Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right leg straight back and up, keeping your hips level.
3. Shift your body forward into a plank position while keeping the right leg lifted.
4. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows close to your sides, maintaining a straight line from head to left heel. Return to the plank position and repeat on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the movement.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body to protect your shoulders.
3. Breathe steadily, inhaling as you lower and exhaling as you push back up.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (Rectus abdominis), Side abdominals (Obliques), Buttocks (Gluteus maximus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a downward-facing dog position with your hands shoulder-width apart and feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right leg straight back and up, keeping your hips level and ensuring your body forms a straight line from your wrists to your raised foot.
3. Hold the position, keeping your core engaged and your leg extended.
4. Lower your right leg back to the floor and return to the plank position. Repeat with the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the movement.
2. Keep your hips squared to the floor to ensure proper alignment.
3. Breathe steadily, inhaling as you lift your leg and exhaling as you lower it.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Shoulders (Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius and Soleus), Core muscles (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
2. Place your hands behind your head, keeping your elbows wide.
3. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, coming up about three-quarters of the way.
4. Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to avoid straining your lower back.
2. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands; use your abdominal muscles to lift your upper body.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift and inhaling as you lower.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Obliques (Internal and External Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent.
2. Keep your hands close in front of your chest with your fists forming a punch and facing forward.
3. Lift your right foot to the back, straightening it sideways and lightly touching the floor when fully extended. While extending both fists frontwards.
4. Bring your right foot back to starting position and both fists close to your chest at starting position and repeat with alternating legs
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your knees slightly bent. This helps absorb the impact and engages your leg muscles more effectively.
2. Maintain a tight core. Engaging your core muscles will help with balance and stability throughout the movement.
3. Use controlled movements. Avoid rushing; perform each step deliberately to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Abductors (Gluteus medius, Tensor fasciae latae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start with feet shoulder-width apart, hands close to your chest.
2. Step your right foot back and to the left, crossing behind your left leg and bending both knees into a curtsy lunge while extending both arms straight to the oposite side in front of yout torso.
3. Return to the starting position by stepping your right foot forward to meet your left foot.
4. Repeat the curtsy lunge the opposite side while straightening both arms on the opposite side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain Balance: Keep your core engaged to help maintain balance throughout the movement.
2. Controlled Movements: Perform each step and curtsy with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Keep Knees Aligned: Ensure your front knee stays aligned with your front foot to avoid unnecessary strain on your knee joint.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Shoulders (Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Inner Thighs (Adductors)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start with feet shoulder-width apart, hands in fists at chest level.
2. Perform four punches in front of you, alternating between left and right hands.
3. Step your right foot out to the side and lower into a squat position, keeping your back straight and knees aligned with your toes.
4. Return to the standing position by stepping your left foot back in, and repeat the exercise.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage Your Core: Keep your core muscles engaged to help with balance and stability during punches and squats.
2. Controlled Movements: Perform punches and squats in a controlled manner to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Keep Knees Aligned: Ensure your knees stay in line with your toes during the squat to avoid unnecessary strain on your knee joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start with feet shoulder-width apart, arms straight in front of your torso.
2. Step your right foot back into a reverse lunge, bending both knees to 90 degrees. Return to the starting position by stepping your right foot forward and repeat 1 time.
3. Return to standing position and perform four side taps by stepping your right foot out to the side and tapping the floor, then bringing it back to the center. Repeat on the other side.
4. Return to starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core muscles engaged to maintain balance and stability during lunges and taps.
2. Perform each lunge and tap with control to maximize muscle activation and minimize injury risk.
3. Ensure your front knee stays aligned with your front foot during lunges to avoid unnecessary strain on your knee joint.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: 45 degree bicycle twist knee to elbow
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Align yourself to 45 degrees to the floor by fixing your left foot into the footrest and supporting your thigh against the padded platform.
2. Place your left hand behind your head and your right hand on your waist.
3. Open your upper leg slightly and bend your knee while bringing your opposite elbow towards it.
4. Return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips pressed on the hyperextension bench to engage your core muscles more effectively and protect your spine.
2. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hand; use your core to lift and twist, keeping your neck in a neutral position.
3. Perform the exercise slowly and deliberately to maximize muscle engagement and reduce the risk of strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Align yourself to 45 degrees to the floor by fixing your left foot into the footrest and supporting your thigh against the padded platform.
2. Place your left hand behind your head and your right hand on your waist.
3. Straighten your upper leg wide and bend your knee while twisting your torso and bringing the opposite elbow towards it.
4. Return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your feet are securely positioned on the hyperextension bench to maintain stability throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your core muscles to lift and twist, avoiding pulling on your neck with your hands.
3. Perform the exercise with controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and reduce the risk of strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise: 45 degree hyperextension (arms in front of chest)_female
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform.
2. Place your arms across your chest and lean forward.
3. Raise yourself by leaning backward and forming an upright position.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maintain proper form and maximize muscle engagement.
2. Avoid hyperextending your back; stop when your body forms a straight line to prevent strain on your lower back.
3. Engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to support your spine and maintain stability.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform.
2. Place your arms across your chest and lean forward.
3. Raise yourself by leaning backward and forming an upright position.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maintain proper form and maximize muscle engagement.
2. Avoid hyperextending your back; stop when your body forms a straight line to prevent strain on your lower back.
3. Engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to support your spine and maintain stability.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place your feet one after the other onto the footrests and support your thigh against the platform.
2. Place your hands behind your head and assume an upright position with a straight back.
3. Crunch your torso toward the platform and then to the other side.
4. Repeat while keeping yourself stable.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a steady and controlled pace to ensure proper form and prevent strain.
2. Focus on using your oblique muscles to lift your upper body, avoiding any jerking or sudden movements.
3. Keep your neck in a neutral position to avoid straining it during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform.
2. Place your hands behind your head and lean forward.
3. Raise yourself by leaning backward and twisting your torso to a side.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the twisting motion smoothly and avoid jerking to prevent strain on your back.
2. Engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain stability and support your spine.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift and twist, and inhaling as you lower back down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Obliques (external and internal obliques)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart keeping them bent to a half squat position.
2. Step your right foot out at a 45-degree angle to the side until your leg is completely straight.
3. Bring your right foot back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left foot, continuing to alternate sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the movement.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes when you step out to protect your joints.
3. Perform the exercise with controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and reduce the risk of injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Hip Abductors (gluteus medius, gluteus minimus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit or stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, maintaining good posture. Make a fist with both hands and place them under your chin.
2. Apply gentle upward pressure with your fist against your chin, resisting with your neck muscles. Hold this position for 5 seconds.
3. Keep your neck and head steady, avoiding any movement while maintaining the pressure.
4. Release the pressure after 5 seconds and relax. Repeat the exercise for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your jaw relaxed, avoiding clenching your teeth.
2. Focus on the resistance created by your fist and neck muscles rather than the amount of force applied.
3. Breathe normally throughout the exercise, avoiding holding your breath.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and your arms extended overhead.
2. Raise your upper back and bring your arms forward to touch your heels.
3. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck relaxed and avoid straining it by using your core muscles to lift your shoulders.
2. Ensure your lower back stays pressed into the mat to engage your core effectively and protect your spine.
3. Perform the exercise with controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and reduce the risk of injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and your arms extended overhead.
2. Raise your upper back and bring your arms forward to touch your heels.
3. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck relaxed and avoid straining it by using your core muscles to lift your shoulders.
2. Ensure your lower back stays pressed into the mat to engage your core effectively and protect your spine.
3. Perform the exercise with controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and reduce the risk of injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with both legs bent at 90 degrees. Position one leg in front of your body with your thigh and shin at a 90-degree angle, and the other leg to the side with your thigh and shin at a 90-degree angle with foot extending backwards.
2. Lean lightly forward keeping your arms on the floor and holding the stretch for a few seconds.
3. Switch the position of your legs to perform the stretch on the opposite side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight as you lean forward to maximize the stretch and avoid straining your lower back.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid bouncing or jerking movements to reduce the risk of injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Rotators (gluteus medius, gluteus minimus, piriformis)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with a yoga mat placed under your lower back, knees bent facing outwards, and feet  on the floor touching together. Hands behind your head.
2. Lean back to lie down, keeping your arms behind your head.
3. Use your core muscles to sit your torso up, return to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core muscles throughout the movement to maximize effectiveness and protect your lower back.
2. Avoid using momentum by performing the movement slowly and with control.
3. Keep your feet on the floor and your knees stable to maintain proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by hanging on a dip station, holding the parallel bars with your arms extended and your body straight.
2. Lift your knees towards your chest while lightly extending your hips backward, engaging your core muscles.
3. Extend your legs back downwards to starting position.
4. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to maintain control and stability.
2. Perform the movement slowly and deliberately to avoid using momentum and maximize muscle engagement.
3. Keep your upper body stable and avoid swinging to ensure proper form.

Exercise: AB Wheel All The Way out
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by kneeling on a mat with the ab wheel placed on the floor in front of you, holding it with both hands. Ensure your arms are extended and your back is straight.
2. Roll the ab wheel forward, extending your body into a straight line while keeping your core engaged and your hips slightly extended backward.
3. Roll the ab wheel back to the starting position, using your core muscles to control the movement and maintain stability.
4. Repeat the movement, extending fully and returning to the starting position each time.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core muscles engaged throughout the exercise to protect your lower back and maintain stability.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding using momentum to maximize muscle engagement.
3. Ensure your hips are slightly extended backward when rolling out to maintain proper form and prevent lower back strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by kneeling on a mat with the ab wheel placed on the floor in front of you, holding it with both hands. Ensure your arms are extended and your back is straight.
2. Roll the ab wheel forward and to the left, extending your body into a partial straight line while keeping your core engaged and your hips slightly extended backward.
3. Roll the ab wheel back to the starting position, using your core muscles to control the movement and maintain stability.
4. Repeat the movement, rolling out to the left and returning to the starting position each time.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid overextending and roll out only as far as you can maintain control. Overextending can place unnecessary strain on your lower back and shoulders.
2. Breathe steadily. Inhale as you roll out and exhale as you roll back in. Proper breathing helps maintain core engagement and stability.
3. Ensure your hips are slightly extended backward when rolling out to maintain proper form and prevent lower back strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

3. Roll the ab wheel back to the starting position, using your core muscles to control the movement and maintain stability.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by kneeling on a mat with the ab wheel placed on the floor in front of you, holding it with both hands. Ensure your arms are extended and your back is straight.
2. Roll the ab wheel forward until your body is in a plank position, with your arms extended and your body forming a straight line from head to knees.
3. Hold the plank position, keeping your core engaged and your body stable, as long as required.
4. Roll the ab wheel back to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your spine neutral and avoid letting your lower back sag. This helps protect your spine and ensures proper form.
2. Focus on engaging your entire core, including your abdominals, obliques, and lower back, to maintain stability.
3. Roll out and back in with controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and minimize the risk of injury.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by lying on the floor with your arms extended overhead, holding the ab wheel with both hands.
2. Engage your core by lifting your upper body off the floor slightly, performing a small crunch while keeping your arms extended and the ab wheel overhead.
3. Perform small pulsing crunches, lifting and lowering your upper body slightly while maintaining tension in your core.
4. Continue the pulsing movement for the desired number of repetitions, keeping your arms extended and the ab wheel steady.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements small and controlled to maintain tension on your core muscles.
2. Focus on maintaining a neutral spine and avoiding any strain on your neck by using your core to lift your upper body.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift into the crunch and inhaling as you lower back down.

Exercise: AB Wheel Take it or Leave It
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs bent at 90 degrees and your feet off the floor, forming a tabletop position. Hold the AB wheel overhead with both hands, keeping your arms straight.
2. Engage your core and lift your chest towards your knees to perform a crunch, bringing the AB wheel towards your shins.
3. Place the AB wheel gently on your shins and lower your upper body back to the floor, keeping your legs in the tabletop position.
4. Perform another crunch, reaching up to grab the AB wheel from your shins, and then lower your upper body back to the floor. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your legs remain bent at 90 degrees and your shins stay parallel to the floor throughout the exercise.
2. Avoid using momentum to lift your upper body; focus on using your abdominal muscles.
3. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and reduce discomfort.

2. Engage your core and lift your chest towards your knees to perform a crunch, bringing the AB wheel towards your shins.
3. Place the AB wheel gently on your shins and lower your upper body back to the floor, keeping your legs in the tabletop position.
4. Perform another crunch, reaching up to grab the AB wheel from your shins, and then lower your upper body back to the floor. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your legs remain bent at 90 degrees and your shins stay parallel to the floor throughout the exercise.
2. Avoid using momentum to lift your upper body; focus on using your abdominal muscles.
3. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and reduce discomfort.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with knees slightly bent, feet placed on the floor and arms raised to the shoulder height.
2. Squeeze your abdominals and lift your upper back off the floor, reaching forward with your arms
3. Hold for few seconds and slowly return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck relaxed and avoid pulling on it with your hands to prevent strain.
2. Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the movement to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift into the crunch and inhaling as you lower back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Adjust the seat and resistance to your desired settings on the abdominal crunch machine. Sit on the seat and position your feet securely on the footrests.
2. Grab the handles, ensuring your elbows are pointed forward.
3. Engage your core muscles and crunch your abdominals by pulling your upper body forward and curling your chest towards your knees.
4. Hold the crunch for a second, then slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you crunch forward and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Avoid using momentum; focus on engaging your abdominal muscles throughout the exercise.
3. Ensure your lower back remains in contact with the backrest of the machine.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and feet placed on the floor.
2. Inhale and try reaching forward with straight arms while lifting your upper back off the floor.                                                                   3. Hold the end position for few seconds and slowly return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck relaxed and avoid pulling on it with your hands to prevent strain.
2. Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the movement to maximize effectiveness.
3. Hold the crunch position for a count of two to five seconds to increase muscle activation and endurance.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and drawn towards your chest.
2. Wrap your arms around your knees, hugging them tightly.
3. Hold the stretch in this position, allowing your back to round slightly and your head to relax forward.
4. After holding the stretch for the desired amount of time, release your arms and return to a neutral sitting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid hunching them up towards your ears.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid any sudden movements to prevent strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and drawn towards your chest.
2. Place your hands on your knees keeping them set and lean your chest to your knees to stretch.
3. Hold the stretch in this position, allowing your back to round slightly and your head to relax forward.
4. After holding the stretch for the desired amount of time, release your arms and return to a neutral sitting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid hunching them up towards your ears.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid any sudden movements to prevent strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight. Raise your arms overhead and clasp your hands together with elbows bent.
2. Keeping your hands clasped, bring your elbows backward to stretch.
3. Hold the stretch in this position, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
4. After holding the stretch for the desired amount of time, return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid hunching them up towards your ears.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Maintain a straight back and engaged core to ensure proper form and maximize the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight. Raise your arms overhead and clasp your hands together with elbows bent.
2. Keeping your hands clasped, bring your elbows backward to stretch.
3. Hold the stretch in this position, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
4. After holding the stretch for the desired amount of time, return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid hunching them up towards your ears.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Maintain a straight back and engaged core to ensure proper form and maximize the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back straight. Raise one arm to shoulder height and bring it across your chest.
2. Use your opposite hand to grasp your upper arm and gently pull it towards your chest, stretching your shoulder.
3. Hold the stretch in this position.
4. Release your arm and repeat the movement on the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid hunching them up towards your ears.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
3. Maintain a straight back and avoid twisting your torso to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a mat with both legs extended upwards.
2. Open your legs wide apart, stretching your inner thighs.
3. Bring your legs back together to the starting position.
4. Continue the movement in a dynamic manner, opening and closing your legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and control throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement with controlled and smooth transitions to maximize the stretch and prevent injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you open your legs and inhaling as you bring them back together.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a mat with both legs extended upwards.
2. Open your legs wide apart, stretching your inner thighs.
3. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, or as needed.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and control throughout the stretch.
2. Focus on maintaining a steady breathing pattern, inhaling deeply through your nose and exhaling through your mouth while holding the stretch.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid any sudden movements to prevent strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart while keeping your hands together in front of your chest.
2. Take a step to the left while keeping your right foot in place.
3. Bend the left knee unless your right thigh becomes parallel to the floor.
4. Hold for a few seconds, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the stretch.
2. Ensure your bent knee does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid any sudden movements to prevent strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus medius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a mat with both legs extended upwards.
2. Open your legs wide apart, stretching your inner thighs.
3. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, or as needed.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and control throughout the stretch.
2. Focus on maintaining a steady breathing pattern, inhaling deeply through your nose and exhaling through your mouth while holding the stretch.
3. Perform the stretch slowly and avoid any sudden movements to prevent strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
2. Lift your shoulders off the floor, engaging your core.
3. Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg straight.
4. Switch sides, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg straight. Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding the use of momentum to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you twist and bring your elbow to your knee, and inhaling as you switch sides.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
2. Lift your shoulders off the floor, engaging your core.
3. Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg lightly.
4. Switch sides, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg lightly. Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding the use of momentum to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you twist and bring your elbow to your knee, and inhaling as you switch sides.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your hands behind your head and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
2. Lift your back off the floor, engaging your core.
3. Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while extending your right leg slightly.
4. Lower your back to the floor and repeat, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while extending your left leg lightly.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding the use of momentum to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you twist and bring your elbow to your knee, and inhaling as you switch sides.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Make fists of your hands, fold one arm at your side and extend the other arm overhead.
3. Raise one of your thighs while bending your knee, and lower your arm while extending the other arm overhead.
4. Return to the initial position and repeat by raising your other thigh.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the movements with controlled, deliberate motions to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you punch upwards and inhaling as you bring your arm back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Chest (pectoralis major)

Exercise: Air Swing Side To Side Swing
Air Swing Side To Side Swing Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and heels on the floor.
2. Place your hands behind your head.
3. Raise your chest and twist your torso to one side while bringing the opposite knee close.
4. Return to the initial position and repeat by twisting towards the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding the use of momentum to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you twist and bring your elbow to your knee, and inhaling as you switch sides.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and heels on the floor.
2. Place your hands behind your head.
3. Raise your chest and twist your torso to one side while bringing the opposite knee close.
4. Return to the initial position and repeat by twisting towards the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control, avoiding the use of momentum to maximize effectiveness.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you twist and bring your elbow to your knee, and inhaling as you switch sides.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in an all-fours position on a mat, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Reach back with your right hand to grasp the ankle of your right leg.
3. Gently pull your ankle towards your glutes, stretching your quadriceps, and hold the stretch in this position for 20-30 seconds.
4. Release your ankle and switch sides, repeating the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the stretch.
2. Avoid arching your back; maintain a neutral spine to protect your lower back.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in an all-fours position on a mat, with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Reach back with your right hand to grasp the ankle of your right leg.
3. Gently pull your ankle towards your glutes, stretching your quadriceps, and hold the stretch in this position for 20-30 seconds.
4. Release your ankle and switch sides, repeating the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the stretch.
2. Avoid arching your back; maintain a neutral spine to protect your lower back.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously, extending them straight out while maintaining balance. Hold briefly, then lower back to the plank position.
3. Lift your left arm and right leg simultaneously, extending them straight out and holding briefly before returning to the plank position.
4. Continue alternating sides, lifting opposite arms and legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and maintain balance.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your arm and leg and inhaling as you lower them back to the plank position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Shoulders (deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (latissimus dorsi, erector spinae), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1.  Start in a plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously, extending them straight out while maintaining balance. Hold this position for a brief period of 1-2 seconds.
3. Lower your right arm and left leg back to the plank position.
4. Lift your left arm and right leg simultaneously, extending them straight out and holding for a brief period of 1-2 seconds before returning to the plank position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and maintain balance.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your arm and leg and inhaling as you hold the position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Shoulders (deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (latissimus dorsi, erector spinae), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise: Alternate arm leg plank rest pause
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1.Start in a plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously, extending them straight out while maintaining balance. Then lower back to the plank position and pause for a few seconds.
3. Lift your left arm and right leg simultaneously, extending them straight out and return to the plank position and pause for a few seconds.
4. Continue alternating sides, lifting opposite arms and legs with a brief pause in the plank position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and maintain balance.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your arm and leg and inhaling as you pause in the plank position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Shoulders (deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus
Secondary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (latissimus dorsi, erector spinae), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the center of a resistance band with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the handles of the resistance band with your arms fully extended by your sides, palms facing forward.
3. Raise one of the handles towards your shoulder by bending your arm.
4. As it reaches near the shoulder, return to the initial position and repeat by folding your other arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Adjust the resistance band length to increase or decrease the resistance as needed if possible.
2. Ensure you maintain even tension on the band throughout the entire range of motion.
3. Keep your wrists neutral and avoid bending them during the curls.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides. Your palms should face forward (supinated grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right dumbbell up towards your shoulder, maintaining the forward-facing position of your palms.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your elbows stay close to your torso and avoid swinging your arms to lift the weights.
2. Move your arms slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Focus on fully extending your arms at the bottom of each curl to engage the full range of motion.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and arms bent by your sides.
2. Jump lightly and lift your right leg and extend it forward in a kicking motion while simultaneously swing your left arm forward.
3. Lower your right leg and left arm back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement by alternating front kicks with each leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Lift your leg smoothly and avoid swinging it to maintain better control.
2. Perform the kicks with controlled movements to avoid using momentum and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Maintain an upright posture, avoiding leaning back as you kick.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides. Your palms should face each other (neutral grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right dumbbell up towards your shoulder, maintaining the neutral grip with your palm facing inward.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your wrists straight to avoid putting unnecessary strain on them during the curls.
2. Maintain a controlled pace to ensure that you're using muscle strength rather than momentum.
3. Visualize the bicep contraction to enhance the mind-muscle connection for better results.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides. Your palms should face each other (neutral grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right dumbbell up towards your shoulder, maintaining the neutral grip with your palm facing inward.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your wrists straight to avoid putting unnecessary strain on them during the curls.
2. Maintain a controlled pace to ensure that you're using muscle strength rather than momentum.
3. Keep your back straight and shoulders back to maintain proper posture.

Exercise: Alternate heel touch side kick squat
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Lower your hips by bending one of your knees while sliding the opposite leg outward on the floor, and touch your heel with your hands.
3. Return to the initial position, and do the same while bending your other knee and sliding the opposite leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your knees do not extend past your toes when squatting to protect your joints.
3. Perform the side leg slides with controlled movements to maintain proper form and avoid injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus), Abductors (gluteus medius, gluteus minimus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Lift your shoulders slightly off the floor, engaging your core.
2. Reach your right hand towards your right heel, then return to the center position.
3. Reach your left hand towards your left heel. Continue alternating sides in this manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders off the mat and your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize effectiveness.
2. Focus on using your oblique muscles to reach towards your heels rather than using your arms.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maintain proper form and maximize muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight at 45 degrees off the floor and your arms extended overhead in line with your torso.
2. Lift your shoulders off the mat, engaging your core, and simultaneously bring your right knee towards your chest while swinging both arms in an arc motion until parallel to the floor.
3. Straighten your right leg, and lower your arms and shoulders back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg, bringing it towards your chest between your straight arms. Continue alternating sides in this manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to avoid using momentum and ensure proper form.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you crunch and bring your leg towards your chest and inhaling as you lower back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight just off the floor and your arms extended overhead in line with your torso.
2. Lift your shoulders off the mat, engaging your core, and simultaneously bring your right knee towards your chest while swinging both arms in a circular motion until parallel to the floor.
3. Lower your right leg, arms and shoulders back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg, bringing it towards your chest between your straight arms. Continue alternating sides in this manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to avoid using momentum and ensure proper form.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you crunch and bring your leg towards your chest and inhaling as you lower back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side.
2. Raise your legs straight in the air, making a 90-degree angle with your torso.
3. Lower one of your legs and bring it back just before touching the floor.
4. Do the same with your other leg, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your leg and inhaling as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Alternate leg raise from reverse plank position
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your hips with your arms resting on the floor by your side and your legs extended forward.
2. Raise your upper back, bring your elbows under the shoulders, and bear weight on your forearms with your palms down.
3. Alternately raise and lower your legs to your maximum range while keeping them straight.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on maintaining a straight line with your body, avoiding any sagging or arching of the back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your leg and inhaling as you lower it back down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus)

Exercise: Alternate leg raise with head up
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side.
2. Raise your head and upper back off the floor, and lift your legs straight in the air, making a 90-degree angle with your torso.
3. Lower one of your legs and bring it back just before touching the floor.
4. Do the same with your other leg, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you lift your leg and inhaling as you lower it back down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

1. Lie down on your back with your arms resting on the floor by your side.
