Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight and your arms resting by your sides.
2. Lift both legs, straight towards the ceiling until they go past your hips.
3. Lower your legs halfway down, then lift them back up towards the ceiling.
4. Lower your legs back down to the initial position. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your upper back pressed into the mat to avoid arching and straining your spine.
2. Use your breath to guide the movement: inhale as you lift your legs and exhale as you lower them.
3. Engage your thigh muscles to assist with the lift and ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight and your arms resting by your sides.
2. Lift both legs, straight towards the ceiling until they go past your hips.
3. Lower your legs halfway down, then lift them back up towards the ceiling.
4. Lower your legs back down to the initial position. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your upper back pressed into the mat to avoid arching and straining your spine.
2. Use your breath to guide the movement: inhale as you lift your legs and exhale as you lower them.
3. Engage your thigh muscles to assist with the lift and ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet on the floor.
2. Place your right hand behind your head and your left hand on the floor for support.
3. Raise and twist your chest to your left and bring your right elbow towards the left knee.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your oblique muscles to twist your torso rather than pulling on your neck with your hands.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your lower back remains pressed into the mat to protect your spine.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back and fold your knees while keeping your feet on the floor.
2. Place your right hand behind your head.
3. Raise and twist your chest to your left and bring your right elbow towards the left knee.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your oblique muscles to twist your torso rather than pulling on your neck with your hands.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your lower back remains pressed into the mat to protect your spine.
Primary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Abdominals (rectus abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands held up in a guard position near your chest.
2. Punch forward with your right arm, rotating your upper torso slightly.
3. Return your right hand to the guard position and punch forward with your left arm, again rotating your upper torso slightly.
4. Continue alternating punches in a rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on snapping your punches out quickly and returning your hands to the guard position to maintain proper form.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knees to absorb the impact and enhance stability.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Upper Back (trapezius, rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands held up in a guard position near your chest.
2. Punch forward with your right arm, rotating your upper torso slightly.
3. Return your right hand to the guard position and punch forward with your left arm, again rotating your upper torso slightly.
4. Continue alternating punches in a rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on snapping your punches out quickly and returning your hands to the guard position to maintain proper form.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knees to absorb the impact and enhance stability.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Upper Back (trapezius, rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right leg off the floor, extending it straight back while maintaining the plank position. Hold briefly.
3. Lower your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Lift your left leg off the floor, extending it straight back. Hold briefly before lowering it back to the starting position. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels, avoiding any arching or rounding of your back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, transverse abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right leg off the floor, extending it straight back while maintaining the plank position. Hold briefly.
3. Lower your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Lift your left leg off the floor, extending it straight back. Hold briefly before lowering it back to the starting position. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels, avoiding any arching or rounding of your back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, transverse abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart.
2. Lunge back with your right leg, bending both knees to lower your body into a lunge position while reaching your hands towards your left foot.
3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position.
4. Lunge back with your left leg, reaching your hands towards your right foot. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart.
2. Lunge back with your right leg, bending both knees to lower your body into a lunge position while reaching your hands towards your left foot.
3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting position.
4. Lunge back with your left leg, reaching your hands towards your right foot. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on a mat with your arms extended straight in front of you and your legs extended straight back.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously off the floor, engaging your back muscles. Hold briefly.
3. Lower your right arm and left leg back to the mat.
4. Lift your left arm and right leg simultaneously off the floor, holding briefly before lowering them back to the mat. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent your lower back from arching excessively.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on lifting your arm and leg to the same height to maintain balance and symmetry.
Primary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (erector spinae, latissimus dorsi), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor.
2. Raise your torso off the floor by placing your elbows on the floor and raise one of your knees toward the chest while keeping your knee bent.
3. Lower your foot back to the floor while raising your other knee towards your chest.
4. Keep repeating by alternately moving your knees towards and away from the chest.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on maintaining the bend in your knees and tapping the floor lightly to ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet on the floor.
2. Raise your torso off the floor by placing your elbows on the floor and raise one of your knees toward the chest while keeping your knee bent.
3. Lower your foot back to the floor while raising your other knee towards your chest.
4. Keep repeating by alternately moving your knees towards and away from the chest.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on maintaining the bend in your knees and tapping the floor lightly to ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides. Your palms should face forward (supinated grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right dumbbell up towards your shoulder, maintaining the supinated grip with your palm facing upward.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Visualize the bicep contraction to enhance the mind-muscle connection for better results.
2. Ensure your movements are symmetrical to avoid muscle imbalances; focus equally on both arms.
3. Use a weight that allows you to perform the exercise with proper form and control throughout all repetitions.

Exercise: alternating biceps hammer curls resistance band
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, standing on the middle of a resistance band. Hold the handles of the band with your palms facing each other (neutral grip) and arms fully extended by your sides.
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right handle up towards your shoulder, maintaining the neutral grip with your palm facing inward.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the handle back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and shoulders back to maintain proper posture.
2. Visualize the bicep contraction to enhance the mind-muscle connection for better results.
3. Use a resistance band with appropriate tension to perform the exercise with proper form and control throughout all repetitions.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended by your sides. Your palms should face each other (neutral grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl the right dumbbell up towards your shoulder, maintaining the neutral grip with your palm facing inward.
3. Squeeze your bicep at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the same motion with your left arm, alternating between right and left arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid swinging your arms to ensure that the movement is controlled and targets the biceps effectively.
2. Keep your movements steady and controlled to maximize muscle engagement and minimize risk of injury.
3. Ensure your elbows stay close to your torso to focus the effort on your biceps.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping both arms bent by your sides. 
2. Shift your weight onto your left leg and bend your right knee, bringing your heel towards your glutes, squeezing your hamstring at the top of the movement.
3. Slowly lower your right leg back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg. Alternate between right and left legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
2. Ensure your knees stay aligned and avoid twisting your hips.
3. Use a full range of motion, bringing your heel as close to your glutes as possible.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms bent at a 90-degree angle with fists close to your chest.
2. Curl your right leg back, bringing your heel towards your glutes while simultaneously punching forward with your left arm.
3. Lower your right leg and return your left arm to the starting position.
4. Curl your left leg back, bringing your heel towards your glutes while punching forward with your right arm. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your hamstrings and glutes as you curl your leg to enhance muscle activation.
2. Keep a steady rhythm to ensure both sides of your body are working evenly.
3. Maintain a strong and upright posture to avoid unnecessary strain on your back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Chest (pectoralis major), Triceps (triceps brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms bent at a 90-degree angle with fists close to your chest.
2. Curl your right leg back, bringing your heel towards your glutes while simultaneously punching forward with your left arm.
3. Lower your right leg and return your left arm to the starting position.
4. Curl your left leg back, bringing your heel towards your glutes while punching forward with your right arm. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your hamstrings and glutes as you curl your leg to enhance muscle activation.
2. Keep a steady rhythm to ensure both sides of your body are working evenly.
3. Maintain a strong and upright posture to avoid unnecessary strain on your back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Chest (pectoralis major), Triceps (triceps brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a downward dog position with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted towards the ceiling, and body forming an inverted V shape.
2. Bend your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot on the floor and maintaining balance on your left foot and both hands.
3. Straighten your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Bend your left knee towards your chest while maintaining balance. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and balance throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on keeping your hips squared and aligned with the mat to avoid twisting your body.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (gastrocnemius, soleus), Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a downward dog position with your hands and feet on the mat, hips lifted towards the ceiling, and body forming an inverted V shape.
2. Bend your right knee towards your chest, keeping your foot on the floor and maintaining balance on your left foot and both hands.
3. Straighten your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Bend your left knee towards your chest while maintaining balance. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and balance throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on keeping your hips squared and aligned with the mat to avoid twisting your body.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (gastrocnemius, soleus), Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your legs straight and hands behind your head.
2. Raise one of your legs straight towards the ceiling without bending your knee.
3. Slowly lower your leg back towards the floor and simultaneously raise the other leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your lower back pressed into the mat to maintain proper alignment and avoid strain.
2. Use a controlled breathing pattern: inhale as you lift your leg and exhale as you lower it.
3. Engage your thigh muscles to assist with the lift and maintain straight legs throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Step your right foot forward, placing it outside your right hand, and rotate your torso to the right, extending your right arm towards the ceiling.
3. Return your right hand and foot to the plank position.
4. Step your left foot forward, placing it outside your left hand, and rotate your torso to the left, extending your left arm towards the ceiling. Return to the plank position. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and proper alignment throughout the movement.
2. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Triceps (triceps brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands lightly behind your head with your elbows pointing outward.
2. Lift your shoulders off the mat and twist your torso to bring your right elbow towards your left knee.
3. Lower your shoulders back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maximize muscle activation and protect your lower back.
2. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands to prevent strain; use your core muscles to lift and twist your torso.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to ensure proper form and maximize effectiveness.
Primary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Abdominals (rectus abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Step your right foot forward outside your right hand, bringing your body into a low lunge position.
3. Return your right foot to the plank position.
4. Step your left foot forward outside your left hand, bringing your body into a low lunge position. Return your left foot to the plank position. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and proper alignment.
2. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Obliques (external and internal obliques), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your knees slightly and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
3. Lift one of your feet off the floor and step to your side.
4. Return to the initial position and do the same with your other foot. Repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your upper body upright and avoid leaning too far forward or backward.
2. Use a steady pace to maintain a rhythm, which will help with coordination and balance.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you step out and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (gluteus medius, gluteus minimus), Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your knees slightly and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
3. Lift one of your feet off the floor and step to your side.
4. Return to the initial position and do the same with your other foot. Repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your upper body upright and avoid leaning too far forward or backward.
2. Use a steady pace to maintain a rhythm, which will help with coordination and balance.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you step out and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (gluteus medius, gluteus minimus), Adductors (adductor longus, adductor brevis, adductor magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on a mat with your arms extended straight in front of you and your legs extended straight behind you.
2. Lift your right arm and left leg simultaneously off the floor, engaging your core and back muscles. Hold briefly.
3. Lower your right arm and left leg back to the mat.
4. Lift your left arm and right leg simultaneously off the floor, holding briefly before lowering them back to the mat. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Focus on lifting your arm and leg to the same height to maintain balance and symmetry.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (erector spinae, latissimus dorsi), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight on the floor and your arms resting by your sides.
2. Simultaneously lift your right leg and left arm towards the ceiling, trying to touch your toe with your hand.
3. Lower your right leg and left arm back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg and right arm, lifting them towards the ceiling and trying to touch your toe with your hand. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Keep your legs straight and avoid bending your knees to ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (rectus abdominis), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands resting on your hips or at your sides for balance.
2. Flex both feet simultaneously, bringing your toes towards your shins, and then return to the starting position.
3. Repeat the movement, flexing and relaxing both feet simultaneously.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on the movement of your ankles and avoid using your leg muscles to assist.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands resting on your hips or at your sides for balance..
2. Rise onto your toes, lifting your heels off the floor.
3. Lower your heels back to the starting position. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your knees slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints and enhance stability.
2. Use a mirror to check your form and ensure that your ankles are aligned properly.
3. Focus on maintaining a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you rise and inhaling as you lower.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hands at your hips.
2. Lift your right foot off the floor slightly and rotate your ankle in a circular motion, making small controlled circles.
3. After a set number of rotations, switch direction and rotate your ankle in the opposite direction.
4. Repeat the movement with your left ankle, rotating in both directions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your leg remains still and only your ankle is moving to focus on the targeted muscles.
3. Perform the exercise for an equal amount of time or repetitions in both directions to ensure balanced muscle development.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, hands at your hips.
2. Lift your right foot off the floor slightly and rotate your ankle in a circular motion, making small controlled circles.
3. After a set number of rotations, switch direction and rotate your ankle in the opposite direction.
4. Repeat the movement with your left ankle, rotating in both directions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your leg remains still and only your ankle is moving to focus on the targeted muscles.
3. Perform the exercise for an equal amount of time or repetitions in both directions to ensure balanced muscle development.

3. Repeat the movement, flexing and relaxing both feet simultaneously.

2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on the movement of your ankles and avoid using your leg muscles to assist.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands resting on your hips or at your sides for balance..
2. Rise onto your toes, lifting your heels off the floor.
3. Lower your heels back to the starting position. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your knees slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints and enhance stability.
2. Use a mirror to check your form and ensure that your ankles are aligned properly.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands positioned wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull yourself up towards the bar while simultaneously shifting your body to the right, bringing your chest closer to your right hand.
3. Lower yourself back to the starting position.
4. Pull yourself up again, this time shifting your body to the left, bringing your chest closer to your left hand. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your back muscles rather than relying solely on your arms for the pull-up.
2. Keep your elbows slightly bent throughout the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Ensure a full range of motion by fully extending your arms at the bottom of each rep and bringing your chest close to the bar at the top.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bend your right elbow to lower your chest towards your right hand while keeping your left arm extended straight to the side.
3. Push back up to the starting position.
4. Bend your left elbow to lower your chest towards your left hand while keeping your right arm extended straight to the side. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your shoulders and hips stay level to avoid any imbalance during the movement.
2. Use a slow and steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower down.
3. Keep your gaze slightly forward to maintain a neutral spine and avoid neck strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands placed wider than shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bend your right elbow to lower your chest towards your right hand while keeping your left arm extended straight to the side.
3. Push back up to the starting position.
4. Bend your left elbow to lower your chest towards your left hand while keeping your right arm extended straight to the side. Continue alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your shoulders and hips stay level to avoid any imbalance during the movement.
2. Use a slow and steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower down.
3. Keep your gaze slightly forward to maintain a neutral spine and avoid neck strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your arms forward while keeping your palms inward.
3. Take a step backward by extending your left leg behind you while taking your elbow past your back like an archer.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by taking your right leg backward.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement with controlled motions to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your arms forward while keeping your palms inward.
3. Take a step backward by extending your left leg behind you while taking your elbow past your back like an archer.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat by taking your right leg backward.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
3. Perform the movement with controlled motions to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Shoulders (deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Obliques (external and internal obliques), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight to your sides.
2. Begin by making circular motions with your arms, moving them forward in a controlled manner.
3. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and balance throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Keep your arms straight and focus on making smooth, controlled circles to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight to your sides.
2. Begin by making circular motions with your arms, moving them backward in a controlled manner.
3. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and balance throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Keep your arms straight and focus on making smooth, controlled circles to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing the floor.
2. Bring your arms forward and cross them in front of your chest.
3. Return your arms to the starting position, extending them out to the sides.
4. Continue crossing your arms in front of your chest and extending them back out to the sides in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture to avoid straining your back and neck.
2. Use a consistent pace to help coordinate your movements and keep them fluid.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you cross your arms and inhaling as you extend them back out.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height, elbows bent and palms facing the floor.
2. Bring your arms forward while straightening them and cross them in front of your chest twice.
3. Return your arms to the starting position, extending them out to the sides and bringing your chest forward.
4. Continue crossing your arms in front of your chest and extending them back out to the sides in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed to avoid unnecessary tension in your neck and upper back.
2. Use a mirror to ensure your movements are symmetrical and maintain proper form.
3. Breathe deeply, exhaling as you cross your arms and inhale as you extend them back out.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height, elbows bent and palms facing the floor.
2. Bring your arms forward while keeping them bent and cross them in front of your chest twice.
3. Return your arms to the starting position, extending them out to the sides.
4. Continue crossing your arms in front of your chest and extending them back out to the sides in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements smooth and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
2. Alternate which arm crosses over the other each time to ensure balanced muscle engagement.
3. Maintain an upright posture and engage your core to support your back and maintain balance.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your arms to make a 90-degree angle with the elbows while keeping your palms facing inward.
3. Tighten your upper arms and move your arms forward and backward in a pulse-like fashion.
4. Keep doing this activity for a suitable time.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your back throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your movements small and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on keeping your shoulders relaxed and avoid tensing your neck and upper back.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bring your forearms forward with your palms facing the floor and make a 90-degree angle with your upper arms.
3. Tighten your upper arms and move your hands towards each other.
4. As your one hand comes over the other one, return to the initial position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your back throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your movements small and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on maintaining an even rhythm and alternating the crossover to ensure balanced muscle engagement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms bent at the elbows, with your forearms parallel to the floor and palms facing upwards.
2. Perform small, quick pulses by moving your forearms forward and backward, maintaining the position and height.
3. Continue pulsing in a controlled, rhythmic manner for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your back throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid tensing your neck and upper back.
3. Focus on maintaining a consistent pace and range of motion to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms bent at the elbows, with your forearms parallel to the floor and palms facing downwards.
2. Perform small, quick pulses by moving your forearms forward and backward, maintaining the position and height.
3. Continue pulsing in a controlled, rhythmic manner for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your back throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your shoulders relaxed and avoid tensing your neck and upper back.
3. Focus on maintaining a consistent pace and range of motion to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Fold your arms at your sides and make fists with your hands near your chest.
3. Raise your right knee while rotating your torso to the left side and back to the right side.
4. Return to the initial position and repeat by raising your other knee.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on lifting your knee high to fully engage your hip flexors.
2. Use your oblique muscles to initiate the twist, enhancing the rotational movement.
3. Maintain an even pace to ensure both sides of your body are working evenly.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Obliques (external and internal obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder level, palms facing forward.
2. Swing your arms forward until they meet and cross together in front of you in a hugging motion.
3. Swing your arms back to the starting position.
4. Continue swinging your arms forward and back in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your arms at shoulder level to ensure proper form and muscle activation.
2. Engage your core to maintain stability and control throughout the movement.
3. Focus on smooth, controlled movements to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise and avoid injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, with your right arm extended straight out to the side at shoulder height and palm facing upwards and your left hand resting on your hip.
2. Bend your right arm at the elbow, bringing your hand down towards your lower back.
3. Return your right arm to the extended position.
4. Continue the movement with the same arm for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your shoulder relaxed to avoid tension in your neck and upper back.
2. Maintain a steady rhythm to ensure consistent movement and effective muscle engagement.
3. Use a mirror, if available, to check your form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin on your knees, spread wide and feet touching, with your elbows on the floor, directly under your shoulders.
2. Place your hands on your shoulders, with your head positioned between your elbows close to the floor.
3. Gently lower your chest towards the floor, keeping your hips over your knees and your back straight.
4. Hold the stretch briefly, then return to the starting position. Repeat the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your lower back throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on lowering your chest towards the floor to maximize the stretch in your shoulders and upper back.
3. Keep the stretch at least between 15-20 seconds to make the most out of it.

Exercise: arms behind back shoulder flexor stretch
Arms behind back shoulder flexor stretch
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Bring both arms behind your back. Set your forearms parallel to the floor, crossing one over the other to stretch your shoulders.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your shoulders. Return to the starting position and repeat as needed.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders down and away from your ears to avoid unnecessary tension in your neck.
2. Use gentle pressure when crossing your arms behind your back to deepen the stretch gradually.
3. Ensure your upper body is relaxed and avoid forcing the stretch to prevent discomfort or injury.

Exercise: Arms Lateral Raise And Rotation Up
Arms Lateral Raise And Rotation Up_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your right arm straight up overhead and your left arm straight down by your side.
2. Simultaneously lower your right arm while raising your left arm, keeping both arms straight, until your right arm is down by your side and your left arm is overhead.
3. Continue alternating the arms in a controlled, rhythmic swinging motion, moving one arm up while the other moves down.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements smooth and rhythmic to enhance coordination and balance.
2. Use a steady breathing pattern, inhaling as you raise an arm and exhaling as you lower it.
3. Focus on extending through your fingertips to fully engage your shoulder and upper back muscles.

Exercise: Arnold press cable Resistance band standing
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, in the middle of a resistance band.
2. Hold the band handles with your arms bent close to your chest and palms facing back.
3. Push the handles up, while rotating your arms and hands to look forward, and extending your arms overhead.
4. Return to the initial position by reversing the movement and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press the band overhead and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Use a resistance band with appropriate tension to ensure you can perform the exercise with good form.
3. Maintain a neutral wrist position to reduce strain on your joints.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Start with your arms bent, palms facing your shoulders, and elbows close to your torso.
2. Press your back against the bench. Begin to press the dumbbells overhead. As you press, rotate your palms so they face forward at the top of the movement.
3. Fully extend your arms at the top, ensuring your biceps are near your ears.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position by rotating your palms back towards your shoulders. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Rotate your wrists smoothly during the pressing and lowering phases to avoid strain.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you press the weights up and inhaling as you lower them back down.
3. Keep your feet firmly planted to provide a stable base of support.
4. Focus on the full range of motion to engage all parts of the shoulder muscles effectively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on a mat with your arms extended straight to your sides and your legs extended straight behind you.
2. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor, holding the Superman position.
3. Move your arms in a circular motion, starting from the initial position, sweeping them around straight forward, and back to the starting position.
4. Continue moving your arms in a controlled, rhythmic manner while maintaining the Superman hold.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core and glutes to maintain stability and support your lower back throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the arm movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on keeping your legs and chest lifted off the floor to maintain the Superman hold.
Primary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (erector spinae, latissimus dorsi), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on a mat with your arms extended straight to your sides and your legs extended straight behind you.
2. Lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor, holding the Superman position.
3. Move your arms in a circular motion, starting from the initial position, sweeping them around straight forward, and back to the starting position.
4. Continue moving your arms in a controlled, rhythmic manner while maintaining the Superman hold.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core and glutes to maintain stability and support your lower back throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the arm movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on keeping your legs and chest lifted off the floor to maintain the Superman hold.
Primary Activating Muscles: Back Muscles (erector spinae, latissimus dorsi), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the Assault AirBike's seat and adjust it to a comfortable height. Place your feet on the pedals and your hands on the handles.
2. Begin pedaling at a moderate pace. Simultaneously, push and pull the handles back and forth in a coordinated motion with your legs.
3. Gradually increase your pedaling speed and the intensity of your arm movements to achieve a fast pace.
4. Continue pedaling and moving the handles at a fast pace for the desired duration or number of intervals.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily and maintain a consistent pace throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on using both your legs and arms to distribute the effort evenly and prevent fatigue.
3. Perform the movement with control to maximize efficiency and reduce injury risk.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Shoulders (Deltoids), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing away from an elevated box and place your right foot on it. Hold onto a stable bar or support in front of you with your right hand. Keep your chest upright and your front foot flat on the floor.
2. Lower your body by bending your front knee and hip until your back knee is close to the floor.
3. Pause for a second at the bottom and push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use the support only for balance, not to pull yourself up.
2. Do not let your front knee travel excessively past your toes to reduce joint stress.
3. Maintain an upright torso to keep the tension on your quads and glutes.

Exercise: Assisted chin up normal width reverse grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Kneel on the platform pad of an assisted chin-up machine and grasp the handles with a reverse grip (palms facing you) at shoulder-width apart.
2. Begin the movement by pulling your body upward until your chin is above the bar.
3. Slowly lower your body back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining proper form throughout the exercise.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid flaring them out.
2. Use an appropriate level of assistance on the machine to ensure you can perform the exercise correctly.
3. Exhale as you pull your body upward and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on a bench with your hands gripping a pull-up bar, palms facing towards you (supinated grip).
2. Use your legs to assist in pulling your body up towards the bar until your chin is above the bar.
3. Lower your body back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Continue the movement in a controlled, rhythmic manner, using the bench for assistance.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your body aligned and avoid swinging to ensure proper form.
2. Use your legs for assistance, but focus on using your arms and back muscles to perform the pull-up.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you pull up and inhaling as you lower yourself down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Biceps (biceps brachii), Back Muscles (latissimus dorsi, rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself on the assisted pull-up machine, placing your knees on the pad and gripping the pull-up bar with a close underhand (supinated) grip. 
2. Pull your body up towards the bar until your chin is above the bar, using the assistance from the machine.
3. Lower your body back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Continue the movement in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body to maximize bicep and back engagement.
2. Focus on using your arms and back muscles to perform the pull-up, with the machine providing just enough assistance to complete the movement.
3. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you pull up and inhaling as you lower yourself down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Biceps (biceps brachii), Back Muscles (latissimus dorsi, rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright while holding onto a sturdy equipment with both hands for balance. Extend one leg straight forward and keep it off the floor while the other leg remains on the floor.
2. Lower yourself slowly by bending the standing leg at the hip and knee, keeping your chest up and your extended leg straight in front of you.
3. Descend until your glutes are close to your heel and then push through the heel of your planted foot to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Lower yourself slowly and avoid collapsing at the bottom of the squat to avoid injury.
2. Extend your non-working leg fully in front of you and keep it parallel to the floor.
3. Use your arms only for assistance, not to pull yourself up or down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on the floor, with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, close together. Have your partner hold your feet, holding them securely for stability.
2. Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
3. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees.
4. Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position with control. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you lift your upper body towards your knees and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Perform the exercise slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and effectiveness.
3. Keep your elbows out to the sides and avoid pulling on your neck with your hands.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a mat with your knees bent and feet secured with a partner holding them down.
2. Place your hands lightly behind your head or cross them over your chest.
3. Engage your core and lift your upper body towards your knees, performing a sit-up.
4. Lower your upper body back down to the starting position, maintaining control throughout the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your abdominal muscles to lift your body, not your momentum.
2. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands to prevent strain; use your core muscles to lift your body.
3. Keep a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you lift and inhaling as you lower your body.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself in a high plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, your feet together, and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Have your partner place a weight plate on your upper back.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, until your chest nearly touches the floor.
3. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, maintaining a controlled and steady movement. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight line from head to heels to ensure proper form.
2. Exhale as you push up and inhale as you lower your body.
3. Ensure the weight plate is securely placed on your upper back for safety.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Core Muscles (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself in a high plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, your feet together, and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Have your partner place a weight plate on your upper back.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, until your chest nearly touches the floor.
3. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position, maintaining a controlled and steady movement. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight line from head to heels to ensure proper form.
2. Exhale as you push up and inhale as you lower your body.
3. Ensure the weight plate is securely placed on your upper back for safety.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Core Muscles (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and use a nearby support (such as a squat cage, wall or a chair) for balance.
2. Swing your right leg forward and backward in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
3. After completing the desired number of swings with your right leg, switch to your left leg and repeat the movement.
4. Focus on smooth and controlled swings, avoiding excessive momentum.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on maintaining a steady rhythm to ensure controlled movements.
2. Ensure your upper body remains upright and avoid leaning forward or backward.
3. Keep your supporting leg slightly bent to enhance balance and reduce strain on your joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus), Quadriceps (quadriceps femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a block with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart and raise your right arm overhead.
2. Bend your right elbow and reach down your back. Use your left hand to gently pull on your right elbow, enhancing the stretch.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
4. Switch arms and repeat the stretch on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and proper posture throughout the stretch.
2. Avoid pulling too hard on your elbow; the stretch should be gentle and not cause pain.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily to help relax your muscles and enhance the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a block with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart and raise your right arm overhead.
2. Bend your right elbow and reach down your back. Use your left hand to gently pull on your right elbow, enhancing the stretch.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
4. Switch arms and repeat the stretch on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and proper posture throughout the stretch.
2. Avoid pulling too hard on your elbow; the stretch should be gentle and not cause pain.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily to help relax your muscles and enhance the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Fix your feet to the footrests and press your thighs against the padded platform.
2. Place your arms across your chest and lean forward.
3. Raise yourself by leaning backward and forming an upright position.
4. Hold for a while, return to the initial position, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maintain proper form and maximize muscle engagement.
2. Avoid hyperextending your back; stop when your body forms a straight line to prevent strain on your lower back.
3. Engage your core muscles throughout the exercise to support your spine and maintain stability.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position your lower abdomen, face down on an exercise ball , with your feet planted firmly on the floor and your legs extended straight.
2. Place your hands lightly behind your head or cross them over your chest.
3. Bend at the waist to lower your upper body over the exercise ball, keeping your back straight.
4. Engage your lower back and glutes to lift your upper body back to the starting position, extending your back fully.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a stable position by keeping your feet firmly planted on the floor.
2. Avoid rounding your back; keep it straight to ensure proper form and prevent injury.
3. Focus on engaging your lower back muscles to lift your torso, not your neck or arms.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position your lower abdomen, face down on an exercise ball , with your feet planted firmly on the floor and your legs extended straight.
2. Place your hands lightly behind your head or cross them over your chest.
3. Bend at the waist to lower your upper body over the exercise ball, keeping your back straight.
4. Engage your lower back and glutes to lift your upper body back to the starting position, extending your back fully.
