1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Extend your left leg backward, toes extended back, and right arm forward simultaneously, keeping your extending arm straight, until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold this position briefly, maintaining balance and stability.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left arm and right leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and prevent your back from sagging.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and improve balance.
3. Focus on keeping your extended arm and leg parallel to the floor to ensure proper form.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Extend your left leg backward, and right arm forward simultaneously, keeping your extending arm straight, until both are slightly higher than torso level.
3. Hold this position briefly, maintaining balance and stability.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left arm and right leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and prevent your back from sagging.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and improve balance.
3. Maintain a neutral spine position by looking down at the floor during the exercise.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lift your legs off the floor, balancing on your buttocks.
3. Extend your arms forward, parallel to the floor, to grab your legs and lean back slightly while keeping your back straight.
4. Hold this position, maintaining balance.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and prevent your lower back from rounding.
2. Keep your chest lifted and shoulders relaxed to ensure proper form.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily to help maintain the stretch and balance.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (rectus abdominis, obliques), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas), Hamstrings (biceps femoris, semitendinosus, semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a forearm plank position, with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Rock your body back by pushing through your forearms, moving your shoulders behind your elbows level.
3. Rock your body forward by pulling with your forearms, moving your shoulders in front of your elbows level.
4. Repeat this controlled forward and backward motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels to maintain proper form.
2. Ensure your movements are slow and deliberate to enhance control and muscle engagement.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you rock forward and inhaling as you rock back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (erector spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and extend your arms straight out at shoulder level.
2. Slide your hips to the left, keeping your upper body and arms steady.
3. Slide your hips to the right, maintaining control and keeping your arms extended.
4. Continue sliding your hips left and right in a controlled motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and prevent your upper body from swaying.
2. Keep your movements smooth and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your knees are slightly bent to allow for greater range of motion in your hips.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Hip Adductors (Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core Muscles (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight and feet shoulder-width apart, lower your hips to knee level, and extend your arms back at your sides.
2. Push through your feet and raise yourself upright while raising your heels and extending your arms overhead.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain balance and proper form.
2. Use the power from your legs and core to drive the movement, ensuring a controlled and explosive upward motion.
3. Breathe out as you extend upwards and breathe in as you return to the squat position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Calves (Gastrocnemius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your torso.
3. Push through your palms to lift your body back up to the starting plank position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips: Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Chest (Pectoralis Major)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise: Bodyweight bent over rear delt fly
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent, until your torso is almost parallel to the floor.
2. Allow your arms to hang straight down from your shoulders.
3. Lift your arms out to the sides until they are in line with your shoulders, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower your arms back down in a controlled manner and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and engage your core to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together as you lift your arms to maximize muscle activation.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to avoid using momentum and to target the rear deltoids effectively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or by your sides for balance.
2. Lift your heels off the floor, rising onto your toes.
3. Hold the top position briefly, squeezing your calf muscles.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor in a controlled manner and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Stand tall with your shoulders back and chest lifted to maintain good posture.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your weight is evenly distributed on your toes to maintain balance and stability.

Exercise: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Figure Four Glute Bridge
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your arms extended by your sides for support. Place one foot on a box and cross the opposite ankle over the thigh of your working leg, forming a figure-four shape.
2. Engage your glutes and squeeze them to lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Pause at the peak of the movement for a second and slowly lower your hips back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders flat on the ground and your head relaxed throughout the movement.
2. Engage your core to prevent arching your lower back.
3. Use your working heel to press into the elevated surface and drive the lift.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Hip Adductors (Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Figure Four Glute Bridge_Female
Bodyweight Feet Elevated Staggered Glute Bridge
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your arms extended by your sides for support. Place both feet on an elevated surface, with one foot flat and the other slightly forward so only the heel rests on the edge.
2. Engage your glutes and squeeze them to lift your hips off the ground until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Pause at the peak of the movement for a second and slowly lower your hips back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders flat on the ground and your head relaxed throughout the movement.
2. Engage your core to prevent arching your lower back.
3. Use your working heel to press into the elevated surface and drive the lift.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Hip Adductors (Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise: Bodyweight Feet Elevated Staggered Glute Bridge_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or by your sides.
2. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body by bending both knees, ensuring your front knee is aligned over your ankle and your back knee is close to the floor.
3. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left foot stepping forward, alternating legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged and your torso upright to maintain balance and proper form.
2. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid putting unnecessary strain on your knee.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and extend your hands overhead.
2. Swing your arms down forcefully in front of your body, as if slamming a medicine ball to the floor, while simultaneously bending your knees into a squat position.
3. Return to the starting position with hands extended overhead.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and control throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your back stays straight and avoid rounding your spine when swinging your arms down.
3. Perform the movement explosively but with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise: bodyweight full squat with overhead front raise
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart, your torso leaning slightly forward, and both arms extended between your thighs.
2. Begin to straighten your legs to rise into a standing position while simultaneously raising both arms straight overhead.
3. Fully extend your legs and arms, standing tall with your arms overhead.
4. Lower your body back into the squat position, bringing your arms back down between your thighs. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement to protect your back and improve stability.
2. Keep your knees aligned with your toes during the squat to avoid putting strain on your knees.
3. Focus on a controlled descent back into the squat to ensure smooth and effective movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Shoulders (Deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight full squat with overhead front raises
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended in close to your knees.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, while simultaneously raising your arms overhead.
3. Stand back up to the starting position, lowering your arms back close to your knees.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back during the exercise to ensure proper form.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Move at a controlled pace, especially when lifting and lowering your arms, to avoid unnecessary strain and enhance muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight full squat with overhead press
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended just in front of your knees.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Stand up from the squat while pressing your hands overhead, extending your arms fully.
4. Lower your hands back down as you descend into the next squat. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a neutral spine and avoid rounding your back during the exercise to ensure proper form.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Avoid locking your elbows when pressing overhead to keep tension on your muscles and protect your joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Shoulders (Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight full squat with overhead press (version 2)
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a squat position with your feet shoulder-width apart, your torso leaning slightly forward, and both hands just in front of your knees.
2. Straighten your legs to rise into a standing position while simultaneously pressing your hands upwards until they are extended overhead.
3. Fully extend your legs and arms, standing tall with your arms overhead.
4. Lower your body back into the squat position, bringing your hands back down in front of your knees. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a neutral spine throughout the movement to protect your back and improve stability.
2. Keep your knees aligned with your toes during the squat to avoid putting strain on your knees.
3. Focus on a controlled descent back into the squat to ensure smooth and effective movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Shoulders (Deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the ground with your upper back resting against a bench and your knees bent, feet flat on the floor and shoulder-width apart. Cross your arms over your chest.
2. Engage your core and press through your heels to lift your hips upward until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement, keeping your chin tucked slightly and your ribs down.
4. Slowly lower your hips back down to the ground under control. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Press through your heels, not your toes, to better target the glutes.
2. Exhale as you lift your hips and inhale as you lower them.
3. Pause and squeeze your glutes at the top for 12 seconds to maximize activation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a partial lunge position with your left foot forward and right foot back, hands in front of your hips.
2. Thrust your right knee forward and up to hip level, bringing your hands to meet your knee.
3. Return to the partial lunge position, lowering your right leg back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a steady breathing pattern to support balance and coordination during the movement.
2. Keep your supporting leg slightly bent to absorb impact and provide stability.
3. Focus on a powerful knee thrust while maintaining proper form and balance.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by kneeling on the floor with both knees, hands placed on your hips.
2. Lift your right foot and place it flat on the floor in front of you, transitioning into a half-kneeling position.
3. Push through your right foot to stand up fully, bringing your left foot to meet your right.
4. Lower back down into the half-kneeling position, then return to the original kneeling position. Repeat with the other leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your back straight and avoid leaning forward as you transition from kneeling to standing.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a kneeling push-up position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your body on the floor.
2. Push up by extending both arms, keeping your knees on the floor. Lift your right hand off the floor, performing a rowing motion by bringing your elbow up towards the ceiling.
3. Return your right hand to the floor and lower your body to the starting position.
4. Repeat alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and prevent your hips from sagging during the push-up and row.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and avoid injury.
3. Focus on a full range of motion in both the push-up and the rowing movement to ensure effectiveness.
Primary Activating Muscles: Chest (Pectoralis Major), Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a kneeling position with your knees on the floor and your torso upright.
2. Lean back slowly, keeping your body straight from your knees to your head, engaging your quadriceps.
3. Return to the upright kneeling position, repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and prevent your lower back from arching.
2. Keep your core engaged to stabilize your spine and prevent lower back strain.
3. Focus on a smooth and steady movement to maintain balance and ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1.Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands just in front of your hips.
2. Lift your right knee towards the middle of your hips while lightly rotating your torso to bring your left hand to touch the right knee.
3. Lower your right leg back to the floor and return your hands to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left knee, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture throughout the exercise to ensure proper form.
2. Rotate your torso smoothly to engage your oblique muscles effectively.
3. Ensure your knee movement is deliberate and controlled to maximize muscle activation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a kneeling position with your knees on the floor. Place your hands on the floor in front of you opposite your head, close together, and lean forward.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your forearms and head towards the floor, engaging your triceps.
3. Push through your hands to extend your arms back to the starting position, straightening your elbows.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your body stable by engaging your core throughout the movement.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body to target the triceps more effectively.
3. Control the movement, avoiding any jerking motions, to enhance muscle engagement and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your stomach while curling your arms at your chest and extend your legs on the floor.
2. Bend your knees to lift your lower legs towards your glutes, engaging your hamstrings.
3. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips pressed into the floor to ensure proper form and maximize hamstring engagement.
2. Squeeze your hamstrings at the top of the movement for a brief hold to enhance muscle contraction.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start by hanging from a bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
2. Pull yourself up explosively, transitioning from a pull-up to a dip position above the bar.
3. Push your body up until your arms are fully extended above the bar.
4. Lower yourself back down to the starting hanging position in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core and maintain a straight body line to ensure proper form.
2. Use an explosive pull-up motion to help transition from below the bar to above the bar.
3. Focus on a controlled descent to avoid straining your muscles and joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Rhomboids), Chest (Pectoralis Major), Shoulders (Deltoids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended overhead.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your arms extended overhead.
3. Stand back up to the starting position, maintaining the arm position throughout.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and proper alignment throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your chest lifted and your back straight to avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Shoulders (Deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended overhead with hands holding together, elbows slightly bent.
2. Bend your elbows to lower your hands behind your head, engaging your triceps.
3. Extend your arms back to the starting overhead position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary and close to your ears throughout the exercise to effectively target the triceps.
2. Engage your core to maintain stability and avoid arching your back.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or by your sides.
2. Step forward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee is aligned over your ankle and your back knee is close to the floor.
3. Perform small pulsing movements by slightly raising and lowering your body in the lunge position.
4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement on the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged and your torso upright to maintain balance and proper form.
2. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid putting unnecessary strain on your knee.
3. Perform the pulsing movements slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or extended in front of you.
2. Lower your body into a squat position, ensuring your thighs are parallel to the floor and your back is straight.
3. Perform a small pulsing movement by slightly raising and lowering your body in the squat position.
4. Return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet flat on the floor to maintain balance and stability.
2. Keep your chest lifted and your back straight to avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Perform the pulsing movements slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight pulse squat arms to chest
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on crossed at your chest
2. Lower your body into a squat position, ensuring your thighs are parallel to the floor and your back is straight.
3. Perform a small pulsing movement by slightly raising and lowering your body in the squat position.
4. Return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet flat on the floor to maintain balance and stability.
2. Keep your chest lifted and your back straight to avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Perform the pulsing movements slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or by your sides.
2. Step backward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position, ensuring your front knee is aligned over your ankle and your back knee is close to the floor.
3. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left foot stepping backward, alternating legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture throughout the exercise to ensure proper form.
2. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid putting unnecessary strain on your knee.
3. Focus on smooth and controlled movements to enhance muscle engagement and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
2. Step backward with your right foot and lower your body into a lunge position while simultaneously raising your arms in front of you to shoulder level.
3. Ensure your front knee is aligned over your ankle and your back knee is close to the floor.
4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position, lowering your arms back to your sides. Repeat the movement with your left foot stepping backward, alternating legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, inhaling as you lunge down and exhaling as you push back up.
2. Keep your arms straight and parallel to the floor during the front raise to maximize shoulder activation.
3. Avoid locking your knees when returning to the standing position to keep the tension on your muscles and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Shoulders (Deltoids), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet together and your hands by your sides or on your hips.
2. Lift your right leg straight back and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight, until your torso is parallel to the floor.
3. Return to the starting position by lowering your right leg and raising your torso back to upright.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture and look forward to help with balance.
2. Keep a slight bend in your standing knee to avoid locking it and to protect your joints.
3. Focus on keeping your movements smooth and steady to maintain proper form and avoid injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands extended in front of you for balance.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Stand back up to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet flat on the floor to maintain balance and stability.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands extended down by your sides.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Stand up from the squat and raise your right leg straight in front of you to hip level mimicking a kick, lower it down and immidiately raise your left leg to hip level.
4. Lower your left leg back to the floor and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on maintaining an upright posture to ensure proper alignment and form.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Move at a controlled pace, particularly when raising and lowering your leg, to avoid unnecessary strain and enhance muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands extended by your sides.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Stand up from the squat and raise your right leg as high as possible, kicking it to the side until straight.
4. Lower your right leg back to the floor and immediately transition into the next squat, alternating legs with each repetition.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on maintaining an upright posture to ensure proper alignment and form.
2. Keep your weight distributed evenly on your feet during the squat to maintain balance.
3. Move at a controlled pace, particularly when raising and lowering your leg, to avoid unnecessary strain and enhance muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight Squat to Side to Front Leg
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands at your sides.
2. Lower your body into a squat position until your thighs are parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Stand up from the squat and raise your right leg straight to the side, then lower it back to the floor.
4. Perform another squat, then stand up and raise your right leg straight to the front. Lower it back to the floor and repeat the movement, alternating legs with each repetition.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your core to maintain stability and balance throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your weight distributed evenly on your feet during the squat to maintain balance.
3. Move at a controlled pace, especially when lifting and lowering your leg, to avoid unnecessary strain and enhance muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands crossed to your chest.
2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back.
3. Hold the squat position for the desired duration, maintaining proper form throughout.
4. Stand back up to the starting position by pressing through your heels and straightening your legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your feet flat on the floor to ensure stability and proper form.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Focus on steady breathing to help maintain the hold and prevent fatigue.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bodyweight standing around world wall supported
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back against a wall for support.
2. Extend your arms to the sides of your torso with palms facing forward.
3. Move your arms in a circular motion, bringing them overhead, and back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back flat against the wall to maintain proper alignment and support.
2. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Perform the arm movements slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Upper Chest (Clavicular Head)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and bring both arms straight behind your back, holding your hands together.
2. Gently arch your back, pushing your hips forward and looking towards the ceiling.
3. Hold the stretched position for a few seconds, maintaining a gentle and controlled stretch.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep the movement gentle to avoid straining your lower back.
2. Engage your core to support your lower back during the stretch.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily to enhance the stretch and relaxation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands on your hips or by your sides for balance.
2. Rise up onto your toes, lifting your heels off the floor.
3. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor to return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation.
3. Ensure your weight is evenly distributed on both feet to prevent imbalance.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Tibialis (Tibialis Anterior), Fibularis Muscles (Peroneus Longus, Peroneus Brevis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides, bent at 90 degrees, elbows at shoulder height.
2. Bring your arms together in front of your body until your forearms meet.
3. Open your arms back out to the sides to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your movements are smooth and controlled to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Keep your shoulders down and away from your ears to avoid tension.
3. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles as you bring your arms together to enhance muscle activation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, upper arms parallel to the floor, and arms bent at 90 degrees, fingers pointing at the ceiling.
2. Press your hands upward, extending your arms fully overhead.
3. Lower your hands back to shoulder level to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain stability and avoid arching your back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation.
3. Keep your shoulders down and away from your ears throughout the exercise.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Upper Chest (Clavicular Head), Triceps (Triceps Brachii)

Exercise: Bodyweight standing military press wall supported
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your back against a wall for support, upper arms parallel to the floor, and arms bent at 90 degrees, fingers pointing at the ceiling.
2. Press your hands upward, extending your arms fully overhead.
3. Lower your hands back to shoulder level to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on keeping your back and head in contact with the wall to maintain proper alignment.
2. Ensure a full range of motion by fully extending your arms without locking your elbows.
3. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you press up and inhaling as you lower your arms.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Upper Chest (Clavicular Head)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your hands on your hips.
2. Raise your shoulders up towards your ears.
3. Lower your shoulders back to the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture to ensure proper form.
2. Avoid rolling your shoulders; focus on lifting them straight up and down.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place your hands behind your head, forming a triangle with your bent elbows, elbows facing outwards.
2. Close your elbows together in front of you, bringing them towards each other.
3. Open your elbows back out to the sides to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture and avoid arching your back during the exercise.
2. Keep your neck relaxed and avoid pushing your head forward as you bring your elbows together.
3. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles as you bring your elbows together.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in front of a step box.
2. Step up onto the box with your right foot, then bring your left foot up to meet your right, standing fully on the box.
3. Step back down to the floor with your left foot, followed by your right foot.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, alternating the lead foot.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your entire foot is placed on the box to prevent slipping.
3. Focus on pushing through your heel when stepping up to activate your glutes and quadriceps.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands pressed together close to your chest, elbows bent.
2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you, keeping your hands pressed together.
3. Bring your hands back to your chest, bending your elbows to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a firm press of your hands together to engage your chest muscles throughout the exercise.
2. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and balance.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position on your toes and elbows, with your hands positioned at shoulder-width apart, palms on the floor.
2. Push through your palms to extend your arms straight, keeping your palms in place. 
3.  Lower your forearms to the floor back to the starting plank position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels to maintain proper form.
2. Engage your core to stabilize your body and prevent your hips from sagging.
3. Focus on your breathing; inhale as you lower your forearms and exhale as you extend your arms back to the plank position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your back against a wall and your feet shoulder-width apart, positioned a few inches away from the wall.
2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and hips, allowing your buttocks to touch the wall first, then your entire torso.
3. Immediately push through your heels to stand back up, returning to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Start the movement by engaging your glutes and core to maintain stability.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes and do not extend past your toes to prevent strain on your knees.
3. Move smoothly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
Bend at the waist, rotating your torso to touch your right hand to your left foot, while keeping your left arm extended upward.
Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side, touching your left hand to your right foot.
Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your movements are slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knees to reduce strain on your lower back and hamstrings.
Primary Activating Muscles: Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Bend at the waist, rotating your torso to touch your right hand to your left foot 3-4 times in a pulsing motion, while keeping your left arm extended upward.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side, touching your left hand to your right foot.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, alternating sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and stability throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure your movements are slow and controlled to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knees to reduce strain on your lower back and hamstrings.
Primary Activating Muscles: Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise: Both Arms Behind On Wall Biceps Stretch
Both Arms Behind On Wall Biceps Stretch_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended just off the floor and your arms resting on the floor by your sides.
2. Bend your knees towards your chest, stopping when your upper legs are vertical to the floor.
3. Lower your legs back down without letting them touch the floor.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.
3. Focus on using your lower abdominal muscles to lift and lower your legs.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, legs slightly bent, and your hands lightly bent in front of your hips.
2. Slowly straighten your legs while simultaneously drawing circles with your hands, moving them outward and upward.
3. Encircle your hands inward, bringing them close together and downward as you bend your knees back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions or duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a slight bend in your knees throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your shoulders relaxed to avoid tension and enhance fluidity in your movements.
3. Focus on maintaining a consistent rhythm with both the leg movements and the circular hand motions.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended by your sides at shoulder level.
2. Rotate your torso to touch the inside of your right thigh with your left hand, slightly bending your knees as you do so.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side, rotating your torso to touch the inside of your left thigh with your right hand, slightly bending your knees.
4. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your gaze forward to help maintain balance and proper alignment.
2. Engage your core muscles to support the rotational movement and protect your lower back.
3. Perform the exercise at a controlled pace to ensure proper form and muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in front of a box.
2. Bend your knees and hips, swinging your arms back to prepare for the jump.
3. Explosively jump onto the box, landing softly with both feet.
4. Stand up fully on the box before stepping or jumping back down to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on landing softly to reduce impact on your joints.
2. Engage your core throughout the jump to maintain stability and control.
3. Use your arms to generate momentum and help propel your body upward.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart in front of a box.
2. Bend your knees and hips, swinging your arms back to prepare for the jump.
3. Explosively jump onto the box, landing softly in a squat position.
4. Jump back down to the floor, returning to the starting position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on landing softly to reduce impact on your joints.
2. Engage your core throughout the jump to maintain stability and control.
3. Use your arms to generate momentum and help propel your body upward.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Extend your left arm forward in a quick, snapping motion to throw a jab.
3. Quickly retract your left arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Rotate your hips and shoulders slightly to add power to the jab.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Rotate your hips and shoulders, bringing your left arm in a horizontal arc to throw a hook.
3. Quickly retract your left arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Focus on rotating your hips and shoulders to add power to the hook.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Bend your knees slightly and rotate your hips and shoulders, bringing your left fist upward in a rising arc to throw an uppercut.
3. Quickly retract your left arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Focus on driving the punch from your legs and hips to add power to the uppercut.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Rotate your hips and shoulders, extending your right arm forward in a straight line to throw a cross.
3. Quickly retract your right arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Rotate your back foot and hips to add power to the cross.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Rotate your hips and shoulders, bringing your right arm in a horizontal arc to throw a hook.
3. Quickly retract your right arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Focus on rotating your hips and shoulders to add power to the hook.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in a boxing stance with your feet shoulder-width apart, left foot forward, and hands up in a guard position near your chin.
2. Bend your knees slightly and rotate your hips and shoulders, bringing your right fist upward in a rising arc to throw an uppercut.
3. Quickly retract your right arm back to the guard position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your non-punching hand up to protect your face and maintain a balanced stance.
2. Engage your core to generate power and maintain stability.
3. Focus on driving the punch from your legs and hips to add power to the uppercut.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position on your toes and hands, arms straight in line with shoulders, with your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your left elbow while lightly rotating your hips. Return your leg to starting position.
3. Repeat the movement on the opposite side, bending your left knee and bringing it towards your right elbow while lightly rotating your hips. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements controlled to ensure each repetition is deliberate and effective.
2. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you bring your knee towards your elbow and inhaling as you return to the plank.
3. Focus on maintaining proper plank form, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1.Begin in a plank position on your toes and hands, with your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your left elbow while lightly rotating your hips, stop when your knee passes the elbow.
3. Return to the starting plank position, then repeat the movement on the opposite side.
4. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure you keep your movements smooth and controlled to maintain form and avoid injury.
2. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you bring your knee towards your elbow and inhaling as you return to the plank position.
3. Keep your shoulders stable and your core engaged throughout the exercise to enhance effectiveness.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor at shoulder width, and arms extended by your sides.
2. Lift your hips off the floor to form a straight line from your shoulders to your knees, engaging your glutes and core.
3. While keeping your hips elevated, move your knees outwards in a controlled manner and back.
4. Repeat the movement  for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Ensure your hips remain elevated and level throughout the exercise to maximize glute activation.
3. Perform the leg abductions slowly and with control to avoid any jerky movements and enhance muscle engagement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie down on your back with your knees bent, feet together on the floor, and arms resting at your sides.
2. Raise your hips and straighten your thighs with your back while your knees are closed.
3. Maintain this position, raise your arms and then land them overhead with your palms facing upward.
4. Return to the initial position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet hip-width apart and ensure your knees stay aligned with your ankles to maintain proper form.
2. Engage your core and glutes to support your lower back and maintain stability.
3. Breathe deeply and evenly throughout the pose, relaxing your shoulders and neck.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms resting by your sides.
2. Lift your hips off the floor to form a straight line from your shoulders to your knees, engaging your glutes and core.
3. While keeping your hips elevated, extend your right leg straight keeping it in level with torso, then lower it back to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg, extending it straight keeping it in level with torso, then lowering it back to the starting position. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Ensure your hips remain elevated and level throughout the exercise to maximize glute activation.
3. Perform the leg raises slowly and with control to avoid any jerky movements and to enhance muscle engagement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Begin walking at a brisk pace, ensuring that you take quick, short steps.
3. Swing your arms naturally with each step, allowing them to move opposite to your legs for balance.
4. Maintain this brisk pace for the desired duration or distance.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain good posture and stability.
2. Focus on a heel-to-toe motion with each step to ensure proper walking mechanics.
3. Breathe steadily and rhythmically to support your pace and endurance.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides.

Exercise Tips:

2. Focus on a heel-to-toe motion with each step to ensure proper walking mechanics.
3. Breathe steadily and rhythmically to support your pace and endurance.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand a few feet in front of a bench or elevated surface, facing away from it. Place your left foot behind you on the bench, with the top of your foot resting on the surface.
2. Position your right foot firmly on the floor, a comfortable distance in front of the bench.
3. Lower your body by bending your right knee and hip, keeping your torso upright, until your right thigh is parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your front knee aligned with your toes to avoid putting unnecessary strain on your knee.
2. Focus on driving through the heel of your front foot to engage your glutes and quadriceps effectively.
3. Maintain a slight forward lean to help with balance and ensure proper form throughout the exercise.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Bulgarian split squat cable Resistance band
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place one foot behind you on a bench or step, with your other foot forward. Secure the resistance band under your front foot.
2. Hold the handles of the resistance band with your palms facing forward, elbows bent, and hands raised near your shoulders. Keep your arms folded by your sides.
3. Lower your body towards the floor by bending the front knee, stopping just before your back knee touches the floor
4. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain an upright posture throughout the exercise to prevent leaning forward or arching your back.
2. Exhale as you push back up to the starting position and inhale as you lower down.
3. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to prevent strain on your knee joint.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Lower your body into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Jump your feet back to land in a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
4. Perform a push-up, then jump your feet back towards your hands.
5. Explode into a jump straight up, reaching your arms overhead. Land softly and immediately lower back into the squat position to begin the next repetition.
Exercise Tips:
1. Start with a moderate pace to master the form, then gradually increase your speed as you become more comfortable with the movement.
2. Ensure your movements are fluid and controlled to avoid unnecessary strain on your joints.
3. Focus on landing softly during the jump to reduce impact on your knees and ankles.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Chest (Pectoralis Major), Shoulders (Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Triceps (Triceps Brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms at your sides, ready to begin the movement.
2. Lower your body into a squat position and place your hands on the floor in front of you.
3. Step your right foot back, then your left foot, to land in a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
4. Step your right foot forward, then your left foot, to return to the squat position, then stand up and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Start with a moderate pace to master the form, then gradually increase your speed as you become more comfortable with the movement.
2. Engage your core to maintain stability and support your lower back throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on keeping your knees aligned with your toes during the squat to prevent unnecessary strain on your joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended in front of you, palms facing down.
2. Bend your right knee to bring your heel towards your buttocks while simultaneously pulling your elbows back to perform a rowing motion.
3. Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left leg, bringing your left heel towards your buttocks while pulling your elbows back.
4. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions or duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper body upright to maintain proper form and avoid leaning forward.
2. Perform the rowing motion with controlled movements, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you pull your elbows back.
3. Ensure each butt kick is high enough to effectively engage the hamstrings.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Shoulders (Deltoids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Begin by jogging in place, lifting your heels towards your buttocks with each step. 
3. Alternate lifting your right and left heels in a quick, continuous motion, keeping your knees pointing down. Swing your arms naturally with each step, allowing them to move opposite to your legs for balance.
4. Maintain a steady pace for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper body upright and avoid leaning forward to maintain proper form.
2. Engage your core to support balance and stability throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on a quick, light motion with each heel lift to effectively engage your hamstrings.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Begin by jogging in place, lifting your heels towards your buttocks with each step. 
3. Alternate lifting your right and left heels in a quick, continuous motion, keeping your knees pointing down. Swing your arms naturally with each step, allowing them to move opposite to your legs for balance.
4. Maintain a steady pace for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper body upright and avoid leaning forward to maintain proper form.
2. Engage your core to support balance and stability throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on a quick, light motion with each heel lift to effectively engage your hamstrings.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs bent and the soles of your feet pressed together, allowing your knees to fall out to the sides.
2. Hold your feet with both hands and sit up tall, lengthening your spine.
3. Gently flap your knees up and down like the wings of a butterfly, keeping your movements smooth and controlled.
4. Continue the flapping motion for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid slouching to maintain proper posture.
2. Breathe deeply and evenly throughout the exercise to relax your muscles and enhance the stretch.
3. Perform the flapping motion gently to avoid straining your hip joints and inner thighs.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs bent and the soles of your feet pressed together, allowing your knees to fall out to the sides.
2. Hold your feet with both hands and sit up tall, then lean forward slightly towards the floor, creating a gentle arch in your back.
3. Press your knees gently towards the floor to deepen the stretch in your hips.
4. Hold the position for the desired duration, breathing deeply and evenly throughout.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a gentle arch in your back while leaning forward to ensure a proper stretch and avoid straining.
2. Inhale deeply and exhale slowly throughout the pose to help relax your muscles and enhance the stretch.
3. Apply gentle pressure to your knees without forcing them down to prevent overstraining your hip joints.
Primary Activating Muscles: Adductors (Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis, Adductor Magnus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your back facing the low pulley, holding the handle behind your head with your arm bent, elbow pointing up and palm facing the ceiling. Use your other hand to support the active arm by holding it just above the elbow.
2. Extend your active arm up overhead, straightening your elbow to push the handle upward.
3. Slowly return your arm to the starting position behind your head. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arm stationary throughout the exercise to isolate the triceps.
2. Avoid using momentum; perform the movement slowly and with control.
3. Exhale as you extend your arm and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Kneel on the seat of a cable pulldown machine with both legs secured under the thigh pads. Face away from the machine and hold the cable bar behind your neck with both hands.
2. Lean forward to straighten your legs until your torso is almost parallel to the floor.
3. Slowly return to the starting position by bringing your upper body back up, bending at the knees.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
2. Avoid using momentum; focus on the controlled contraction of your hamstrings.
3. Exhale as you straighten your legs and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Abdominals (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at a cable pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip, your arms fully extended overhead.
2. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, bringing your elbows down and back.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position with your arms fully extended overhead. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum; perform the movement slowly and with control.
2. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Focus on the contraction of your back muscles as you pull the bar down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Upper Back (Rhomboids), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on a flat bench positioned between two cable machines, with the cables set at a low position. Grasp the handles with your arms bent and hands close to your chest sides.
2. Press the handles upward in an arc motion over your chest, extending your arms upward.
3. Lower the handles back down to the starting position, stopping when your hands are close to your chest sides.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Ensure your back remains flat against the bench and avoid arching your spine.
3. Focus on the contraction of your chest muscles as you press the handles up.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on a flat bench positioned between two pulley cables, with the cables set at a low position. 
2. Grasp the handles with your arms bent and hands close to your chest sides.
3. Press the handles upward in a straight line over your chest, extending your arms fully.
4. Lower the handles back down to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Ensure your back remains flat against the bench and avoid arching your spine.
3. Focus on the contraction of your chest muscles as you press the handles up.

Exercise: Cable bent over one arm lateral raise
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand to the side of the machine with your right side facing it, and grasp the handle with the left hand, allowing the cable to cross in front of your body.
2. Bend at the hips until your upper body is nearly parallel to the floor, keeping your knees slightly bent and your back flat. Let the arm holding the handle hang straight down.
3. Raise the handle out to the side until your hand is at shoulder level, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
4. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbow throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body; focus on isolating the shoulder muscle.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise: Cable bent over reverse grip row
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend at the hips to form a 90 degree angle with your upper body, keeping your knees slightly bent. Let your arms extend with the cable, holding the bar.
3. Pull the bar towards your lower abdomen, bringing your elbows backwards.
4. Slowly extend the bar back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
2. Exhale as you pull the bar towards you and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body; focus on isolating the back muscles.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine and grasp the bar with an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend at the hips to form a 90 degree angle with your upper body, keeping your knees slightly bent. Let your arms extend with the cable, holding the bar.
3. Pull the bar towards your lower abdomen, bringing your elbows backwards.
4. Slowly extend the bar back to the starting position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
2. Exhale as you pull the bar towards you and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body; focus on isolating the back muscles.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the pulley machine and grasp the EZ-bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and core engaged. Hold the bar extending in front of your thighs.
3. Curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders by bending your elbows. Keeping your upper arms stationary and focusing on contracting your biceps.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with your arms fully extended. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
2. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Keep your elbows close to your torso throughout the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a low cable pulley with a straight bar attachment, with your feet hip-width apart, holding the bar in front of your hips with both hands.
2. Push through your forefeet to raise your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause for a second at the peak of the movement and then slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on moving only at the ankles to isolate your calves.
2. Keep your knees slightly bent and avoid locking them out to minimize knee stress.
3. Hold the top position for a second to maximize contraction.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the pulley machine and grasp the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands closer than shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and core engaged. Hold the bar extending in front of your thighs.
3. Curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders by bending your elbows. Keeping your upper arms stationary and focusing on contracting your biceps.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with your arms fully extended. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Start with a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you build strength.
2. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.

Exercise: Cable close grip front lat pulldown
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the lat pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the bar attached to the machine with your arms fully extended above you, hands closer than shoulder-width and palms facing forward.
2. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, bringing your elbows down and back while slightly leaning back.
3. Slowly return the handle to the starting position with your arms fully extended overhead.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control.
2. Exhale as you pull the handle down and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Ensure your chest stays up and your shoulders down to avoid rounding your back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids), Shoulders (Deltoids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing away from the machine, with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bar held with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
2. Stand upright with your back straight and core engaged. Let the bar hang down in front of your thighs with your arms fully extended and the cable passing between your legs.
3. Raise the bar in front of you to shoulder height, keeping your arms straight but with a slight bend in the elbows.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you raise the bar and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Avoid using momentum; focus on the contraction of your shoulder muscles.
3. Ensure your shoulders stay down and relaxed, not shrugged up towards your ears.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
