1. Stand upright facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a bar attachment with both hands at chest level with elbows facing the floor.
2. Begin squatting by bending your hips and knees, descend into a deep squat until your thighs are parallel to the ground or lower.
3. Push through your heels to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows pointed down and tucked in to stabilize the bar during the squat.
2. Engage your core to protect your lower back and maintain balance.
3. Ensure your knees track in line with your toes as you descend.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris), Calves (Gastrocnemius), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach an ankle strap to a low pulley and secure it around your working ankle, then stand upright facing the machine and hold onto a stable surface or clasp your hands together for balance.
2. Keep your upper body stationary and your knees aligned as you slowly bend your working knee, curling your foot up toward your glutes.
3. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, focusing on squeezing your hamstring.
4. Lower your foot back down to the starting position with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Squeeze your hamstring at the top of the curl for peak contraction.
2. Adjust the weight appropriately to maintain proper form throughout the set.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your standing leg for better stability.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach an ankle strap to a low pulley on a cable machine and secure it around one ankle. Stand facing the machine and hold onto the handles or frame for support while keeping your torso leaning slightly forward.
2. Engage your core and shift your weight onto the stationary leg while slightly bending the knee of the supporting leg.
3. Extend the strapped leg straight back in a controlled motion, squeezing your glute at the top without hyperextending your lower back.
4. Slowly return your leg to the starting position without letting the weight stack touch, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform each repetition with slow and controlled motion to maximize glute engagement.
2. Avoid swinging your leg or using momentum to lift the weight.
3. Focus on squeezing the glute at the top of the movement for better muscle activation.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the middle of a cable machine with the handles attached to the low pulleys on either side, with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold the left handle with your right hand and the right handle with your left hand, with the cables crossing in front of you. Stand 
2. Stand upright with your back straight. Let the handles hang down in front of your thighs with your arms fully extended.
3. Raise the handles out to your sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Choose a weight that allows you to complete the exercise with proper form.
2. Exhale as you raise the handles and inhale as you lower them back down.
3. Avoid using momentum; focus on the contraction of your shoulder muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand next to the machine on your left side, holding the handle with your right hand. Lean away from the machine, using your left hand to hold onto the machine for support.
2. Position your feet together, with your outside foot slightly in front for better stability. Let the handle hang down at your side with your arm fully extended.
3. Raise the handle out to the side until your arm is parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
4. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you raise the handle and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Avoid using momentum; focus on the contraction of your shoulder muscles.
3. Lean away from the machine to increase the range of motion and target the shoulder muscles more effectively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable machine with the pulleys set at a low position. Grasp the handles with your palms facing forward and arms extended down out to your sides. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly staggered for stability.
2. Stand upright with your back straight. Bring the handles together in front of your body in a wide arc, keeping a slight bend in your elbows and palms should face upwards.
3. Slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, maintaining the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on the contraction of your chest muscles as you bring the handles together.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Exhale as you bring the handles together and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the pulldown machine with your feet placed securely under the knee pads. Grasp the bar with both hands, hands at shoulder-width apart and palms facing down.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and core engaged, extending your arms fully in front of you.
3. Pull the bar towards your lower abdomen, bringing your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid strain.
2. Engage your core to maintain stability and proper posture.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise: cable lying extension pullover (with cables attachment)
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach both cable handles to a single low pulley. Lie on a flat bench with your head positioned near the pulley. Grasp the handles with your palms facing up and your arms extended in line with your body.
2. Keep your feet flat on the floor and your back pressed against the bench. Engage your core to maintain stability.
3. Raise the handles in an arc motion over your head, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Lower the handles back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Focus on the contraction of your lats and triceps as you pull the handles up.
3. Exhale as you pull the handles back to the starting position and inhale as you lower them.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on a flat bench between a dual crossover machine and your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with your palms facing up and arms extended to the sides at chest level.
2. Raise the handles over your chest in a wide arc motion, keeping a slight bend in your elbows. 
3. Return to the starting position by lowering the handles out to your sides in a wide arc motion.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on the contraction of your chest muscles as you bring the handles together.
2. Start with a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you build strength.
3. Make sure the bench is stable and positioned securely between the cable machines.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to the middle pulley of a cable machine. Lie on a flat bench with your head positioned near the pulley. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip, your arms extended straight up above your chest.
2. Lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
3. Just before touching your forehead, extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting your triceps.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms to isolate the triceps.
2. Focus on the contraction of your triceps as you extend your arms.
3. Exhale as you extend your arms and inhale as you lower the bar.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to the low pulley of a cable machine. Lie on a flat bench with your head positioned near the pulley. Grasp the bar or rope with an overhand grip, your arms extended straight up above your chest.
2. Lower the bar towards your forehead by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
3. Just before touching your forehead, extend your arms back to the starting position, focusing on contracting your triceps.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary and only move your forearms to isolate the triceps.
2. Focus on the contraction of your triceps as you extend your arms.
3. Exhale as you extend your arms and inhale as you lower the bar.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable machine with the pulleys set at a high position. Grasp the handles with your palms facing forward and arms extended down out to your sides. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly staggered for stability.
2. Stand upright with your back straight. Bring the handles together in front of your body in a wide arc, keeping a slight bend in your elbows and palms should face upwards.
3. Slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, maintaining the slight bend in your elbows.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on the contraction of your chest muscles as you bring the handles together.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Exhale as you bring the handles together and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable fly machine with the pulleys set at mid-chest height, with one foot in front of the other and knees slightly bent. Hold the handles with both hands, arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height, palms facing forward.
2. Keep your back straight and maintain a slight bend at the hips and knees for stability.
3. Pull the handles together in front of your chest in a wide arc, keeping your arms slightly bent, until your hands meet in the centerline of your chest.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Exhale as you bring the handles together and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a rope to the low pulley on the machine. Grasp the end of the rope in each hand and bring it close to your chest.Feet close together, flat on the floor, knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
2. Push through your heels and extend your legs to stand up, keeping the handles close to your chest.
3. Slowly lower yourself back down to the seated position, controlling the movement. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on pushing through your heels to engage your glutes and quads effectively.
2. Exhale as you stand up and inhale as you sit back down.
3. Ensure your back remains straight and avoid rounding your spine.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a handle to a middle pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine and grasp the handle with your left hand, using a neutral grip (palm facing your body). Step back to create tension in the cable.
2. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and bend slightly at the hips, keeping your back straight and core engaged. Your upper arm should be parallel to the floor and close to your body with your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
3. Extend your left arm straight back by straightening your elbow, keeping your upper arm stationary and focusing on contracting your triceps.
4. Slowly return your arm to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your right hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arm stationary and only move your forearm to isolate the triceps.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
3. Exhale as you extend your arm and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable one arm bent over row
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine, holding the handle with your left hand. Step back with one foot to create tension in the cable.
2. Bend at the hips slightly to the floor, keeping your knees bent and your back flat. Place your right hand on your right knee for support.
3. Pull the handle towards your lower abdomen, bringing your elbow back. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blade towards your spine.
4. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your right hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handle towards you and inhale as you extend your arm back.
2. Start with a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you build strength.
3. Focus on the contraction of your back muscles as you pull the handle towards you.

Exercise: Cable One Arm Chest Fly Bent
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable fly machine with the pulleys set at mid-chest height, with feet just wider than shoulder-width and bend at the hips and knees and lean towards the floor. Place your left hand to your knee for support. 
2. Hold the handle with your right hand, arm extended out to the side at shoulder height, palm facing forward. Bring the handle opposite your chest in a wide arc motion, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Slowly return the handles to the starting position, maintaining control and the bend in your elbow.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Start with a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you build strength.
3. Focus on squeezing your chest muscles as you bring the handles together.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing the machine, holding the handle with your right hand, palm facing forward.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight. Let your arm fully extend down by your side.
3. Curl the handle upwards towards your shoulder by bending your elbow, keeping your upper arm stationary and close to your body.
4. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbow close to your torso throughout the exercise.
2. Exhale as you curl the handle up and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a single handle to a low pulley on a cable machine. Stand facing away from the machine, holding the handle with your right hand, palm facing back. Step forward to create tension in the cable.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight. Let your arm fully extend down by your side.
3. Raise the handle straight in front of you to shoulder height, keeping your arm straight but with a slight bend in the elbow.
4. Slowly lower the handle back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your elbow; keep a slight bend to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Exhale as you raise the handle and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Avoid locking your elbow; keep a slight bend to reduce strain on your joints.

Exercise: Cable one arm inner biceps curl
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight, with your right side facing the machine, holding the handle with your right hand, arm extended at shoulder height parallel to the floor, palm facing up.
2. Curl the handle towards your shoulder by bending your elbow, keeping your upper arm stationary and parallel to the floor.
3. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
2. Exhale as you curl the handle up and inhale as you extend it back.
3. Keep your elbow at shoulder height and stationary throughout the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the lat pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the handle attached to the high pulley with your right hand, arm fully extended above you, palm facing forward.
2. Pull the handle down towards your right shoulder, bringing your elbow down while slightly leaning back.
3. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handle down and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blade towards your spine as you pull down.
3. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable machine with the pulleys set at the highest position. Grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing upward. Extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height, almost parallel to the floor.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and elbows slightly bent.
3. Curl the handles towards your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl the handles towards your head and inhale as you extend them back.
2. Keep your elbows stationary and at shoulder height throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a rope handle to the high pulley on a cable machine. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, back to the machine, and grasp the rope handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Step forward to create tension in the cable. Extend your arms straight in level with your torso, keeping your elbows close to your head.
3. Lower the rope behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
3. Exhale as you extend your arms and inhale as you lower the rope.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine. Attach a single handle to a middle pulley and hold it with your right hand, palm facing downwards.
2. Bend slightly at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight, and extend your right arm forward.
3. Pull the handle towards your body, rotating your palm to face upwards as you bring your elbow back, keeping it close to your torso.
4. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position, rotating your palm back to face inwards. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your back muscles at the top of the movement.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor. Attach a straight bar to the low pulley of a cable machine and grasp the bar with both hands, shoulder-width apart, palms facing upwards.
2. Position your upper arms on the preacher bench pad and extend your arms fully, holding the bar.
3. Curl the bar towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.
3. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the middle of a cable pulley machine with a rope attached at a low position. Hold the handles between your thighs with your back facing the machine, and the cables extending back.
2. Spread your feet just wider than shoulder-width, lean forward, bending at the hips and knees into a semi-squat position, while keeping your back straight and your arms extended.
3. Extend your hips forward to straighten your body, pushing the handles with your thighs.
4. Return to the starting semi-squat position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using your lower back to lift; the movement should come from your hips.
2. Focus on engaging your glutes and hamstrings as you extend your hips.
3. Exhale as you extend your hips forward and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the cable pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the bar attached to the high pulley with an overhand grip, hands placed at shoulder-width, arms fully extended above you.
2. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, bringing your elbows down and back while keeping them close to your body.
3. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid flaring them out.
3. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the cable pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the Pro Lat Bar attached to the high pulley with an overhand grip, hands placed wider than shoulder-width, arms fully extended above you.
2. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, bringing your elbows down and back while keeping them close to your body.
3. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid flaring them out.
3. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and lean slightly forward, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body. Your forearms should be parallel to the floor.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Stand with a slight bend in your knees for better stability.
3. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and a slight bend in your knees.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs, keeping your arms slightly bent throughout the movement.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Stand with a slight bend in your knees for better stability.
3. Focus on engaging your lats during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable machine with the pulleys set at chest height. Cross the cable ends and hold the left cable end with your right hand and the right cable end with your left hand, arms extended in front of you.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and a slight bend in your knees.
3. Pull the handles apart and out to the sides, keeping your arms straight but with a slight bend in the elbows, until your arms are extended out to your sides.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, bringing the handles back in front of you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles apart and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your rear deltoids and upper back during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine. Set the pulley at shoulder height and grasp the handle of the cable with your right hand, palm facing down. Set your arm parallel to the floor in front of you and bent at 90 degrees.
2. Drive your elbow sideways while slowly straightening your arm, pulling the cable across your chest.
3. Slowly bring your arm back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your upper back muscles at the top of the movement.
2. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.
3. Stand with a slight bend in your knees for better stability.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand straight with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine. Set the pulley at shoulder height and grasp the handle of the cable with your right hand, palm facing down. Set your arm parallel to the floor in front of you and bent at 90 degrees.
2. Drive your elbow sideways, keeping your arm bent at 90 degrees, pulling the cable across your chest.
3. Slowly bring your arm back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your upper back muscles at the top of the movement.
2. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.
3. Stand with a slight bend in your knees for better stability.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Shoulders (Deltoids),

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the cable pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Attach a straight bar to the high pulley and grasp the bar with both hands, palms facing forward, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Lean your head slightly forward, keeping your back straight and core tight. Extend your arms fully above your head.
3. Pull the bar down behind your neck by bending your elbows and bringing them down to the sides.
4. Slowly extend your arms up to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you extend it back up.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the low pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and arms fully extended down in front of you.
3. Curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable crossover machine with the pulleys set at shoulder height. Cross the cable ends and hold the left cable end with your right hand and the right cable end with your left hand, arms extended in front of you.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and a slight bend in your knees.
3. Pull the handles apart and out to the sides, keeping your arms straight but with a slight bend in the elbows, until your arms are extended out to your sides.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, bringing the handles back in front of you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles apart and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your rear deltoids and upper back during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body. Your forearms should be parallel to the floor.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, allowing your forearms to become parallel to the floor again. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable reverse grip straight back seated high row
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Attach a straight bar to the high pulley and grasp the bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing back), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and arms fully extended above your head.
3. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest by bending your elbows and bringing them down and back, keeping your upper arms close to your body.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid leaning back or using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you extend it back up.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Rhomboids)

Exercise: Cable reverse grip triceps push down straight bar on crossover
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body. Your forearms should be parallel to the floor.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, allowing your forearms to become parallel to the floor again. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable reverse grip triceps pushdown (EZ bar)
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight an EZ bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the EZ bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body. Your forearms should be parallel to the floor.
3. Push the EZ bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, allowing your forearms to become parallel to the floor again. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable reverse grip triceps pushdown back side POV
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body. Your forearms should be parallel to the floor.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control, allowing your forearms to become parallel to the floor again. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor facing a cable machine with your legs extended straight out in front of you. Attach a straight bar to the low pulley and grasp the bar with both hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing down.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and arms fully extended towards the machine. Bend your knees slightly for comfort.
3. Pull the handle towards your lower abdomen by bending your elbows and bringing them backwards, keeping your upper arms close to your body.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the bar towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids)

Exercise: Cable seated one arm alternate row
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the seated cable row machine with your feet flat on the footrests and knees slightly bent. Attach a single handle to the low pulley and grasp the handle with your right hand, arm fully extended towards the machine.
2. Sit upright with your back straight, keeping your left hand on your left knee for support.
3. Pull the handle towards your lower abdomen by bending your elbow and bringing it back, keeping your upper arm close to your body.
4. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left hand.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the edge of a bench in the middle of a cable machine with the pulleys set at the lowest position. Attach single handles to each pulley and grasp the left handle with your right hand and the right handle with your left hand, allowing the cables to cross under your thighs.
2. Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight, so your chest is close to your knees.
3. Raise both handles out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you raise the handles and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Ensure your feet are firmly planted on the floor for stability.
3. Focus on engaging your rear deltoids and upper back during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the seated pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor. Attach a V-bar handle to the low pulley and grasp the handle with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and arms fully extended towards the machine.
3. Pull the handle towards your lower abdomen by bending your elbows and bringing them backwards, keeping your upper arms close to your body.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Avoid rounding your back; keep your chest lifted throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Forearms (Brachioradialis)

Exercise: Cable Seated Row With V Bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the seated cable machine with your feet flat on the floor. Attach a V handle to the pulley and grasp the handle with both hands, arms fully extended towards the machine.
2. Lean slightly forward, keeping your back straight.
3. Pull the handle towards your abdomen by bending your elbows and bringing it back while raising your torso to a seated position, keeping your arms close to your body.
4. Extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired repetitions
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Avoid rounding your back; keep your chest lifted throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Forearms (Brachioradialis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the seated pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor. Attach a straight bar to the middle pulley and grasp the bar with both hands using a supine grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Sit upright with your back straight and arms fully extended towards the machine.
3. Pull the bar towards your lower abdomen by bending your elbows and bringing them back, keeping your upper arms close to your body.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the bar towards your body and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Avoid rounding your back; keep your chest lifted throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Upper Back (Rhomboids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Shoulders (Deltoids), Forearms (Brachioradialis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a straight bar to a low pulley and stand facing the cable while holding the bar with both hands. Shift your weight onto your right leg, keeping it bent at 90 degrees. 
2. Slightly bend your standing knee and hinge at the hips to lower your torso to the floor.
3. Once your torso is nearly parallel to the floor. Drive through your standing leg to return to the starting position
4. Lower your foot to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a neutral spine throughout the entire movement to avoid lower back strain.
2. Keep your hips square to the floor and avoid rotating your torso as you hinge forward.
3. Engage your core to help stabilize your balance during the single-leg movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (Gluteus Maximus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Abdominals (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in front of a low pulley cable machine with a bar attached and grab it with both hands using an overhand grip. Take a step back into a split stance with one foot forward and one foot behind.
2. Hold the bar extended along the cable and keep your torso upright.
3. Lower your body by bending both knees until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your front knee aligned with your ankle throughout the movement.
2. Lower yourself slowly to avoid unnecessary strain on the knee joint.
3. Avoid locking out the knees at the top to keep muscles under tension.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach an ankle strap to a high pulley and secure it around your right ankle. Stand facing away from the machine and hold onto a stable surface for balance.
2. Bend the knee of the strapped leg so your heel is close to your glutes.
3. Slowly extend your leg by straightening the knee and then return it to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking out your knee at the top to keep constant tension.
2. Start with light resistance to perfect form and avoid joint strain.
3. Make sure your thighs remain in line throughout the motion.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable crossover machine with the pulleys set at the highest point. Grasp the handles with each hand, palms facing forward.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart with one foot forward and the other back and knees slightly bent. Keep your back straight and arms extended out to your sides.
3. Pull the handles down and forward until they meet in front of your hips. Keep a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles down and infront of your chest and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your chest muscles during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the high pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, lean your torso slightly forward and keep your back straight and a slight bend in your knees. Extend your arms fully in front of you at shoulder height.
3. Pull the bar down towards your thighs, keeping your arms straight throughout the movement.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position with control, bringing it back to shoulder height. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise to target the middle back muscles.
2. Focus on engaging your lats and core during the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you return it to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach an EZ bar to the high pulley of a cable machine. Stand with your back facing the machine, feet shoulder-width apart, and grasp the EZ bar with both hands, palms facing up.
2. Step forward slightly to create tension in the cable and position your feet in a staggered stance for stability. Extend your arms straight up above your head, keeping your elbows close to your ears.
3. Lower the EZ bar behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Extend your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you extend your arms and inhale as you lower the EZ bar.
2. Keep your elbows close to your ears and stationary throughout the exercise.
3. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down elbow out (v bar)
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight, knees slightly bent and lean slightly forward.
2. Grasp the V-bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing each other, and place your hands shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, with your elbows flared out to the sides.
3. Push the V-bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms close to your torso.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and avoid injury of your elbow joints.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the V-bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down ez bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent.
2. Grasp the EZ bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Push the EZ bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the EZ bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down ez bar close grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent.
2. Grasp the EZ bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands closer than shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Push the EZ bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the EZ bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down ez bar wide grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent.
2. Grasp the EZ bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Push the EZ bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the EZ bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down straight bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent.
2. Grasp the straight bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Push the bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the straight bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable triceps push down v bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and knees slightly bent.
2. Grasp the v bar attached to the high pulley with both hands, palms facing down, and place your hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Bend your elbows at a 90-degree angle, keeping your elbows close to your body.
3. Push the v bar down towards your thighs by straightening your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid moving your upper arms.
2. Focus on squeezing your triceps at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you push the v bar down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Cable twin handle parallel grip lat pulldown
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit upright on a bench positioned between two cable pulley machines with the pulleys set at a high position. Hold a handle in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing forward), arms fully extended above you.
2. Pull the handles down towards your shoulders by bending your elbows and bringing them downwards, keeping them close to your body.
3. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the handles down and inhale as you extend them back up.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand sideways to the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Attach a handle to the pulley at shoulder height and grasp it with both hands, arms extended in front of you.
2. Twist your torso away from the machine, pulling the handle across your body while keeping your arms straight.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
2. Exhale as you twist away from the machine and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Minimize hip twisting to focus on engaging your obliques and core during the twist.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand sideways to the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart. Attach a handle to the high pulley and grasp it with both hands, arms extended diagonally along the cable.
2. Twist your torso down and across your body, pulling the handle down towards your opposite hip while keeping your arms straight.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
2. Exhale as you twist away from the machine and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Minimize hip twisting to focus on engaging your obliques and core during the twist.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand sideways to the cable machine with your feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, knees bent at almost 90 degrees and hips pushed back.
2.  Grasp the handle, attached at hip height, with the hand closest to the machine, keeping it close to your shoulder. Place your other hand on your hip.
3. Twist your torso away from the machine while pushing the handle sideways and straight across your torso, straightening your legs to a standing position as you press the handle.
4. Slowly return to the starting semi-squat position with control, bringing the handle back to your shoulder. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you twist and press the handle across your torso, and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius), Triceps (Triceps Brachii), Legs (Quadriceps Femoris, Biceps Femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with the left foot forward and the right foot back, knees bent. Attach a handle to the low pulley and grasp it with the right hand, palm facing down. Lean forward so your upper body is almost parallel to the floor.
2. Extend your arm fully towards the pulley, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
3. Pull the handle towards your torso, rotating your wrist as you pull until your palm faces the ceiling.
4. Slowly extend your arm back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handle towards your torso and inhale as you extend it back.
2. Keep your feet firmly planted on the floor for stability.
3. Keep your core tight throughout the exercise to protect your lower back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Shoulders (Deltoids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at the lat pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Attach a wide grip bar to the high pulley and grasp it with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing back), hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull the bar down towards your upper chest by bending your elbows and bringing them down and back.
3. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid flaring them out.
3. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you extend it back up.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable crossover machine with the pulleys set at the lowest point. Grasp the handles with each hand, palms facing forward.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent. 
3. Pull the handles up and forward until they meet over your chest.
4. Slowly return your arms to the starting position. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles down and infront of your chest and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your chest muscles during the movement.

Exercise: Cable upright row with EZ bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine with an EZ bar attached to the low pulley. Grasp the EZ bar with both hands using an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull the EZ bar upwards towards your chin by bending your elbows and raising your upper arms, leading with your elbows, keeping the bar close to your body.
3. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Keep your elbows higher than your wrists throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the EZ bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Cable upright row with straight bar
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the low pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Pull the bar upwards towards your chin by bending your elbows and raising your upper arms, leading with your elbows, keeping the bar close to your body.
3. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Keep your elbows higher than your wrists throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the straight bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench facing the cable machine with a straight bar attached to the low pulley. Grasp the bar with both hands using an underhand grip (palms facing up), hands shoulder-width apart.
2. Rest your forearms on your thighs with your wrists just beyond your knees, allowing the bar to hang down.
3. Curl the bar upwards by flexing your wrists, bringing the bar towards your forearms.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your forearms stationary on your thighs throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on squeezing your forearms at the top of the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Forearms (Flexor Carpi Radialis, Flexor Carpi Ulnaris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with the pulleys set at the lowest position. Grasp a handle in each hand, holding the left handle with your right hand and the right handle with your left hand, so the cables cross in front of you.
2. Take a step back and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and arms extended down in front of you.
3. Raise the handles up and out to form a "Y" shape, keeping your arms straight but with a slight bend in the elbows. Lift until your arms are overhead.
4. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Use a lighter weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Exhale as you raise the handles and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise: Calf push stretch with hands against wall
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your right foot back and keep on your toes, keeping your leg straight and bring your left leg close to the wall, touching it with your forefoot. 
3. Press your back heel flat to the floor, pushing with your left forefoot against the wall to deepen the stretch in your calf.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight back and avoid arching or rounding your spine.
2. Use a lighter push against the wall if you are new to stretching, gradually increasing the pressure as you become more flexible.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended out to the sides at shoulder level.
2. Lift your heels off the floor as high as possible while simultaneously bringing your arms forward to clap, keeping them straight.
3. Lower your heels back to the floor and return your arms to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your head up and eyes forward to maintain proper alignment and balance.
2. Squeeze your calf muscles fully at the top of the movement for maximum benefit.
3. Focus on keeping your arms straight and level with your shoulders throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.

Exercise: Calf raise from deficit with chair supported
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the edge of a raised platform or step, with your heels hanging off the edge, and hold onto a chair for support.
2. Position your feet hip-width apart, ensuring your toes are firmly on the platform.
3. Slowly raise your heels as high as possible, engaging your calf muscles and lifting your body.
4. Lower your heels back down past the edge of the platform to feel a stretch in your calves. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use the chair for balance but avoid leaning on it heavily to ensure your legs are doing the work.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your heels drop below the platform to achieve a full range of motion and stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg press machine and position your feet shoulder-width apart on the higher portion of the footplate with your toes pointing up.
2. Press the footplate by extending your legs and keeping a slight bend in your knees.
3. Push through your forefeet to raise the footplate as much as possible, squeezing your calf muscles.
4. Slowly lower your forefeet down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your legs slightly bent throughout the exercise to avoid placing stress on your knees.
2. Focus on a full range of motion, pushing your forefeet as much as possible for deep muscle activation.
3. Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg press machine and position your feet shoulder-width apart on the higher portion of the footplate with your toes pointing up.
2. Press the footplate by extending your legs and keeping a slight bend in your knees.
3. Push through your forefeet to raise the footplate as much as possible, squeezing your calf muscles.
4. Slowly lower your forefeet down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your legs slightly bent throughout the exercise to avoid placing stress on your knees.
2. Focus on a full range of motion, pushing your forefeet as much as possible for deep muscle activation.
3. Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)

Exercise: Calf raise on hack squat machine
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the hack squat machine with your shoulders under the pads and your feet hips-width apart on the foot platform, with your toes pointing forward and your heels hanging off the edge.
2. Extend your legs to release the safety handles, keeping a slight bend in your knees.
3. Push through your forefeet to raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calf muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your legs slightly bent throughout the exercise to avoid placing stress on your knees.
2. Focus on a full range of motion, lowering your heels as much as possible for a deep muscle activation.
3. Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)

Exercise: Calf raise on hack squat machine_Female
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the hack squat machine with your shoulders under the pads and your feet hips-width apart on the foot platform, with your toes pointing forward and your heels hanging off the edge.
2. Extend your legs to release the safety handles, keeping a slight bend in your knees.
3. Push through your forefeet to raise your heels as high as possible, squeezing your calf muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your legs slightly bent throughout the exercise to avoid placing stress on your knees.
2. Focus on a full range of motion, lowering your heels as much as possible for a deep muscle activation.
3. Exhale as you raise your heels and inhale as you lower them back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height for support.
2. Position your feet flat on the floor, ensuring they are parallel to each other.
3. Slowly raise your heels as high as possible, lifting your body and engaging your calf muscles.
4. Lower your heels back to the floor in a controlled manner. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on lifting your heels fully and pausing briefly at the top of the movement to maximize muscle activation.
2. Use the wall for balance but ensure your legs are doing the work.
3. Keep your knees slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints.

Exercise: Calf stretch with hands against wall
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a wall with your feet shoulder-width apart. Place your hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step one foot back, keeping your back leg straight and your front leg slightly bent. Press your back heel into the floor.
3. Lean forward slightly, pushing against the wall to deepen the stretch in your calf.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then switch legs and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back leg straight and your heel pressed into the floor to maximize the stretch.
2. Stretch both legs equally to maintain balanced flexibility.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on the floor with your legs extended straight on the floor. Pass a rope with handles under your right forefoot, holding the handles with both hands.
2. Keep your back flat against the floor and gently pull the rope towards you, flexing your foot and bringing your toes towards your shin.
3. Straighten your leg fully to deepen the stretch in your calf muscle.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release the rope and switch to the other foot, repeating the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.
2. Use a moderate amount of tension on the rope to ensure a good stretch without causing discomfort or pain.
3. Focus on feeling the stretch in your calf muscle, not your lower back or hamstrings.

Exercise: Calve Stretch From Wall To Floor
Calve Stretch From Wall To Floor_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on a step or stair with one foot on a higher step and the other foot on a lower step, ensuring the lower foot's heel is hanging off the edge.
2. Hold onto the railing or wall for support to maintain balance.
3. Slowly lower the heel of the lower foot below the level of the step until you feel a stretch in your calf muscle.
4. Hold the stretch for the desired duration, then slowly raise your heel back to the starting position. Repeat as needed for both legs.
Exercise Tips:
Maintain an upright posture and engage your core to ensure balance and stability.
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to avoid straining your calf muscles.
2. Use the railing or wall for support but ensure your legs are performing the stretch.
3. Perform this stretch after a workout or when your muscles are warm to maximize flexibility and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the captain's chair and place your forearms on the arm pads, gripping the handles for stability. Allow your legs to hang straight down.
2. Engage your core and keep your back pressed against the back pad.
3. Raise your legs, knees first, up in front of you until your thighs are parallel to the floor and your feet are slightly forward.
4. Slowly lower your knees back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you raise your knees and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Avoid using momentum; the movement should be controlled and deliberate.
3. Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the captain's chair and place your forearms on the arm pads, gripping the handles for stability. Allow your legs to hang straight down.
2. Engage your core and keep your back pressed against the back pad.
3. Raise your legs straight up in front of you until they are parallel to the floor, keeping them as straight as possible.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the back pad to prevent swinging and maintain proper form.
2. Avoid using momentum; the movement should be controlled and deliberate.
3. Exhale as you raise your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a lunge position with your right leg forward and left leg back, ensuring your right knee is aligned over your ankle and your left knee is just above the floor. Bend both arms at your sides.
2. Explosively push off your left foot, bringing it forward in a small step while pushing  your right leg slightly backwards.
3. Immediately return your left foot back to the starting lunge position.
4. Continue the explosive movement, maintaining a steady, rhythmic pace. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions or duration, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee stays aligned with your toes to avoid putting unnecessary strain on your knee.
2. Perform the movement with a controlled pace to maximize cardiovascular benefits and prevent injury.
3. Use your arms to help balance and stabilize your movements.
4. Focus on the explosive movement of the back leg to engage your glutes and hamstrings.
5. Breathe steadily throughout the exercise, inhaling as you bring your leg forward and exhaling as you return to the lunge position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees aligned under your hips.
2. Inhale deeply, then slowly arch your back upwards towards the ceiling, tucking your chin towards your chest and drawing your navel in towards your spine.
3. Hold the arched position for a few seconds, feeling the stretch along your spine and back muscles.
4. Exhale and slowly return to the starting tabletop position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on your breath, inhaling deeply as you arch your back and exhaling as you return to the starting position.
2. Ensure your wrists and knees remain aligned throughout the exercise to maintain proper form and avoid strain.
3. Relax your neck and avoid straining it as you tuck your chin towards your chest.
4. Perform this stretch as part of a cool-down routine or whenever you need to relieve tension in your back.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a tabletop position on all fours, with your wrists aligned under your shoulders and your knees aligned under your hips.
2. Slowly lift your torso upwards, arching your back gently and leaning backward.
3. Allow your hands to slide down to your legs, supporting your upper body as you look up towards the ceiling.
4. Hold this position for the desired duration and slowly return to the starting tabletop position. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe deeply and evenly, inhaling as you lift your torso and exhaling as you return to the starting position.
2. Avoid forcing the stretch; only lean back as far as is comfortable without causing pain.
3. Use a mat or cushion under your knees for added comfort and support.
4. Perform this stretch to enhance flexibility in your spine and relieve tension in your chest and neck.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight up in the air.
2. Simultaneously bend your elbows and thrust your arms downwards to your hips while thrusting your hips forward.
3. Return to the initial position with your arms extended overhead and your hips back in the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement with a controlled pace, focusing on the coordinated motion of your arms and hips.
2. Use the downward thrust of your arms to help generate momentum for the hip thrust.
3. Keep your feet firmly planted on the floor to maintain stability.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: Chair back lunge left Resistance band
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach one end of a resistance band to a sturdy chair or similar support and the other end to your left ankle. Stand facing the chair with your right foot firmly planted on the floor.
2. Step back with your left foot, keeping your right foot in place, and lower your body into a lunge position by bending both knees, ensuring your right knee is directly above your right ankle and your left knee is hovering just above the floor.
3. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a lighter resistance band if needed to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
2. Focus on keeping your front knee aligned over your ankle to avoid putting excess strain on your knee joint.
3. Maintain balance by keeping your hands steady and holding the chair.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: chair back lunge right Resistance band
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach one end of a resistance band to a sturdy chair or similar support and the other end to your right ankle. Stand facing the chair with your left foot firmly planted on the floor.
2. Step back with your right foot, keeping your left foot in place, and lower your body into a lunge position by bending both knees, ensuring your left knee is directly above your left ankle and your right knee is hovering just above the floor.
3. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a lighter resistance band if needed to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
2. Focus on keeping your front knee aligned over your ankle to avoid putting excess strain on your knee joint.
3. Maintain balance by keeping your hands steady and holding the chair.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand a few feet in front of a chair, facing away from it. Place your one foot on the chair behind you, with the top of your foot resting on the seat.
2. Position your other foot firmly on the floor, a comfortable distance in front of the chair.
