4. Lower into the next push-up with control, immediately repeating the explosive movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your movements controlled and focus on generating power in the push without lifting off the floor.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you push up explosively and inhaling as you lower down.
3. Focus on explosive power and control rather than speed to maximize effectiveness.
4. Use a non-slip surface to prevent your hands from slipping during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet wide apart, about 3-4 feet, with your right foot turned out 90 degrees and your left foot slightly turned in. Place your hands on your hips.
2. Bend your right knee, ensuring it aligns over your right ankle, and lower your right thigh until it is parallel to the floor. Extend your left leg straight.
3. Lean to your right side by bending your right knee further and place your right elbow on your right thigh. Raise your left arm overhead, creating a straight line from your left hand to your left foot.
4. Hold the position for a moment, then return to the starting position with control. Repeat on the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your bent knee is aligned with your ankle to avoid strain on the knee joint.
2. Only stretch as far as is comfortable without causing pain or discomfort.
3. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you extend into the stretch and exhaling as you hold the stretch.
4. Use a yoga block or modify the hand placement if needed for additional support.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise: Extended side Angle Pose With Block
Extended side Angle Pose With Block_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your back straight and shoulders relaxed.
2. Slowly rotate your head to the left side while diagonally lowering your head, bringing your chin towards your left shoulder to feel a stretch in your neck.
3. Hold the stretch for a few seconds, breathing deeply and steadily.
4. Return to the neutral position and repeat on the other side by rotating your head to the right and diagonally lowering your head towards your right shoulder. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain good posture with your back straight and shoulders relaxed throughout the exercise.
2. Perform the stretches in a smooth, fluid motion to enhance flexibility and reduce muscle tension.
3. Avoid overextending your neck; only stretch as far as is comfortable without causing pain or discomfort.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back Muscles (Upper Trapezius), Neck Muscles (Levator Scapulae)

Exercise: Extension Of Arms In Vertical Stretch
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, your back straight, and your core engaged.
2. Raise your arms overhead, interlocking your fingers and turning your palms upward.
3. Stretch upwards as much as possible, lengthening your spine and reaching towards the ceiling. Hold the position for 15-30 seconds.
4. Slowly release the stretch and bring your arms back down to your sides. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to maximize the stretch and avoid any sudden movements.
2. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you reach upwards and exhaling as you hold the stretch.
3. Avoid arching your back; instead, focus on lengthening your spine.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Arms (Biceps Brachii, Triceps Brachii), Forearms (Flexor Carpi Radialis, Flexor Carpi Ulnaris)

Exercise: Ez bar biceps curl close grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with hands closer than shoulder-width, palms facing forward, and your arms fully extended down.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize biceps activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Ez bar biceps curl normal grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with hands at shoulder-width, palms facing forward, and your arms fully extended down.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize biceps activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Ez bar biceps curl wide grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with hands just wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward, and your arms fully extended down.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your chest by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize biceps activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Ez bar cable curl wide grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar attached to the low pulley, hands just wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your shoulder by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize biceps activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: Ez bar cable curl wide grip crossover machine
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar attached to the low pulley of a crossover machine, hands just wider than shoulder-width, palms facing forward.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your shoulder by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary and close to your body.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize biceps activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you curl the bar up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with an overhand grip. Raise the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended, with your hands positioned closer together on the bar.
2. Keep your elbows close to your head and slowly lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows.
3. Lower the bar until your arms are fully bent.
4. Extend your elbows to raise the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms overhead.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your elbows remain close to your head throughout the movement to effectively target the triceps.
2. Use a controlled motion and avoid swinging the bar or using momentum.
3. Avoid locking your elbows at the top of the movement to maintain tension on the triceps.

Exercise: Ez bar seated close grip shoulder press
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with back support, holding an EZ bar with a close overhand grip. Position the bar at shoulder height with your palms facing your neck and your elbows pointing forward.
2. Press the bar overhead by extending your elbows upward.
3. Fully extend your arms without locking your elbows at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position at shoulder height with control, keeping your elbows pointing forward.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your elbows stay in front of you throughout the movement to effectively target the shoulders.
2. Avoid locking your elbows at the top to keep tension on the shoulder muscles.
3. Inhale as you lower the bar and exhale as you press it overhead.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench holding an EZ bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up). Rest your forearms on your thighs with your wrists just beyond the edge, allowing the bar to hang down.
2. Curl your wrists upward by flexing your forearms, lifting the EZ bar as high as possible while keeping your forearms stationary on your thighs.
3. Squeeze your forearms at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled manner, allowing your wrists to fully extend.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your forearms stationary on your thighs throughout the exercise.
2. Use a controlled motion and avoid using momentum or swinging the bar.
3. Avoid lifting your forearms off your thighs to ensure proper isolation of the forearm muscles.
Primary Activating Muscles: Forearms (Flexor Carpi Radialis, Flexor Carpi Ulnaris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ bar with an overhand grip (palms facing down), hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Let the bar hang in front of your thighs.
2. Raise the EZ bar directly in front of you to shoulder height until parallel to the floor.
3. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder muscles.
4. Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift the bar; focus on a controlled motion.
2. Exhale as you lift the bar and inhale as you lower it.
3. Keep your wrists in a neutral position to avoid strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest first on an incline bench, holding an EZ barbell with palms facing the floor, hands positioned shoulder-width apart. Hold the barbell close to your shoulders, just under your face, with elbows bent.
2. Press the barbell forward in a straight line until your arms are fully extended, keeping the bar parallel to the floor.
3. Pause briefly at the end of the movement, ensuring your arms are straight and the barbell is fully extended forward.
4. Return the barbell back to the starting position with control, bringing it close to your shoulders. Repeat the exercise.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum; focus on a controlled and steady motion.
2. Exhale as you press the barbell forward and inhale as you lower it.
3. Focus on using your shoulders to press the weight, minimizing lower back involvement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ barbell with a close grip (hands positioned closer than shoulder-width apart) and palms facing up.
2. Curl the barbell upward towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, focusing on engaging your biceps.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the barbell reaches shoulder height.
4. Lower the barbell back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows stationary and close to your body throughout the movement.
2. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body to lift the barbell.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding an EZ barbell with a normal grip (hands positioned at shoulder-width apart) and palms facing up.
2. Curl the barbell upward towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, focusing on engaging your biceps.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the barbell reaches shoulder height.
4. Lower the barbell back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows stationary and close to your body throughout the movement.
2. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body to lift the barbell.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and your arms at your sides.
2. Quickly alternate lifting your feet off the floor, moving them up and down rapidly as if running in place, but without moving forward.
3. Keep your core engaged and maintain a slight bend in your knees to stay light on your feet.
4. Continue the rapid foot movement for the desired duration, maintaining a steady and controlled pace.
Exercise Tips:
1. Stay on your forefeet to maintain quick, light movements.
2. Use your arms for balance, allowing them to move naturally as your feet move.
3. Focus on quick, controlled movements to maximize speed and effectiveness.
4. Breathe steadily throughout the exercise, inhaling through your nose and exhaling through your mouth.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet together, holding a barbell across your upper back with an overhand grip. Ensure the barbell is balanced and rests comfortably on your traps.
2. Slowly lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hips, keeping your knees aligned with your toes.
3. Lower yourself until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor, or as low as your flexibility allows, without compromising form.
4. Push through your heels to stand back up, extending your knees and hips to return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet together throughout the entire movement to maintain balance and stability.
2. Ensure your knees track over your toes and do not cave inward.
3. Maintain a neutral spine and keep your chest up to avoid rounding your back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin on the floor in an all-fours position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
2. Keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle, lift your right leg out to the side until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Keep your hips level and avoid rotating your torso.
3. Hold the position for a moment, then lower your right leg back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left leg and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid rotating your hips or torso; focus on isolating the movement in your hip.
2. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping or injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your leg and inhaling as you lower it.
4. Ensure your hands are positioned directly under your shoulders to maintain proper form and prevent strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin on the floor in an all-fours position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
2. Keeping your knee bent at a 90-degree angle, lift your right leg out to the side until your thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Move your right leg in a circular motion, making small controlled circles with your knee while keeping your hips level and avoiding torso rotation.
4. Complete the desired number of circles, then lower your right leg back to the starting position. Repeat on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid rotating your hips or torso; focus on isolating the movement in your hip.
2. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping or injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your leg and inhaling as you lower it.
4. Ensure your hands are positioned directly under your shoulders to maintain proper form and prevent strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a fixed vertical bar. Position your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the bar with both hands, palms facing each other.
2. Step back slightly and lean your hips backward, allowing your arms to extend fully and your upper body to lean forward. Keep your back straight and your knees bent.
3. Lean backwards and down to the floor while pulling back with your hips to feel a deep stretch in your shoulders, upper back, and lats.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and steadily. Slowly return to the starting position by stepping forward and releasing the bar.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to maximize the stretch and avoid any sudden movements.
2. Only stretch as far as is comfortable without causing pain or discomfort.
3. Ensure the bar is securely fixed and can support your weight.
Primary Activating Muscles: Shoulders (Deltoids), Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position a flat bench between two cable machines with the pulleys set at the lowest position. Attach handles to the pulleys and lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the floor.
2. Grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing up, and extend your arms out to your sides at chest level.
3. Raise the handles over your chest in a wide arc, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, squeezing your chest at the top.
4. Slowly bring the handles back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement to avoid straining your joints.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Inhale as you loer the handles back down and exhale as you raise them up.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Position a resistance band under your upper back, holding a handle in each hand with your palms facing forward.
2. Position your elbows on the floor bent at a 90-degree angle.
3. Press the handles straight up towards the ceiling until your arms are fully extended, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press the handles up and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter resistance band if needed to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides, palms facing down. Place your hands under your hips for added support if needed.
2. Lift your legs off the floor a few inches, keeping them straight and close together.
3. Quickly alternate kicking your legs up and down in a small, controlled motion, engaging your core throughout the movement.
4. Continue the flutter kicks for the desired duration, maintaining a steady and controlled pace. Lower your legs back to the floor to complete the exercise.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move your legs in a controlled manner to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you kick your legs and inhaling as you maintain the movement.
3. Avoid letting your lower back arch off the floor; keep it pressed down to prevent strain.
4. Adjust the height of your kicks to suit your fitness level and comfort, starting with smaller kicks and increasing the range of motion as you build strength.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, placing the resistance band under both feet. Hold the handles of the resistance band with your palms facing backwards and your arms extended down in front of you.
2. Raise your arms straight in front of you to shoulder height, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your shoulder muscles throughout the movement.
2. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.
3. Stand with a slight bend in your knees for better stability.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms facing your hips), hands placed at shoulder-width.
2. Lift the barbell in front of you by raising your arms straight out until they are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the barbell at the top of the movement for a brief moment, ensuring your shoulders are fully engaged.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position in a controlled manner, keeping your arms straight throughout the movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift the barbell; focus on using your shoulder muscles.
2. Keep your core engaged to prevent arching your lower back.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Chest (Pectoralis Major, Clavicular Head), Upper Back (Trapezius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing down), arms hanging down by your sides.
2. Lift the dumbbells in front of you by raising your arms straight forward until they are at head height.
3. Hold the dumbbells at the top of the movement for a brief moment, ensuring your shoulders are fully engaged.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift the dumbbells; focus on using your shoulder muscles.
2. Keep your core engaged to prevent arching your lower back.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Chest (Pectoralis Major, Clavicular Head), Upper Back (Trapezius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a bar with both hands, palms facing down, and hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your arms straight down in front of you at shoulder height, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
3. Gently raise the bar overhead and bend them both at 90 degrees to lower them until you feel a stretch in your shoulders.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds. Repeat as needed.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid arching or rounding your spine.
2. Use a lighter bar to ensure proper form and gradually increase the stretch as you become more flexible.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily throughout the stretch to help relax your muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly out. Hold a dumbbell in each hand, hanging by your sides, with your palms facing each other.
2. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hinging at your hips, pushing your knees lightly outwards as you descend.
3. Continue lowering yourself until your thighs are just lower than parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees track over your toes and do not cave inward during the squat.
2. Maintain a straight back and avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Keep your chest up and your shoulders back to maintain proper posture.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Position the dumbbells over your shoulders with your palms facing forward and elbows pointing down.
2. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hinging at your hips, pushing your knees lightly outwards as you descend.
3. Continue lowering yourself until your thighs are just lower than parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees track over your toes and do not cave inward during the squat.
2. Maintain a straight back and avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Keep your chest up and your shoulders back to maintain proper posture.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand. Place the kettlebells resting on opposite shoulders with your palms facing down and elbows pointing forward.
2. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hinging at your hips, pushing your knees lightly outwards as you descend.
3. Continue lowering yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees track over your toes and do not cave inward during the squat.
2. Maintain a straight back and avoid leaning forward excessively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a full planche position with your hands placed on the floor shoulder-width apart and your body parallel to the floor, fully supported by your hands. Your legs should be extended straight behind you, and your core and glutes engaged to maintain a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a horizontal position throughout the movement.
3. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting planche position.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining control and stability throughout the exercise.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core and glutes to maintain a straight body line and prevent sagging or arching.
2. Ensure your hands are positioned directly under your shoulders to maintain proper form and support.
3. Use a non-slip surface to prevent your hands from slipping during the exercise.
4. This is an advanced exercise; ensure you have adequate strength and balance before attempting it.

Exercise: Gate Pose Rounding Spine Looking Up

Gate Pose Variation Arm Extended on Side

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place your arms at your sides with palms facing down.
2. Engage your core and glutes and lift your hips towards the ceiling until your body forms a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
3. While holding the bridge position, spread your knees apart as far as comfortable, keeping your feet flat on the floor.
4. Bring your knees back together, then lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your hips remain lifted and in line with your body during the abduction movement.
2. Avoid letting your knees collapse inward; maintain control during the abduction movement.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lift your hips and spread your knees, and inhaling as you lower your hips.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands, gripping at the handle.
2. Lower your body into a squat by bending your knees and hinging at your hips.
3. Continue lowering yourself until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
4. Push through your heels to return to the starting position, extending your hips and knees. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees track over your toes and do not cave inward during the squat.
2. Maintain a straight back and avoid leaning forward excessively.
3. Breathe in as you lower into the squat and exhale as you push back up to the starting position.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, placing a resistance band under both feet. Hold a handle with each hand and place it close to your shoulders.
2. Hinge at your hips to lower your torso forward until it is almost parallel to the floor, keeping your back straight.
3. Slowly return to the starting position by extending your hips and knees to raise your torso.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your spine.
2. Focus on engaging your glutes and hamstrings throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you raise your torso and inhale as you lower it.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back with an overhand grip.
2. Begin to hinge at your hips, pushing your hips back while lowering your torso towards the floor.
3. Continue to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the floor.
4. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and raising your torso back up. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight back and avoid rounding your spine.
2. Focus on hinging at the hips rather than bending at the waist.
3. Keep a slight bend in your knees to reduce stress on your lower back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand. Bring the dumbbells at shoulder height, with your elbows bent and pointing forward.
2. Begin to hinge at your hips, pushing your hips back while lowering your torso towards the floor.
3. Continue to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the floor, feeling a stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and raising your torso back up. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight back and avoid rounding your spine.
2. Focus on hinging at the hips rather than bending at the waist.
3. Keep a slight bend in your knees to reduce stress on your lower back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell with both hands at chest height. Keep your elbows bent and pointing downward.
2. Begin to hinge at your hips, pushing your hips back while lowering your torso towards the floor.
3. Continue to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the floor, feeling a stretch in your hamstrings.
4. Return to the starting position by driving your hips forward and raising your torso back up. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight back and avoid rounding your spine.
2. Focus on hinging at the hips rather than bending at the waist.
3. Keep a slight bend in your knees to reduce stress on your lower back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Step on the elliptical machine and place your feet securely on the pedals. Grip the handles with both hands for stability.
2. Begin moving your legs in a smooth, elliptical motion, coordinating with the handles as they move back and forth. Start at a moderate pace to get comfortable with the movement.
3. Gradually increase your speed to a fast pace, maintaining a smooth and controlled motion with both your legs and arms.
4. Continue pedaling and moving the handles at a fast pace for the desired duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily and deeply to maintain oxygen flow during the exercise.
2. Focus on using both your legs and arms to distribute the effort evenly and prevent early fatigue.
3. Adjust the resistance level if needed to provide a challenging but manageable workout.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Shoulders (Deltoids), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the rowing machine with your feet securely strapped into the footrests, knees bent, and hands grasping the handle with an overhand grip.
2. Push through your legs to extend your knees and drive your body backward, keeping your arms straight until your legs are almost fully extended.
3. Just before your legs are fully extended, pull the handle towards your lower chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Reverse the motion by extending your arms forward first, then bending your knees to return to the starting position. Repeat the motion at a fast pace for the desired duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your spine throughout the exercise.
2. Use a moderate resistance level to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Exhale as you pull, and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Back (Latissimus Dorsi)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Shoulders (Deltoids), Arms (Biceps, Triceps), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself on the hack squat machine with your shoulders under the pads and your feet shoulder-width apart on the foot platform. Keep your back pressed against the backrest.
2. Release the safety handles and slowly lower your body by bending your knees until your thighs are parallel to the foot platform.
3. Push through your heels to extend your legs and return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on keeping your knees aligned with your toes to avoid straining your joints.
3. Exhale as you push up and inhale as you lower your body.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Quickly jump your feet forward towards your hands, landing with your heels on the floor in a squat position.
3. Immediately jump your feet back to return to the high plank position, keeping your body straight and your core engaged.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a quick and controlled pace.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you jump your feet forward and back, and inhaling as you hold the plank position.
2. Ensure your hands are placed directly under your shoulders in the plank position to maintain proper form and prevent strain.
3. Use a non-slip surface to prevent your feet or hands from slipping during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, placing the resistance band under both feet. Hold the handles with your palms facing each other and your arms extended down at your sides.
2. Curl the handles up towards your shoulders simultaneously by bending your elbows, keeping your palms facing each other throughout the movement.
3. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your body and avoid swinging your arms.
2. Focus on engaging your biceps and forearms throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise: HAMMER STRENGTH ISO-LATERAL LEG CURL Alternating Legs_Female
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the Hammer Strength Iso-Lateral Leg Curl machine, placing your ankles under the leg pads and holding the handles on the sides of the machine for stability. Start with both legs fully extended.
2. Curl one leg by bending your knee and pulling your ankle towards your glutes, keeping the other leg extended.
3. Squeeze your hamstrings at the top of the movement and slowly lower your leg back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat with the other leg, alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips pressed against the bench throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your hamstrings throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl your leg and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise: HAMMER STRENGTH Plate-Loaded Combination Iso-Lateral Chest Chest Press_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides.
2. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your chest until thigh is vertical to the floor, interlacing your fingers behind your thigh.
3. Slowly straighten your right leg, extending your heel towards the ceiling and feeling the stretch in your hamstring. Keep your left leg extended and flat on the floor.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly bend your right knee and lower your leg back to the starting position. Repeat on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor to maintain proper alignment and support.
2. Engage your core to stabilize your body and prevent your back from arching.
3. Move slowly and with control to maximize the stretch and avoid any sudden movements.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides.
2. Lift your right leg towards the ceiling, keeping it straight. Use both hands to gently hold the back of your right leg, just below the knee or higher if possible.
3. Pull your right leg gently towards your torso, feeling the stretch in your hamstring. Keep your left leg extended and flat on the floor.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly lower your right leg back to the starting position. Repeat on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to maximize the stretch and avoid any sudden movements.
2. Perform the stretch on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat, to prevent discomfort or injury.
3. Only stretch as far as is comfortable without causing pain or discomfort.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by placing a sturdy chair against a wall for stability. Position yourself in front of the chair, with your back facing it.
2. Place your hands on the floor slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, about a foot away from the chair. Kick up into a handstand position, with your feet resting on the seat of the chair.
3. Slowly lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping your body straight and your core engaged.
4. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting handstand position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent arching your back.
2. Keep your movements slow and controlled to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing forward or towards each other. Allow your body to hang straight with your feet off the floor.
2. Engage your core and, keeping your legs together, bend your knees and lift them towards your chest.
3. Raise your knees as high as comfortably possible, aiming to bring them towards your chest.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid swinging your body; use controlled movements to lift and lower your legs.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lift your knees and inhaling as you lower them.
3. Ensure your grip on the bar is secure to prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Hang from a pull-up bar with your hands shoulder-width apart, palms facing forward or towards each other. Allow your body to hang straight with your feet off the floor.
2. Engage your core and, keeping your legs together, bend your knees and lift them towards your right elbow, twisting your torso to engage your obliques.
3. Raise your knees as high as comfortably possible, aiming to bring them towards your elbow.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat the movement, this time lifting your knees towards your left elbow. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid swinging your body; use controlled movements to lift and lower your legs.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lift your knees and twist, and inhaling as you lower them.
3. Ensure your grip on the bar is secure to prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Position your arms along your sides with your palms facing down.
2. Lift your shoulders slightly off the floor, engaging your core and keeping your neck relaxed.
3. Reach your right hand towards your right heel, bending your torso to the side. Return to the center and then reach your left hand towards your left heel.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled manner, maintaining the contraction in your core throughout the exercise. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise and prevent injury.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you reach towards your heel and inhaling as you return to the center.
3. Ensure your lower back remains pressed into the floor to prevent strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a rope handle to a high pulley on a cable machine. Kneel down facing the machine, holding the rope handles with both hands, and position them close to your head.
2. Keep your back straight and engage your core muscles topull the rope down by crunching your torso towards your knees, bringing your elbows towards your thighs.
3. Just before your elbows touch your thighs, return to the starting position with control, keeping the tension on the cable.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees are firmly planted on the floor for stability.
2. Keep your hips stable and avoid using momentum.
3. Exhale as you crunch down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms raised to shoulder height in front of you, palms facing down.
2. Lift your right knee towards your left elbow while simultaneously twisting your torso to the right, engaging your core.
3. Return to the starting position, then lift your left knee towards your right elbow while twisting your torso to the left.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled manner, maintaining a steady rhythm. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Twist your torso and lift your knee simultaneously to engage both your abs and obliques.
2. Move smoothly and with control to avoid straining your back or hips.
3. Ensure your movements are balanced and controlled to prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Begin by lifting your right knee towards your chest as high as possible while simultaneously swinging your left arm forward.
3. Quickly switch to lift your left knee towards your chest while swinging your right arm forward, mimicking a running motion.
4. Continue to alternate knees rapidly, maintaining a steady rhythm and engaging your core. Repeat for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Lift your knees as high as possible while maintaining proper form and balance.
2. Move quickly but with control to maximize cardiovascular benefits and prevent injury.
3. Ensure your movements are balanced and coordinated to avoid straining your muscles.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin on the floor on your hands and knees. Position your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.
2. Extend your legs straight back, one at a time, coming onto the balls of your feet to form a straight line from your head to your heels. Your body should be in a high plank position.
3. Engage your core, glutes, and legs to maintain a straight body line. Keep your shoulders directly over your wrists.
4. Hold the plank position for the desired amount of time, maintaining proper form and steady breathing.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and prevent sagging or arching of your back.
2. Ensure your hands are positioned directly under your shoulders to support your weight evenly.
3. Breathe steadily, inhaling through your nose and exhaling through your mouth to help maintain focus and endurance.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a resistance band to a high anchor point. Kneel down facing the anchor point, holding the handles of the resistance band with both hands, bend your arms at 90 degrees to bring your hands close to your face, palms facing each other.
2. Pull the resistance band down by crunching your torso towards your knees, bringing your elbows towards your thighs.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control, keeping the tension on the band. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your knees are firmly planted on the floor for stability.
2. Keep your hips stable and avoid using momentum.
3. Exhale as you crunch down and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise: Hold the world med ball chest press
Hold the world med ball chest press_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms stretched overhead.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders and legs off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed into the floor. Your body should form a slight curve with your arms and legs elevated.
3. Hold this position, maintaining tension in your core and keeping your lower back flat against the floor.
4. Continue to hold the position for the desired duration, then slowly lower your shoulders and legs back to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your shoulders and legs are lifted at the same height to create a balanced position.
2. Focus on steady breathing, inhaling through your nose and exhaling through your mouth to help maintain focus and endurance.
3. If the full hollow hold is too challenging, you can modify the position by bending your knees or keeping your arms by your sides.
4. Avoid straining your neck; keep it relaxed and in line with your spine.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
2. Lower your hips, jump up and land into a squat position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width.
3. Then lower your hips again, jump up, and land into a squat position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed hip-width apart this time.
4. Repeat by jumping in and out alternately.
Exercise Tips:
1. Land softly on your forefeet to reduce impact on your joints.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes when you squat to avoid strain.
3. Move quickly but with control to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise: In and out squats jump bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand tall with your back straight, feet shoulder-width apart, and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
2. Lower your hips, jump up and land into a squat position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed wider than your shoulder width.
3. Then lower your hips again, jump up, and land into a squat position with your knees bent, thighs parallel to the floor, and feet placed hip-width apart this time.
4. Repeat by jumping in and out alternately.
Exercise Tips:
1. Land softly on your forefeet to reduce impact on your joints.
2. Ensure your knees are aligned with your toes when you squat to avoid strain.
3. Move quickly but with control to maximize the effectiveness of the exercise and prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Set an incline bench between two cable machines with the pulleys positioned at the middle setting. Lie back on the bench with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp a handle in each hand, with your palms facing up and your arms extended to your sides.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your back pressed firmly against the bench.
3. Raise the handles opposite your chest in a wide arc, until your arms are level with your chest, squeezing your chest muscles at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the handles back the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise to avoid straining your joints.
2. Keep your back and head pressed firmly against the bench.
3. Exhale as you bring the handles up and inhale as you lower them down.

Exercise: incline diamond push up On Bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself facing a bench. Place your hands on the edge of the bench close together so that your thumbs and index fingers form a diamond shape.
2. Step your feet back to extend your legs fully, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core to maintain stability.
3. Lower your chest towards the bench by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
4. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower down.
3. Avoid flaring your elbows out to the sides; keep them close to your body to engage your triceps more effectively.
4. Use a stable, non-slip bench to prevent any movement or slipping during the exercise.

Exercise: Incline diamond push up on bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself facing a bench. Place your hands on the edge of the bench close together so that your thumbs and index fingers form a diamond shape.
2. Step your feet back to extend your legs fully, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core to maintain stability.
3. Lower your chest towards the bench by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
4. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower down.
3. Avoid flaring your elbows out to the sides; keep them close to your body to engage your triceps more effectively.
4. Use a stable, non-slip bench to prevent any movement or slipping during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Set an adjustable bench to a 45-degree incline and sit back against it with your feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your arms fully extended down by your sides, palms facing forward (supinated grip).
2. Engage your core and keep your elbows close to your torso. Slowly curl both dumbbells up towards your shoulders simultaneously, maintaining the supinated grip with your palms facing upward.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on a full range of motion, ensuring you fully extend your arms at the bottom of each curl.
2. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows at the start to avoid locking them out.
3. Keep your upper arms stationary and close to your torso to isolate the biceps effectively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Adjust an incline bench to a 45-degree angle and lie chest-first against it, with your feet firmly planted on the floor for stability.
2. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), allowing the dumbbells to hang down towards the floor in line with your shoulders.
3. Keeping your arms slightly bent at the elbows, raise the dumbbells up and out to the sides until they reach shoulder height.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the movement to reduce joint strain.
2. Keep your body stabilized against the bench to isolate your shoulder muscles.
3. Use a slow and controlled motion to maximize muscle engagement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a chair and place your hands on top, close to the edge, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Step your feet back to extend your legs behind you, forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Engage your core and keep your body straight. Lower your chest towards the chair by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body.
3. Lower yourself until your chest is close to the chair, then push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push up and inhale as you lower yourself down.
2. Use a chair that can support your weight without moving.
3. Keep your core engaged to maintain a straight body line and avoid sagging your hips.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand facing a sturdy box and place your hands on top, close to the edge, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Step your feet back to extend your legs behind you, forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Engage your core and keep your body straight. Lower your chest towards the box by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body.
3. Lower yourself until your chest is close to the box, then push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the starting position. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push up and inhale as you lower yourself down.
2. Use a sturdy box or bench that can support your weight without moving.
3. Keep your core engaged to maintain a straight body line and avoid sagging your hips.

Exercise: Intermediate hip flexor and quad stretch
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your stomach with your legs extended and your arms at your sides. Position an elastic cable around your right ankle.
2. Bend your right knee to bring your foot towards your glutes, holding the elastic cable in your both hands.
3. Gently pull on the cable to bring your foot closer to your glutes, feeling the stretch in your quadriceps. Hold this position for a moment.
4. Extend your right leg lightly backwards, allowing the cable to provide resistance and deepen the stretch in your hip flexor and quadriceps. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you extend your leg and exhaling as you pull your foot towards your glutes.
2. If you find it difficult to reach the cable, use a longer strap or adjust the tension to ensure a comfortable stretch.
3. Ensure your head and neck remain in a neutral position, looking down towards the floor to avoid strain.
4. Perform the stretch on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat, to prevent discomfort or injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position a bar on the smith machine at about waist height. Lie on your back underneath the bar with your legs extended and your heels on the floor.
2. Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. Engage your core and pull your chest towards the bar by bending your elbows, keeping your body in a straight line from head to heels.
4. Lower yourself back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your back muscles to pull yourself up, rather than your arms.
2. Adjust the height of the bar or your foot position to make the exercise easier or harder as needed.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you pull up and inhaling as you lower yourself down.
4. Ensure the bar is securely locked in place on the smith machine to prevent any movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended out to your sides, forming a T-shape, and your legs extended straight.
2. Lift your right leg towards the ceiling, keeping it straight, and then lower it across your body towards your left hand while keeping your shoulders flat on the floor.
3. Allow your right leg to lower as far as comfortably possible, feeling a stretch in your lower back, glutes, and hamstrings.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly return your right leg to the starting position. Repeat on the other side with your left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Only stretch as far as is comfortable without causing pain or discomfort.
2. Perform the stretch on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat, to prevent discomfort or injury.
3. If you have limited flexibility, bend your knee slightly to reduce strain and gradually work towards straightening your leg.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise: Iso Lateral Shoulder Press Alternate Arms
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the Iso-Lateral Shoulder Press machine, back pressed against the backrest and feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with both hands, palms facing forward.
2. Press one handle upward by extending your arm fully while keeping the other arm stationary.
3. Squeeze your shoulder muscles at the top of the movement and slowly return the handle to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat with the other arm, alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your shoulder muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you press the handle upward and inhale as you return it to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms stretched on your sides.
2. Simultaneously lift your upper body and legs towards each other, reaching your hands towards your feet. Engage your core to lift both your torso and legs.
3. Try to touch your hands to your feet at the top of the movement, forming a "V" shape with your body.
4. Slowly lower your upper body and legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. If the full movement is too challenging, modify by bending your knees slightly.
2. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lift your body and inhaling as you lower it.
3. Ensure your lower back remains pressed into the floor during the movement to prevent strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and your arms relaxed by your sides. Engage your core and maintain an upright posture.
2. Begin jogging by taking short, quick steps, lifting your knees slightly higher than walking pace.
3. Swing your arms naturally with each step, keeping them bent at a 90-degree angle.
4. Maintain a steady, comfortable pace and continue jogging for the desired duration or distance.
Exercise Tips:
1. Gradually increase your jogging duration and intensity to build endurance and strength.
2. Breathe steadily and rhythmically to maintain oxygen flow during the jog.
3. Stay hydrated and take breaks if needed, especially during longer jogging sessions.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet together, holding a jump rope with the handles in each hand. Position the rope behind you, ready to swing it over your head.
2. Swing the rope over your head and, as it passes under your feet, lift one foot off the floor, quickly followed by the other foot, allowing the rope to pass beneath both feet in succession.
3. Continue to alternate feet with each jump, lifting one foot after the other, maintaining a steady rhythm and keeping your jumps low and controlled.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired duration or number of repetitions, ensuring a smooth and continuous motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on quick, controlled movements, keeping your jumps low to minimize impact on your joints.
2. Use your wrists to swing the rope, rather than your arms, to maintain a smooth and efficient motion.
3. Wear supportive footwear to protect your feet and ankles during the exercise.

1. Stand with your feet together, holding a jump rope with the handles in each hand. Position the rope behind you, ready to swing it over your head.
2. Swing the rope over your head and, as it passes under your feet, jump with both feet simultaneously, keeping your jumps low to the floor.
3. Land softly on your forefeet and immediately swing the rope over your head again for the next jump.
4. Continue jumping at a steady rhythm, maintaining a smooth and continuous motion for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

2. Use your wrists to swing the rope, rather than your arms, to maintain a smooth and efficient motion.
3. Wear supportive footwear to protect your feet and ankles during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet together, holding a jump rope with the handles in each hand. Position the rope behind you, ready to swing it over your head.
2. Swing the rope over your head and, as it passes under your feet, perform a small jump, landing on your forefeet.
3. Immediately perform a second smaller bounce while keeping the rope in motion and preparing for the next swing.
4. Continue with the double bounce rhythm, maintaining a smooth and controlled motion for the desired duration or number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on quick, controlled movements, keeping your jumps low to minimize impact on your joints.
2. Use your wrists to swing the rope, rather than your arms, to maintain a smooth and efficient motion.
3. Wear supportive footwear to protect your feet and ankles during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Loop the jump rope over a vertical bar or similar stable structure, ensuring the rope is at about hip height. Stand facing the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handles of the jump rope with both hands.
2. Step back slightly to create tension in the rope, keeping your core engaged and your back straight.
3. Pull the rope towards your face by bending your elbows and bringing your hands towards your ears, engaging your upper back and shoulder muscles.
4. Extend your arms back out to the starting position with control. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together as you pull the rope towards your face to maximize muscle engagement.
2. Move slowly  with control and avoid using momentum to prevent injury.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you pull the rope towards your face and inhaling as you extend your arms back out.
4. Ensure the vertical bar or structure is stable and can support the tension in the rope to prevent slipping or injury.
