Exercise: Leg press wide high stance behind view
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg press machine and position your feet just wider than shoulder-width, high in the center of the foot platform, keeping your feet flat and parallel. Adjust the seat so that your knees are bent at about a 90-degree angle.
2. Hold the handles on the sides of the seat for stability. Keep your back pressed against the backrest and your core engaged.
3. Press through your heels to extend your legs, pushing the platform away from you until your legs are fully extended but not locked at the knees.
4. Slowly return to the starting position by bending your knees with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Ensure both feet remain flat on the platform for better stability and muscle balance.
3. Exhale as you press the platform away and inhale as you return to the starting position.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Position yourself on a captain's chair, supporting your body weight with your forearms on the arm pads and your back against the backrest. Let your legs hang straight down.
2. Engage your core and keep your legs straight. Lift both legs together while keeping them straight.
3. Raise your legs until they are parallel to the floor or as high as you can comfortably go, maintaining control throughout the movement.
4. Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position without swinging. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid swinging your legs or using momentum; focus on controlled movements to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your legs and inhaling as you lower them.
3. Ensure your arms and shoulders remain stable to support your body weight effectively.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by sitting on the floor with your legs extended straight together in front of you. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
2. Slowly bend forward at the hips, reaching your hands towards your feet. Keep your legs straight and your toes pointing up.
3. Continue to reach forward, aiming to touch your toes or go as far as your flexibility allows. Allow your head and neck to relax as you stretch.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and steadily.
Exercise Tips:
1. Allow your head and neck to relax completely to maximize the stretch in your spine.
2. Perform the stretch on a comfortable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping or discomfort.
3. If you find it difficult to reach your toes, use a yoga strap or towel around your feet to assist.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the lever leg extension machine. Position your feet under the padded lever, with the lever resting just above your ankles.
2. Grip the handles on the sides of the machine for support. Engage your core and keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest.
3. Extend your legs by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knees, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the lever leg extension machine. Position your feet under the padded lever, with the lever resting just above your ankles.
2. Grip the handles on the sides of the machine for support. Engage your core and keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest.
3. Extend your legs by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knees, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Extend your arms straight in line with your head, keeping them close to your ears, and hands crossed over each other.
2. Engage your core and lift your upper body off the floor, with your arms following your torso line, until it forms a 45-degree angle with the floor.
3. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your abdominal muscles.
4. Slowly lower your body back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your arms straight and aligned with your ears to ensure proper form and avoid straining your neck.
2. Press your lower back firmly into the floor throughout the exercise to prevent lower back strain.
3. Use a comfortable, non-slip exercise mat to provide cushioning and prevent slipping during the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable machine with the pulleys set at the lowest position. Grasp the handles with each hand, palms facing up, and take a step forward to create tension in the cables.
2. Lean lightly forward and position your feet shoulder-width apart, keeping your back straight and your arms extended slightly behind you.
3. Raise the handles up and together in a wide arc, bringing them to meet above your head, while keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
4. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid using momentum.
2. Focus on squeezing your shoulder muscles at the top of the movement.
3. Exhale as you raise the handles and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise: Low Resistance band lying bicep curl
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the middle of the resistance band to a low anchor point in front of you. Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a handle in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended straight by your sides.
2. Curl the handles towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms stationary.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back flat on the bench and avoid arching your spine.
2. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise: Low Resistance band lying bicep curl half repetition
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the middle of the resistance band to a low anchor point in front of you. Lie on a bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a handle in each hand with your palms facing up and your arms extended straight by your sides.
2. Curl the handles halfway towards your shoulders by bending your elbows until your forearms are parallel to the floor, keeping your upper arms stationary.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back flat on the bench and avoid arching your spine.
2. Focus on engaging your biceps throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl the handles up and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Lift your right leg to perform a front kick, extending your leg straight out in front of you.
3. As you bring your right leg back down, step it behind you into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee nearly touches the floor.
4. Push through your left heel to stand back up, returning to the starting position. Repeat the movement on the same side or alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle during the lunge to avoid strain.
2. Perform the front kick with control, avoiding any jerky movements to prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you perform the front kick and inhaling as you lower into the lunge.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart. Step your right foot forward into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee nearly touches the floor.
2. From the lunge position, perform small pulses by slightly raising and lowering your hips in a controlled manner. 
3. Continue pulsing for the desired number of repetitions or duration, keeping your core engaged and maintaining balance.
4. Return to the starting position by pushing through your right heel and repeat the exercise on the opposite leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain.
2. Use a controlled motion and avoid bouncing to maintain muscle tension and effectiveness.
3. Perform the pulses with control, avoiding any jerky movements to prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, placing the middle of the resistance band under your left foot. Hold the handles of the resistance band at shoulder height with your elbows bent and facing the floor.
2. Step your right leg back into a reverse lunge, bending both knees to lower your right knee towards the floor while keeping your left knee aligned with your ankle.
3. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position, bringing your right leg forward.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides to work the other leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push back up to the starting position and inhale as you lower into the lunge.
2. Focus on engaging your glutes and quadriceps throughout the movement.
3. Ensure your front knee does not extend past your toes to avoid joint strain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Shoulders (Deltoids)

Exercise: Lunge rotation left and right bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms bent at your sides, hands close to your torso.
2. Step your right foot forward into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee nearly touches the floor.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your arms to the right side, then rotate your torso to the left, bringing your arms to the left side.
4. Return your torso to the center and push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat the movement on the opposite leg. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain.
2. Keep your back straight and your chest lifted to maintain proper posture.
3. Perform the rotations with control, avoiding any jerky movements to prevent injury.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: Lunge to knee drive left bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Step your left foot back into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee nearly touches the floor.
3. Push through your right heel to stand back up, simultaneously driving your left knee up towards your chest.
4. Return your left leg to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Switch sides and repeat the movement with your right leg stepping back.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain.
2. Perform the knee drive with control, avoiding any jerky movements to prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you drive your knee up and inhaling as you lower into the lunge.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: Lunge to knee drive right bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot back into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee nearly touches the floor.
3. Push through your left heel to stand back up, simultaneously driving your right knee up towards your chest.
4. Return your right leg to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions. Switch sides and repeat the movement with your left leg stepping back.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain.
2. Perform the knee drive with control, avoiding any jerky movements to prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you drive your knee up and inhaling as you lower into the lunge.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: lunges alternate leg with pause bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot forward into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee nearly touches the floor. Pause for a moment in this position.
3. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, then step your left foot forward into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your left thigh is parallel to the floor and your right knee nearly touches the floor. Pause for a moment in this position.
4. Push through your left heel to return to the starting position. Alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee is aligned with your ankle and does not extend past your toes to avoid strain.
2. Perform each lunge with control, pausing briefly to enhance muscle engagement.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you push back to the starting position and inhaling as you step forward into the lunge.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: Lunges same leg side view bodyweight
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot forward into a lunge position, lowering your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the floor and your left knee nearly touches the floor. Pause for a moment in this position.
3. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
4. Repeat the lunge with your right leg for the desired number of repetitions before switching to your left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you push back to the starting position and inhaling as you step forward into the lunge.
2. Keep your back straight and your chest lifted to maintain proper posture.
3. Use a controlled motion when bringing your leg back to the starting position to maintain balance.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot back into a lunge position, keeping your right leg straight and your heel on the floor. Bend your left knee slightly, keeping your left foot flat on the floor.
3. Lean forward slightly, pressing your hips downward and feeling the stretch in your right calf. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.
4. Return to the starting position and switch legs, stepping your left foot back and repeating the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your back leg remains straight and your heel stays on the floor to maximize the stretch in your calf.
2. Keep your front knee aligned with your ankle to avoid unnecessary strain on your joints.
3. Perform the stretch on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping or discomfort.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying face down on the floor with your legs extended straight behind you and your hands placed under your shoulders, palms flat on the floor.
2. Slowly press your hands into the floor to lift your chest upward, extending your spine. Keep your hips and legs relaxed on the floor.
3. Continue to lift your chest until you feel a comfortable stretch in your abdomen and lower back. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
4. Slowly lower your chest back down to the floor and return to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your elbows; keep them slightly bent to prevent strain on your joints.
2. Breathe deeply and steadily, inhaling as you lift your chest and exhaling as you hold the stretch.
3. Perform the stretch on a comfortable surface, such as a yoga mat, to prevent discomfort or injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Attach the resistance band to a low anchor point behind your head and hold the handles with both hands, keeping your arms bent and handles close to your head.
2. Curl your upper body, bringing your elbows towards your knees while lifting your back off the floor. 
3. Slowly lower your upper body back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl your torso up and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Keep your feet flat on the floor for better stability.
3. Focus on engaging your abdominal muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying face down on the floor with your legs extended straight behind you and your hands placed behind your head, elbows out to the sides.
2. Engage your core and glutes, then lift your upper torso off the floor, keeping your neck in a neutral position and your lower body relaxed on the floor.
3. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your lower back muscles.
4. Slowly lower your upper torso back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck in a neutral position to avoid straining it.
2. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to prevent discomfort or injury.
3. If you find it challenging to lift your upper torso, you can start with smaller movements and gradually increase the range of motion as you build strength.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a bench with your arms extended out to the sides, your elbows bent at 90 degrees, and your forearms hanging off the sides of the bench, perpendicular to the floor in line with your head.
2. Rotate your shoulders to lift your forearms upward until they are vertical to the floor, maintaining the 90-degree angle at your elbows throughout the movement.
3. Slowly lower your forearms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench to maintain stability.
2. Move slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Keep your elbows fixed at a 90-degree angle throughout the movement to isolate the shoulder rotation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back on a bench with your arms extended out to the sides, your elbows bent at 90 degrees, and your forearms hanging off the sides of the bench, perpendicular to the floor in line with your torso.
2. Rotate your shoulders to lift your forearms upward until they are vertical to the floor, maintaining the 90-degree angle at your elbows throughout the movement.
3. Slowly lower your forearms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged and your back flat against the bench to maintain stability.
2. Move slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Keep your elbows fixed at a 90-degree angle throughout the movement to isolate the shoulder rotation.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight and your arms out to the sides to form a T shape.
2. Bend and lift your right leg and cross it over your body, aiming to touch the floor on the left side, and extend your left arm to hold your right knee down. 
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your lower back and hips.
4. Slowly return your right leg to the starting position. Repeat the stretch with your left leg, crossing it over your body to the right side. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to avoid any sudden movements that could cause strain.
2. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you lift your leg and exhaling as you hold the stretch.
3. Avoid forcing your leg to touch the floor if you feel any pain; go as far as your flexibility allows.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left knee, forming a figure-four position.
3. Grasp the back of your left thigh with both hands and gently pull your left leg towards your chest. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right glute and hip.
4. Slowly release your left leg and return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch with your left ankle crossed over your right knee. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your head and shoulders relaxed on the floor to avoid tension in your neck and upper back.
2. Avoid pulling too hard; go as far as your flexibility allows without causing pain.
3. Use a towel or strap if needed to assist in pulling your leg towards your chest.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs straight on the floor.
2. Lift your right knee towards your chest, holding it with both hands to keep it close while extending your left leg straight off floor, keeping it in line with your right foot.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release your right knee and return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch with your left knee lifted towards your chest and your right leg extended. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor to avoid strain and to deepen the stretch.
2. Start with a smaller range of motion if you feel any discomfort, gradually increasing as flexibility improves.
3. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you prepare for the stretch and exhaling as you hold the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the floor with your legs extended straight and your arms extended out to your sides, palms facing down.
2. Lift both arms straight upwards, keeping them in line with your shoulders. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Hold the top position for a second, feeling the contraction in your shoulder and upper back muscles.
4. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to prevent discomfort or injury.
3. Move slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the lying leg curl machine, positioning your legs under the padded lever, just above your ankles. Adjust the machine so that your knees are just off the edge of the bench.
2. Grasp the handles on the sides of the machine for stability and keep your back flat against the bench.
3. Curl your legs up towards your glutes by bending your knees, squeezing your hamstrings at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower the padded lever back to the starting position with control, fully extending your legs. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips pressed against the bench throughout the exercise to isolate the hamstring muscles.
2. Avoid using momentum; let your muscles do the work.
3. Exhale as you curl your legs up and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms at your sides, palms facing down firm on the floor.
2. Engage your core muscles and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Keeping your legs straight, lift them up towards the ceiling until they are perpendicular to the floor.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position with control, stopping just before they touch the floor. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you lift your legs up and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Keep your legs as straight as possible for maximum effectiveness.
3. Focus on engaging your abdominal muscles throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Abdominals (Obliques), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise: Lying On Side Arm Circle Warm Up
Lying On Side Arm Circle Warm Up_Female
Lying pull over with Resistance band cable
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the middle of the resistance band to a low anchor point behind you. Lie on your back on the floor, knees bent and feet flat on the floor, holding a handle in each hand with your arms extended straight above your head, palms facing forward.
2. Keeping your arms straight, pull the handles over your head and towards the floor until your arms are in line with your body.
3. Slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, keeping your arms straight. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles over your head and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
2. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Focus on engaging your lats and chest muscles throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Chest (Pectoralis Major)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the floor with your legs extended straight and your arms resting by your sides.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back with your right hand to grasp your right ankle or foot.
3. Gently pull your right foot towards your glutes, feeling the stretch in your right quadriceps. Keep your hips pressed into the floor.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release your right foot and return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch on your left leg. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips pressed into the floor to maximize the stretch in your quadriceps and avoid straining your lower back.
2. Move slowly and with control to avoid any sudden movements that could cause strain.
3. If you cannot reach your foot comfortably, use a towel or strap around your ankle to assist with the stretch.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your side with your legs extended straight and your head resting on your lower hand. Extend your top arm and reach back to grasp your top ankle or foot.
2. Bend your top knee and gently pull your foot towards your glutes with your hand, feeling the stretch in your quadriceps. Keep your hips stacked and your body in a straight line.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, breathing deeply and steadily.
4. Slowly release your foot and return to the starting position. Repeat the stretch on the other side. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips stacked and your body in a straight line to maintain proper alignment and maximize the stretch.
2. If you cannot reach your foot comfortably, use a towel or strap around your ankle to assist with the stretch.
3. Focus on deep, steady breathing, inhaling as you prepare for the stretch and exhaling as you hold the stretch.

Exercise: Lying Single Leg Extended On Wall Hamstrings Stretch
Lying Single Leg Extended On Wall Hamstrings Stretch_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the decline chest press machine with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with both hands at chest level, palms facing down.
2. Press the handles forward by extending your arms, keeping your elbows slightly bent at the end of the movement.
3. Squeeze your chest muscles at the bottom of the movement and slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, bringing them back to chest level.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you press the handles forward and downward, and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the incline chest press machine with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with both hands, elbows facing the floor, palms facing forward.
2. Press the handles upward by extending your arms, keeping your elbows slightly bent at the end of the movement.
3. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement and slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, bringing them back to chest level.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you press the handles forward and downward, and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the chest fly machine with your feet flat on the floor and your back pressed firmly against the backrest. Grasp the handles, arms parallel to the floor, with both hands at chest level and palms facing forward.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and your arms extended out to your sides.
3. Bring the handles together in front of your chest by squeezing your chest muscles, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
4. Slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, bringing them back to your sides. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you bring the handles together and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the lateral raise machine with your feet flat on the floor and your back pressed firmly against the backrest. Adjust the seat height so that the pads rest against the outside of your upper arms.
2. Grasp the handles with both hands, keeping your elbows bent.
3. Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor and slowly lower your arms back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you raise your arms and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Use a moderate weight to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your shoulder muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step): 1. Stand tall with your back straight, arms by your side, and feet shoulder-width apart.

1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands placed on your hips.
2. Slowly rotate your torso to the right, keeping your hips facing forward. Twist as far as is comfortable, feeling the stretch in your middle back.
3. Return to the center and repeat the rotation to the right once more.
4. Rotate your torso to the left side twice in the same manner, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips facing forward to ensure the stretch targets your middle back effectively.
2. Perform the stretch on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping or discomfort.
3. Avoid forcing the twist; go as far as your flexibility allows without causing pain.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight on the floor and your arms straight by your sides, palms facing the floor.
2. Curl your abdomen, raising your upper back off the floor, while simultaneously lifting your legs straight up towards the ceiling and raise your arms towards your feet.
3. Just before your hands and feet touch, lower your upper back, legs and arms back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you lift your upper back, legs and arms up, and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Keep your legs as straight as possible for maximum abdominal activation.
3. Focus on engaging your abdominal muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms bent at the elbows, hands positioned at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Engage your shoulders and press your hands upward until your arms are fully extended above your head.
3. Hold the top position for a moment, feeling the contraction in your shoulder muscles.
4. Slowly lower your hands back to shoulder height with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe consistently, exhaling as you press your hands upward and inhaling as you lower them.
2. Keep your head aligned with your spine to prevent neck strain.
3. Avoid using momentum; focus on muscle strength to perform the movements.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your chest towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping your body straight.
3. Push through your hands to raise your hips up and back into a downward-facing dog position, forming an inverted V-shape with your body.
4. Lower your hips and return to the plank position by moving your body forward. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core to maintain a straight body line during the plank position and prevent your hips from sagging.
2. Lower your chest towards the floor with controlled movement to ensure proper muscle engagement and avoid injury.
3. As you push into the downward-facing dog, focus on driving your hips upward while keeping your arms and legs as straight as possible.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Upper Back (Trapezius), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1.Begin in a plank position on your toes and hands, with your body in a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bend your right knee and bring it towards your right elbow and stop when your knee is close to the elbow.
3. Return to the starting plank position, then repeat the movement on the opposite side.
4. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure you keep your movements smooth and controlled to maintain form and avoid injury.
2. Maintain a steady breathing pattern, exhaling as you bring your knee towards your elbow and inhaling as you return to the plank position.
3. Keep your shoulders stable and your core engaged throughout the exercise to enhance effectiveness.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Adjust the MTS Iso-Lateral Kneeling Leg Curl machine to fit your height. Kneel on the machine with your left knee on the knee pad and the right leg extended, securing your ankle under the padded lever. Rest your chest against the chest pad.
2. Hold onto the handles for stability and keep your back straight.
3. Curl your leg by bending your knee and pulling your heel towards your glutes, squeezing your hamstrings at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower your leg back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your chest pressed against the pad and your back straight throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your hamstrings throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl your leg up and inhale as you lower it back down.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)
Equipment: MTS Iso-Lateral Kneeling Leg Curl Machine

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Adjust the MTS Iso-Lateral Kneeling Leg Curl machine to fit your height. Kneel on the machine with your left knee on the knee pad and the right leg extended, securing your ankle under the padded lever. Rest your chest against the chest pad.
2. Hold onto the handles for stability and keep your back straight.
3. Curl your leg by bending your knee and pulling your heel towards your glutes, squeezing your hamstrings at the top of the movement.

2. Focus on engaging your hamstrings throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you curl your leg up and inhale as you lower it back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the multi-hip machine and position the padded lever against the outside of your thigh. Grip the handles firmly and maintain an upright posture with a slight bend in your standing leg.
2. Engage your glutes and push the working leg laterally against the resistance, lifting it to the side as far as possible.
3. Slowly return your leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your torso upright and avoid leaning to the side during the movement.
2. Engage your core muscles to help stabilize your hips and maintain balance.
3. Move your leg in a controlled manner to avoid swinging and ensure full glute engagement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the multi-hip machine and position the padded lever against the outside of your thigh. Grip the handles firmly and maintain an upright posture with a slight bend in your standing leg.
2. Engage your glutes and push the working leg laterally against the resistance, lifting it to the side as far as possible.
3. Slowly return your leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your torso upright and avoid leaning to the side during the movement.
2. Engage your core muscles to help stabilize your hips and maintain balance.
3. Move your leg in a controlled manner to avoid swinging and ensure full glute engagement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the multi-hip machine, turn to one side, and position the padded lever behind your thigh. Hold the handles firmly in front of you and lean slightly forward at the hips while keeping your spine straight.
2. Extend your leg backward in a controlled motion until your leg is in line with your torso.
3. Slowly return your leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in the standing knee to improve balance and reduce joint stress.
2. Focus on squeezing your glutes at the top of the extension for maximum activation.
3. Avoid swinging the leg or using momentum; perform the movement slowly and under control.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Core (Rectus Abdominis), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand on the platform of the multi-hip machine, turn to one side, and position the padded lever behind your thigh. Hold the handles firmly in front of you and lean slightly forward at the hips while keeping your spine straight.
2. Extend your leg backward in a controlled motion until your leg is in line with your torso.
3. Slowly return your leg to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, switch legs, and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a slight bend in the standing knee to improve balance and reduce joint stress.
2. Focus on squeezing your glutes at the top of the extension for maximum activation.
3. Avoid swinging the leg or using momentum; perform the movement slowly and under control.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Core (Rectus Abdominis), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet together. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your chest and lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body.
3. Lower your chest until it is just above the floor.
4. Push through your hands to raise your body back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body to maximize chest and triceps engagement and reduce shoulder strain.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower yourself.
3. Keep your head aligned with your spine to avoid straining your neck.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head, keeping your elbows wide.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift your upper back off the floor, rotating your abdomen to raise your right elbow towards the ceiling.
3. Squeeze your obliques at the top of the movement and slowly lower your upper back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides to work the opposite oblique.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you lift and rotate your upper body, and inhale as you lower it back down.
2. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands; let your abs do the work.
3. Focus on engaging your oblique muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with a neutral grip. Bend at the hips and knees, keeping your back straight and almost parallel to the floor, and extend your free hand to hold on a bench.
2.  Allow the dumbbell to hang straight down from your shoulder, with your arm fully extended towards the floor.
3. Raise the dumbbell out to the side until your arm is parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbow.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a controlled motion to lift and lower the dumbbell, avoiding momentum.
2. Focus on using your shoulder muscles to lift the weight rather than swinging your arm.
3. Keep a slight bend in your elbow throughout the exercise to reduce strain on your joints.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying flat on your back with your legs slightly bent and your feet together. Hold a weight plate with both hands, extending your arms straight above your chest.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift your upper body off the floor into a sitting position while keeping the weight extended straight up.
3. As you sit up, ensure your back remains straight and your chest is lifted, bringing your torso to an upright position.
4. Lower your upper body back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the entire movement to maintain stability and proper form.
2. Avoid using momentum to lift your upper body; focus on using your abdominal muscles to perform the sit-up.
3. Exhale as you sit up and inhale as you lower back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet on the floor. Hold a weight plate with both hands, extending your arms straight above your chest.
2. Engage your core muscles and sit up by lifting your upper body towards your knees, keeping the weight extended upwards and your arms straight.
3. Continue to sit up until your torso is upright, maintaining the weight above your head throughout the movement.
4. Lower to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you crunch up and inhale as you lower back down.
2. Start with a lighter weight to master the form before progressing to heavier weights.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and avoid injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying on your back with your legs straight on the floor close together. Hold a dumbbell with both hands, keeping your arms bent and behind your head, close to the floor.
2. Engage your core muscles and lift your torso off the floor while bending your knees and raising them to your chest, and bringing the dumbbell close to your knees.
3. Lower your body back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you crunch up and inhale as you lower back down.
2. Start with a lighter weight to master the form before progressing to heavier weights.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and avoid injury.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended down to your sides, palms facing your torso.
2. Lift your arms overhead, bringing your palms together in a clapping motion.
3. Lower your arms back to the starting position with control, keeping them straight and at shoulder height.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a smooth and controlled motion.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on steady breathing, inhaling as you lift your arms and exhaling as you lower them.
2. Ensure your shoulders stay relaxed and away from your ears to avoid unnecessary tension.
3. Keep your movements smooth and controlled and avoid using momentum.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Raise your right arm overhead and bend your elbow, reaching your right hand down towards your upper back.
3. Bring your left arm overhead and hold your right elbow with your left hand, gently pulling your right elbow to the left side to deepen the stretch. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.
4. Release the stretch and return to the starting position. Repeat on the left side by raising your left arm overhead and bending your elbow, using your right hand to assist with the stretch. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid arching your back; keep your spine neutral to maximize the stretch and prevent injury.
2. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and support your lower back.
3. Use gentle pressure when pulling on your elbow to avoid overstretching and potential discomfort.

Exercise: Overhead extension Resistance band both arms
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, placing the middle of the resistance band under both feet. Hold the handles of the resistance band with both hands and extend your arms overhead, keeping your elbows close to your ears and your palms facing each other.
2. Lower the handles behind your head by bending your elbows until your forearms are about parallel to the floor, keeping your upper arms stationary.
3. Extend your arms back to the starting position by straightening your elbows. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows close to your ears and avoid flaring them out to isolate the triceps.
2. Keep your shoulders down and relaxed to avoid neck tension.
3. Exhale as you extend your arms and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Raise your right arm overhead and bend your elbow, reaching your right hand down towards your upper back.
3. Bring your left arm overhead and hold your right elbow with your left hand, gently pulling your right elbow to the left side to deepen the stretch. Hold this position for 15-30 seconds.
4. Release the stretch and return to the starting position. Repeat on the left side by raising your left arm overhead and bending your elbow, using your right hand to assist with the stretch. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid arching your back; keep your spine neutral to maximize the stretch and prevent injury.
2. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and support your lower back.
3. Use gentle pressure when pulling on your elbow to avoid overstretching and potential discomfort.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight at your sides at shoulder height.
2. Slowly rotate your forearms in the opposite direction so that your palms face up while slightly lowering your arms.
3. Slowly raise your arms back to the starting position while rotating your forearms so that both palms face down. 
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lower your arms and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
2. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears to avoid unnecessary tension.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your elbows to reduce strain on your joints.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the Pec Deck machine with your feet flat on the floor and your back pressed firmly against the backrest. Bend your arms at 90 degrees and rest your elbows on the elbow pads and grasp the handles, upper arms parallel to the floor and palms facing forward.
2. Squeeze your chest muscles to bring the handles together in front of your chest.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control, bringing your elbows back to your sides. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise to maintain proper form.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you bring your elbows together and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Walk your feet towards your hands, lifting your hips up towards the ceiling to form an inverted V-shape. Keep your arms and legs straight, and your head between your arms.
3. Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them pointed outwards.
4. Push through your hands to return to the starting inverted V position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your head aligned with your arms to avoid straining your neck.
2. Ensure your elbows point outwards to target your shoulders effectively.
3. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping and ensure safety.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core.
2. Lift your right knee and drive it towards your left elbow and straighten your leg, twisting your torso slightly to the left as you do so.
3. Return your right leg to the starting plank position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left knee, driving it towards your right elbow. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Move slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you drive your knee towards your elbow and inhaling as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your elbows directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core.
2. Jump your feet out to the sides, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, while keeping your upper body stable.
3. Quickly jump your feet back together to return to the starting plank position.
4. Continue jumping your feet in and out for the desired number of repetitions or duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move quickly but with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Maintain a neutral head position, looking slightly ahead of your hands, to keep your neck aligned with your spine.
3. Ensure your body stays in a straight line, avoiding sagging hips or raised buttocks.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Quickly jump both knees towards your chest, landing with both feet flat on the floor beneath you.
3. Immediately jump your feet back to the starting plank position.
4. Continue jumping your feet in and out for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use controlled, explosive movements to quickly bring your knees to your chest and return to plank position.
2. Ensure your shoulders remain directly over your wrists to maintain alignment and reduce strain on your shoulders.
3. Keep your hips level throughout the movement to maintain proper form and avoid sagging or raising your hips.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Bring your right knee forward and place your right foot outside your right hand, keeping your left leg extended straight back.
3. Return your right foot to the plank position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left knee, bringing your left foot forward to place it outside your left hand. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move your leg slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you bring your foot forward and inhaling as you return to the plank position.
3. Ensure your body stays in a straight line, avoiding sagging hips or raised buttocks.
Primary Activating Muscles: Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin by lying face down on the floor. Place your elbows directly under your shoulders and your forearms flat on the floor, parallel to each other.
2. Engage your core and lift your body off the floor, forming a straight line from your head to your heels. Your elbows and toes should support your body weight.
3. Hold this position, keeping your core tight and your body straight. Avoid letting your hips sag or rise too high.
4. Maintain the plank position for the desired amount of time, focusing on your form and breathing steadily.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, avoiding any sagging or lifting of the hips.
3. Keep your shoulders directly above your elbows to maintain proper alignment and reduce strain on your shoulders.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a side plank position on your right side with your right elbow supporting your body, your left arm raised vertically towards the ceiling, and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your left arm, reaching it under and across your torso while slightly lowering your hips.
3. Return your left arm to the starting position, lifting your hips back to the straight line.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left side and repeat the movement with your right arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the exercise to maintain stability and support your lower back.
2. Ensure your supporting arm or elbow is directly under your shoulder to maintain proper alignment and reduce strain.
3. Keep your hips stable and aligned with your body, avoiding excessive rotation.
4. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you reach under your torso and inhaling as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a high plank position with your hands placed directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Hold a water bottle in your right hand, and keep your feet slightly wider than hip-width apart for stability.
2. Lift the water bottle out to the side while keeping your arm straight, raising it until it is parallel to the floor.
3. Slowly lower the bottle back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged to maintain a stable plank position and prevent your hips from sagging or rotating.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and avoid using momentum.
3. Keep your arm straight and avoid locking your elbow to protect your joint.
Primary Activating Muscles: Shoulders (Posterior Deltoids), Core Muscles (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lift your right hand off the floor and tap your left shoulder, keeping your hips stable and minimizing rotation.
3. Return your right hand to the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left hand, lifting it off the floor and tapping your right shoulder. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your hips level throughout the movement to maintain proper form and avoid rotating your torso.
2. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping and ensure safety.
3. Keep your shoulders directly over your wrists to maintain alignment and reduce strain on your shoulders.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a weight plate with both hands. Keep your arms extended straight down in front of your hips.
2. Raise the plate in front of you with straight arms until they are parallel to the floor, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Pause briefly at the top of the movement, then slowly lower the plate back to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining good form throughout.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift the plate; focus on a slow and controlled movement.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows to protect your joints.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift the plate and inhaling as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the plate-loaded incline chest press machine with your feet flat on the floor. Grasp the handles with both hands, elbows facing the floor, palms facing forward.
2. Press the handles upward by extending your arms, keeping your elbows slightly bent at the end of the movement.
3. Squeeze your chest muscles at the top of the movement and slowly return the handles to the starting position with control, bringing them back to chest level.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back pressed against the backrest throughout the exercise.
2. Focus on engaging your chest muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you press the handles and inhale as you return them to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and both arms extended straight out to your sides.
2. Bend your right knee and lower into a side lunge while simultaneously rotating your torso to the right and bringing your left hand to touch your right leg. Keeping your left leg straight.
3. Push off your right foot to return to the starting wide stance position, straightening your right leg and rotating your torso back to the center.
4. Repeat the movement on the left side, bending your left knee into a side lunge and rotating your torso to bring your right hand to touch your left leg. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your bent knee stays aligned with your toes to avoid strain on your knee joint.
2. Move with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Focus on steady breathing, exhaling as you lower into the lunge and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Rectus Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Adductors (Adductor Magnus, Adductor Longus, Adductor Brevis)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a barbell with an underhand grip (palms facing up), shoulder-width wide, and your arms resting on the preacher pad.
2. Curl the barbell towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed against the pad.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the barbell reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary against the pad to isolate the biceps.
2. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip (palms facing up), and your arms extended over the preacher bench pad.
2. Engage your core and curl both dumbbells towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed against the pad.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the dumbbells reach shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary against the pad to isolate the biceps.
2. Keep your wrists straight and avoid letting them bend backward.
3. Exhale as you curl the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), shoulder-width wide, and your arms resting on the preacher pad.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed against the pad.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary against the pad to isolate the biceps.
2. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise: Preacher curl ez bar close grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), just closer than shoulder-width wide, and your arms resting on the preacher pad.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed against the pad.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary against the pad to isolate the biceps.
2. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise: Preacher curl ez bar wide grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a preacher bench with your feet flat on the floor, holding an EZ bar with an underhand grip (palms facing up), just wider than shoulder-width wide, and your arms resting on the preacher pad.
2. Curl the EZ bar towards your shoulders by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms pressed against the pad.
3. Squeeze your biceps at the top of the movement, ensuring the bar reaches shoulder height.
4. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your upper arms stationary against the pad to isolate the biceps.
2. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.
3. Exhale as you curl the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you.
2. Bend your right knee, placing your right foot flat on the floor inside your left thigh. 
3. Rotate your torso to the right and place your left elbow on the outside of your right knee, using your right hand on the floor behind you for support.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side by switching the positions of your legs and rotating your torso to the left.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use your supporting hand on the floor behind you to maintain balance and assist with the rotation.
2. Move into the stretch slowly and with control to prevent overstretching and injury.
3. Breathe deeply and steadily, using your breath to help deepen the stretch and relax your muscles.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: Prone bench row barbell pronate grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incline bench, holding a barbell with a pronate grip (palms facing down) and your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight down towards the floor.
2. Pull the barbell towards your upper abdomen by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement, ensuring the barbell reaches reaches close to the bench.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms.
2. Exhale as you pull the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.
3. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

Exercise: Prone bench row barbell reverse grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incline bench, holding a barbell with a reverse grip (palms facing up) and your hands placed shoulder-width apart. Extend your arms straight down towards the floor.
2. Pull the barbell towards your abdomen by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement, ensuring the barbell reaches close to the bench.
4. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms.
2. Exhale as you pull the barbell up and inhale as you lower it.
3. Keep your elbows close to your body to maximize back muscle engagement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip (palms facing each other), and your arms extended straight down towards the floor.
2. Pull the dumbbells towards your abdomen by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement, ensuring the dumbbells reach the sides of your torso.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arms.
2. Exhale as you pull the dumbbells up and inhale as you lower them.
3. Use a weight that allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise.

Exercise: Prone bench row dumbbells supinated grip
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incline bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with a supinate grip (palms facing up), and your arms extended straight down towards the floor.
2. Pull the dumbbells towards your abdomen by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement, ensuring the dumbbells reach the sides of your torso.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Exercise: Prone front raises barbell on bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incline bench, holding a barbell with both hands using a pronated grip (palms facing down) and a shoulder-width hand placement. Your arms should be extended straight down towards the floor.
2. Lift the barbell straight up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your body pressed firmly against the bench to prevent lower back strain.
2. Focus on lifting with your shoulders and not your arms to maximize shoulder engagement.
3. Exhale as you lift the barbell and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise: Prone front raises dumbbell on bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie chest-first on an incine bench, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing down). Your arms should be extended straight down towards the floor.
2. Raise the dumbbells straight up in front of you until your arms are in line with your torso.
3. Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position. 
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your body pressed firmly against the bench to prevent lower back strain.
2. Focus on lifting with your shoulders and not your arms to maximize shoulder engagement.
3. Exhale as you lift the barbell and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a resistance band with both hands, arms extended straight in front of you at shoulder height. Your palms should be facing the floor.
2. Pull the resistance band apart by moving your arms out to your sides.
3. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows to avoid locking them.
2. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you pull the band apart and inhale as you return to the starting position.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand beneath a pull-up bar and grasp it with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you), hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your back muscles and pull yourself up towards the bar by bending your elbows.
3. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar, focusing on contracting your back muscles.
4. Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the bottom and pulling up until your chin is above the bar.
2. Focus on engaging your back muscles, particularly the latissimus dorsi, to perform the pull-up effectively.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you pull up and inhaling as you lower yourself down.
4. Avoid using momentum to swing your body; maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise.
5. Perform the exercise on a stable, secure pull-up bar to ensure safety.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Biceps (Biceps Brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand beneath a pull-up bar and grasp it with an overhand grip (palms facing away from you), hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
2. Engage your back muscles to pull yourself up towards the bar by bending your elbows.
3. Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar, focusing on contracting your back muscles.
4. Lower yourself back to the starting position in a controlled manner, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a full range of motion, fully extending your arms at the bottom and pulling up until your chin is above the bar.
2. Focus on engaging your back muscles, particularly the latissimus dorsi, to perform the pull-up effectively.
3. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you pull up and inhaling as you lower yourself down.
4. Avoid using momentum to swing your body; maintain a controlled movement throughout the exercise.
5. Perform the exercise on a stable, secure pull-up bar to ensure safety.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Biceps (Biceps Brachii)
