Exercise: Push Pull Chair Over Head Pull
Push Pull Chair Over Head Pull_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart and your feet together. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body. Perform a push-up.
3. As you push back up, shift your weight onto your left hand and rotate your torso to the right, raising your right arm towards the ceiling. Your body should form a T-shape.
4. Return your right hand to the floor and lower your body into another push-up. Repeat the movement, this time rotating to the left and raising your left arm towards the ceiling. Alternate sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you push up and rotate, and inhaling as you lower your body.
2. Ensure your body forms a straight line during the push-up and rotation, avoiding any sagging or arching of the back.
3. Keep your feet hip-width apart to provide a stable base for the rotation.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Triceps (Triceps Brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet hip-width apart. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Push through your hands to protract your shoulder blades, rounding your upper back slightly.
3. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them close to your body to perform a push-up.
4. Return to the plank position. Repeat the sequence for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight body line during the push-up, avoiding any sagging or arching of the back.
2. Keep your elbows close to your body during the push-up to effectively target your chest and triceps.
3. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to prevent slipping and ensure safety.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Triceps (Triceps Brachii)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet together. Your body should form a straight line from head to heels.
2. Lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body.
3. Lower your chest until it is just above the floor, maintaining a straight body line and keeping your neck neutral.
4. Push through your hands to raise your body back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain a straight body line and avoid sagging your hips.
2. Lower yourself with control, ensuring your chest almost touches the floor while maintaining proper form.
3. Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body to maximize chest and triceps engagement and reduce shoulder strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs straight, vertical to the floor. Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the floor, bringing your chest towards your knees. 
3. Hold the top position for a moment, squeezing your abdominal muscles.
4. Lower your shoulders back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands; instead, use your abdominal muscles to lift your shoulders.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your shoulders and inhaling as you lower them.
3. Keep your lower back pressed against the floor to prevent strain and maintain proper form.
4. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and reduce discomfort.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Bend your right elbow and bring your right arm behind your back, raising your hand upward with your palm facing out.
3. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side by bending your left elbow and using your right hand to assist with the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move slowly and with control to avoid any sudden movements that could cause strain.
2. Keep your core engaged to maintain balance and support your lower back.
3. Avoid arching your back; keep your spine neutral to maximize the stretch and prevent injury.

Exercise: Rear deltoid fly cable Resistance band
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the resistance band to a shoulder height anchor point in front of you. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the handles with both hands, arms extended straight in front of you at shoulder height, palms facing each other.
2. Pull the handles out to your sides by extending your arms and squeezing your shoulder blades together, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
3. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles apart and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter resistance band if needed to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your rear deltoid and upper back muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Extend your right arm, slightly bent, across your body at shoulder height.
3. Use your left hand to gently pull your right arm towards your chest, feeling the stretch in the rear deltoid.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release and return to the starting position. Repeat on the other side by extending your left arm and using your right hand to assist with the stretch.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears to maximize the stretch.
2. Avoid twisting your torso; keep your upper body facing forward.
3. Move slowly and with control to avoid any sudden movements that could cause strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height. Kneel on one knee with the opposite leg forward, foot flat on the ground. 
2. Hold the band handles with both hands, arms extended forward, and palms facing down.
3. Pull the band handles towards your chest by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
4. Return to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the peak of the row to maximize back activation.
2. Adjust the resistance band tension or your kneeling position for an appropriate challenge.
3. Avoid shrugging your shoulders; keep them down and relaxed.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius)

Exercise: Resistance Band Assisted Front Rack Stretch
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the middle of a weight cage with a horizontal bar at chest level. Place the resistance band under your left foot and hold the other end of the band with your left hand.
2. Bring your left elbow up and rest it on the horizontal bar, allowing your forearm to lean backward. The band should extend down by your shoulder, creating tension.
3. Slowly allow your forearm to lean back to increase the stretch in your shoulder, keeping your hand close to your shoulder.
4. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then slowly release the tension and switch to the other arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbow securely on the bar to ensure proper stretch.
2. Allow your forearm to naturally lean back without forcing the movement.
3. Keep a relaxed grip on the band to avoid unnecessary tension.
Primary Activating Muscles: Shoulders (Deltoids), Rotator Cuff (Supraspinatus, Infraspinatus, Teres Minor, Subscapularis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Secure two loop elastic bands on a straight bar, ensuring they are securely anchored. Position each band over your shoulders.
2. Set yourself in a plank position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your feet together. The resistance bands should provide support as you perform the push-ups.
3. Engage your core and lower your body towards the floor by bending your elbows, keeping them at a 45-degree angle to your body. Allow the resistance bands to assist you as you descend.
4. Push through your hands to raise your body back to the starting position, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure the resistance bands are securely positioned over your shoulders and anchored to the straight bar to provide consistent assistance.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you push up and inhaling as you lower yourself.
3. Lower yourself with control, ensuring your chest almost touches the floor while maintaining proper form.
4. Keep your elbows at a 45-degree angle to your body to maximize chest and triceps engagement and reduce shoulder strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place a loop resistance band around both thighs, just above your knees. Start in a kneeling position on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and knees under your hips.
2. Engage your core and keep your back flat. Begin with your left knee bent at a 90-degree angle and your foot flexed.
3. Push your left foot upward towards the ceiling while keeping your knee bent, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return your leg to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the right leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a loop resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
2. Exhale as you kick your leg back and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
3. Focus on engaging your glutes throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise: Resistance Band Calf Press Sitting on Chair
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a chair with your back straight, knees bent at 90 degrees and feet flat hovering just above the floor. Loop a resistance band around your forefeet, holding the ends of the band with your hands.
2. Extend your forefeet downward to point your toes to the floor, pressing against the resistance of the band to engage your calf muscles.
3. Slowly return to the starting position with control, flexing your forefeet back towards you. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid leaning forward.
2. Keep your hands steady to ensure consistent tension in the band.
3. Exhale as you press your toes forward and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Anterior Tibialis (tibialis anterior), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Lie on your side with your legs bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet stacked together.
2. Rest your head on your bottom arm and place your top hand on the floor for stability.
3. Keeping your feet together, lift your top knee as high as you can without moving your pelvis or back, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return your knee to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your feet together to ensure proper form and muscle activation.
2. Exhale as you lift your knee and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Ensure your head and neck remain aligned with your spine for comfort.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus), Thighs (Tensor Fasciae Latae)

Exercise: Resistance Band Cross Body Single Straight Arm Supinated Pulldown
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the resistance band to a high anchor point in front of you, on your left side. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handle with your right hand, palm facing up.
2. Extend your right arm straight opposite the left side of your head, keeping your arm straight.
3. Pull the handle down across your body towards your right hip until fully extended by your side and slowly return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the band down and inhale as you release it back up.
2. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arm for better engagement.
3. Ensure your hips stay square and stable, avoiding any twisting motion.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Rhomboids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach a resistance band to an anchor point at face height. Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding the handles with both hands, palms facing down.
2. Step back to create tension in the band and extend your arms straight in front of you at shoulder height.
3. Pull the handles towards your face by bending your elbows and spreading them out to the sides, keeping your upper arms parallel to the floor.
4. Slowly return to the starting position with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles towards your face and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Use a lighter resistance band if needed to ensure proper form and gradually increase the resistance as you get stronger.
3. Focus on engaging your upper back and rear shoulders throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Trapezius, Rhomboids), Rear Shoulders (Posterior Deltoids)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Secure the middle of the resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at head height. Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding one handle of the band in each hand with your arms extended straight in front of you, palms facing down.
2. Pull the handles towards your face, bending your elbows and flaring them out to the sides until your hands are at your face sides.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement, keeping your upper arms parallel to the floor.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control, maintaining tension in the band. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your elbows high and in line with your shoulders throughout the movement.
2. Focus on engaging your upper back and shoulder muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you pull the handles towards your face and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
Primary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Rear Shoulders (Posterior Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Rotator Cuff (Supraspinatus, Infraspinatus, Teres Minor, Subscapularis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the floor with a loop resistance band over your ankles and another loop resistance band over your forearms. Extend your arms forward and keep your legs straight.
2. Engage your core and glutes, and lift your chest and legs off the floor simultaneously, spreading your legs apart against the resistance of the band.
3. Squeeze your lower back muscles at the top of the movement, keeping your arms and legs straight.
4. Slowly lower your chest and legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your neck in a neutral position to avoid straining it.
2. Focus on engaging your lower back and glute muscles throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you lift your chest and legs and inhale as you lower them back down.
Primary Activating Muscles: Lower Back (Erector Spinae), Glutes (Gluteus Maximus, Gluteus Medius, Gluteus Minimus)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place a loop resistance band just above your knees. Keep your hands extended by your sides with hands firm on the floor.
2. Engage your core and glutes, and lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
3. While holding the bridge position, press your knees outward against the resistance band to stretch them as far as possible.
4. Slowly bring your knees back together, then lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid arching your lower back; keep a straight line from your shoulders to your knees.
2. Focus on engaging your glutes and hip abductors throughout the movement.
3. Exhale as you lift your hips and press your knees outward, and inhale as you bring your knees back together and lower your hips .
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Core (Rectus Abdominis), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus)

Exercise: Resistance Band Hip Thrusts on Knees
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Kneel on the floor with a loop resistance band anchored at a low point behind you and wrapped around your hips. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
2. Sit back on your heels, ensuring the resistance band remains taut.
3. Thrust your hips forward, coming up onto your knees and squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you thrust your hips forward and inhale as you sit back on your heels.
2. Ensure the resistance band stays securely anchored behind you to maintain consistent tension.
3. Focus on engaging your glutes throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Core (Rectus Abdominis), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae)

Exercise: Resistance Band Kneeling Cross Body Single Straight Arm Supinated Pulldown
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the resistance band to a high anchor point in front of you, on your left side. Kneel on the floor on your right knee and your left foot flat on the floor, holding the handle with your right hand, palm facing up.
2. Extend your right arm straight opposite the left side of your head, keeping your arm straight.
3. Pull the handle down across your body towards your right hip until fully extended by your side and slowly return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the band down and inhale as you release it back up.
2. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arm for better engagement.
3. Ensure your hips stay square and stable, avoiding any twisting motion.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major, Rhomboids)

Exercise: Resistance Band Kneeling Cross Body Single Straight Arm Supinated Pulldown_Female
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the resistance band to a high anchor point in front of you, on your left side. Kneel on the floor on your right knee and your left foot flat on the floor, holding the handle with your right hand, palm facing up.
2. Extend your right arm straight opposite the left side of your head, keeping your arm straight.
3. Pull the handle down across your body towards your right hip until fully extended by your side and slowly return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the band down and inhale as you release it back up.
2. Focus on pulling with your back muscles rather than your arm for better engagement.
3. Ensure your hips stay square and stable, avoiding any twisting motion.
Primary Activating Muscles: Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major), Upper Back (Rhomboids)

Exercise: Resistance Band Kneeling Leg Half Circle
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Attach a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees.
2. Lift your right leg a few inches off the floor and extend it straight back.
3. Move your right leg in a half-circle motion inward over your left leg until it lightly touches the floor, keeping the resistance band taut.
4. Slowly return your right leg to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you move your leg in the half-circle motion and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
2. Keep your shoulders and hips squared to the floor.
3. Focus on engaging your glutes and hip abductors throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise: Resistance Band Kneeling Leg Half Circle on bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start in a tabletop position on a bench, with your hands holding the edges for support and your knees under your hips. Attach a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees.
2. Lift your right leg off the bench and extend it straight back, keeping it under bench level.
3. Move your right leg in a half-circle motion inward over your left leg until it comes in level with the bench, keeping the resistance band taut.
4. Slowly return your right leg to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you move your leg in the half-circle motion and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
2. Keep your shoulders and hips squared to the floor.
3. Focus on engaging your glutes and hip abductors throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and knees under your hips. Place a loop resistance band under your right foot and hold the other end on the floor with your right hand.
2. Kick your right leg backward until it's parallel to the floor, extending it fully while keeping the resistance band taut.
3. Slowly return your right leg to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended straight up towards the ceiling and a loop resistance band around your ankles. Place your arms by your sides on the floor for stability.
2. Engage your core and keep your legs straight and feet flexed.
3. Open your legs wide apart against the resistance of the band, keeping your legs straight and maintaining control.
4. Slowly bring your legs back together to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:

Exercise: Resistance Band Lying Bent Knee Hip Abduction
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet touching together, with a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Place your arms on the floor by your sides for stability.
2. Open your knees wide apart against the band's resistance, keeping your feet together and maintaining control.
3. Slowly bring your knees back together to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Use a resistance band with enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
2. Focus on engaging your hip abductors and glutes throughout the movement.
3. Keep your feet together and avoid lifting them off the floor.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae, Gluteus Medius)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Inner Thighs (Adductors)

Exercise: Resistance Band Lying Bent Knee Raise
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach the resistance loop band to a low anchor point and lie on your back with your knees bent and feet touching together. Wrap the other end of the loop resistance band over your feet. Place your arms on the floor by your sides.
2. Keep both legs straight and a few inches off the floor.
3. Slowly bend your knees and bring your legs up until your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and for a 90 degree. 
4. Straighten your legs to the starting position with control and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your abdominals throughout the movement.
2. Avoid lifting your lower back off the floor; keep it pressed down for the duration of the exercise.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knee if necessary to reduce strain.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie face down on the floor with your arms crossed under your head, resting your forehead on your arms. Place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Keep your legs extended and feet together.
2. Engage your core and glutes to lift your legs straight off the floor while resting your head on your arms.
3. While lifting your legs, spread them wide apart against the band's resistance, keeping your legs straight.
4. Slowly bring your legs back together while lowering them to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your glutes and hip abductors throughout the movement.
2. Exhale as you lift and open your legs, and inhale as you bring them back together and lower them.
3. Keep your core engaged throughout the exercise to maintain stability and protect your lower back.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae, Gluteus Medius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your arms by your sides and a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Keep your legs extended and together.
2. Engage your core to lift your right leg straight up towards the ceiling, keeping the resistance band taut and your left leg flat on the floor.
3. Slowly lower your leg back down with control, stopping just before your heel touches the floor.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to lifting your left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your abdominals throughout the movement.
2. Avoid lifting your lower back off the floor; keep it pressed down for the duration of the exercise.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knee if necessary to reduce strain.

Exercise: Resistance Band One Leg Glute Bridge
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Place a loop resistance band around your right thigh, just above your knee, and loop it under your right forefoot.
2. Press through your right heel to lift your hips towards the ceiling, forming a straight line from your shoulders to your knees, while keeping your left leg bent off the floor.
3. Hold the bridge position for a second, then slowly lower your hips back to the starting position with control. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your glutes and hamstrings throughout the movement.
2. Exhale as you lift your hips and inhale as you lower them back down.
3. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise: Resistance Band One Leg Kickback (Bent Position)
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Start standing with a loop resistance band around your ankles. Bend forward at your hips, keeping your back straight, and place your hands on an incline bench's top edge for support.
2. Engage your glutes and lift your right leg off the floor, reaching as high as possible while keeping it straight.
3. Slowly return your right leg to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you kick your leg back and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
2. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
3. Keep your upper body straight and avoid rounding your back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a loop resistance band with both hands. Your arms should be extended straight in front of you at shoulder height, and your palms should be facing down.
2. Pull the resistance band apart by moving your arms out to your sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together, and keeping your arms straight.
3. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control, maintaining tension in the band. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your arms straight throughout the exercise, maintaining a slight bend in your elbows.
2. Maintain a neutral wrist position to prevent strain.
3. Focus on engaging your upper back and shoulder muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise: Resistance Band Reverse Hyper with Stability Ball on Flat Bench
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place a flat bench in front of you and lie face down on the bench with your hips on the edge and your legs extended straight behind you. Place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees, and a stability ball between your feet.
2. Grip the sides of the bench for stability and ensure the stability ball is secure between your feet.
3. Engage your core and glutes, then lift your legs upward, squeezing your glutes and keeping your legs straight.
4. Slowly lower your legs back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep a firm grip on the sides of the bench to maintain stability.
2. Focus on lifting with your glutes and not using momentum.
3. Maintain a steady breathing rhythm, exhaling as you lift and inhaling as you lower your legs.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Abdominals (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise: Resistance Band Seated Bent Knee Abduction
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs bent at a 90-degree angle and your feet flat on the floor. Place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees.
2. Engage your core, lean slightly back, and place your hands on the floor behind you for support.
3. Press your knees outward against the resistance of the band, spreading your legs as wide as possible while keeping your feet flat on the floor.
4. Slowly bring your knees back together to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press your knees outward and inhale as you bring them back together.
2. Keep your feet flat on the floor and avoid lifting them off the floor.
3. Focus on engaging your hip abductors and glutes throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae, Gluteus Medius)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach one end of a resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at a high height. Stand with your left side facing the anchor point, holding the other end of the band with your right hand.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Extend your right arm straight out to the side parallel to the floor, palm facing down.
3. Pull the band towards your body, bringing your right hand close to your hip, keeping your arm straight.
4. Slowly return your right arm to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left side.
Exercise Tips:

2. Exhale as you pull the band across your body and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.

Exercise: Resistance Band Side Plank Glute Raise
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Begin by lying on your left side with your legs bent at 90 degrees and stacked on top of each other.
2. Prop yourself up on your left forearm, ensuring your elbow is directly under your shoulder. Engage your core and lift your hips slightly off the floor.
3. Keeping your legs bent, lift your top leg upwards against the resistance of the band while also raising your hips until your torso is parallel to the floor, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly lower your leg and hips back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your glutes and hip abductors throughout the movement.
2. Exhale as you lift your leg and hip, and inhale as you lower it back down.
3. Maintain a steady pace to ensure consistent tension in the muscles.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Core (Obliques, Rectus Abdominis), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if you are sitting in a chair.
3. Push through your heels to stand back up to the starting position, keeping the resistance band taut.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Keep your chest up and bring both hands close to your chest.
2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if you are sitting in a chair.
3. Explosively jump up by pushing through your heels extending your legs fully and reaching your arms upward.
4. Land softly back into the squat position, absorbing the impact through your legs. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Land softly with your knees slightly bent to reduce impact on your joints.
2. Perform the movement with control, especially when landing, to maximize muscle activation and reduce injury risk.
3. Exhale as you jump up and inhale as you lower into the squat.
Primary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Hip Abductors (Tensor Fasciae Latae), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):

2. Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and pushing your hips back as if you are sitting in a chair.

4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:

Exercise: Resistance Band Standing Balance Glute Kickback
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a loop resistance band around your ankles. Place your hands on your hips for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto your right leg and lift your left foot slightly off the floor.
3. Keeping your right leg straight, kick it back and upward against the band's resistance, squeezing your glutes at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return your left leg to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the right leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a slight bend in your standing leg for balance.
2. Exhale as you kick your leg back and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
3. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise: Resistance Band Standing Balance Hip Abduction
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Place your hands on your hips for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto your right leg and lift your left foot slightly off the floor.
3. Keeping your left leg straight, lift it to the side against the band's resistance, squeezing your hip abductors at the top of the movement.
4. Slowly return your leg to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the right leg.

3. Keep your upper body straight and avoid leaning to the side.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a loop resistance band around your wrists. Keep your elbows bent at 90 degrees and close to your sides, with your forearms parallel to the floor and pointing forward.
2. Rotate your shoulders outwards by pulling the resistance band apart while keeping your elbows fixed at your sides.
3. Slowly return your forearms to the starting position with control, maintaining tension in the band. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce shoulder injury risk.
2. Exhale as you rotate your forearms outward and inhale as you return them to the starting position.
3. Keep your elbows fixed at your sides to ensure proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a loop resistance band around your thighs, just above your knees. Bend your hips and knees to lower into a half-squat position, and lean your back slightly forward, keeping your back straight.
2. Press your knees outward against the band's resistance, opening your legs as wide as possible.
3. Slowly bring your knees back together to the starting position with control, keeping tension in the band.
4. Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining the half squat position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you press your knees outward and inhale as you bring them back together.
2. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
3. Ensure your feet remain flat on the floor and your weight is evenly distributed.
Primary Activating Muscles: Hip Abductors (Gluteus Medius, Tensor Fasciae Latae)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris)

Exercise: Resistance Band Standing Single Arm Shoulder Extension
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach one end of a resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at hips height. Stand facing the anchor point and hold the other end of the band in your right hand.
2. Extend your right arm up, pointing to the anchor point, with your palm facing down.
3. Pull the band backward, keeping your arm straight, and until it reaches parallel to your side.
4. Slowly return your arm to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your shoulder and upper back muscles throughout the movement.
2. Keep your elbow slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Ensure the resistance band stays taut throughout the exercise.
Primary Activating Muscles: Shoulders (Deltoids), Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Middle Back (Latissimus Dorsi, Teres Major)

Exercise: Resistance Band Standing Single Arm Shoulder Flexion
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Attach one end of a resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at hips height. Stand with your back facing the anchor point and hold the other end of the band in your right hand.
2. Extend your right arm back, pointing to the anchor point, with your palm facing forward.
3. Pull the band forward, keeping your arm straight, and until it reaches your lower chest height.
4. Slowly return your arm to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left arm.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on engaging your shoulder and upper back muscles throughout the movement.
2. Keep your elbow slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Ensure the resistance band stays taut throughout the exercise.

Exercise: Resistance Band Upper Body Dead Bug
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie flat on your back with your knees bent at a 90-degree angle, knees right above your hips. Attach two loop resistance bands at a low point, extending behind you. 
2. Hold the end of each band in each hand, keeping your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling.
3. Lower your right leg towards the floor while keeping your left leg and arms in the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg, alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you lower your leg and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
2. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor to avoid strain.
3. Focus on engaging your core muscles throughout the movement.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise: Resistance Band Upper Body Dead Bug_Female

2. Hold the end of each band in each hand, keeping your arms extended straight up towards the ceiling.
3. Lower your right leg towards the floor while keeping your left leg and arms in the starting position.
4. Repeat the movement with your left leg, alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Secure the middle of the resistance band to a sturdy anchor point at head height. Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding one handle of the band in each hand with your arms extended straight in front of you, palms facing down.
2. Pull the handles towards your face, bending your elbows and flaring them out to the sides until your hands are at your face sides.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement, keeping your upper arms parallel to the floor.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position with control, maintaining tension in the band. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure the resistance band is securely anchored to avoid slipping.
2. Exhale as you pull the band towards your face and inhale as you return to the starting position.
3. Maintain a slight bend in your knees for better balance and support.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands on the floor, arms straight, and the ab roller set under your feet. Your legs should be straight back, forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core and slowly roll the ab roller towards your hands, keeping your legs straight. Continue rolling until your thighs are vertical to the floor.
3. Hold the position briefly, ensuring your core is tight and your back is straight.
4. Roll the ab roller back to the starting position with control, maintaining a straight line with your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you roll the roller towards your hands and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
2. Avoid arching your back; maintain a neutral spine to prevent strain on your lower back.
3. Start with a small range of motion if you are new to this exercise, gradually increasing the distance as you build strength.
4. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands on the floor, arms straight, and the ab roller set under your feet. Your legs should be straight back, forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core and slowly roll the ab roller towards your hands, keeping your legs straight. Continue rolling until your thighs are vertical to the floor.
3. Hold the position briefly, ensuring your core is tight and your back is straight.
4. Roll the ab roller back to the starting position with control, maintaining a straight line with your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you roll the roller towards your hands and inhaling as you return to the starting position.
2. Avoid arching your back; maintain a neutral spine to prevent strain on your lower back.
3. Start with a small range of motion if you are new to this exercise, gradually increasing the distance as you build strength.
4. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand in the center of a cable crossover machine with the pulleys set at shoulder height. Grasp the left handle with your right hand and the right handle with your left hand, crossing the cables in front of you and palms facing the floor.
2. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and keep your back straight. Extend your arms straight in front of you at chest height, palms facing down.
3. Pull the handles outwards and backward in a reverse fly motion, keeping your arms straight, until both arms are fully extended to your sides.
4. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles outward and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Keep your elbows slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Focus on engaging your upper back and shoulder muscles throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids, Trapezius), Rear Shoulders (Posterior Deltoids)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Rotator Cuff (Supraspinatus, Infraspinatus, Teres Minor, Subscapularis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your arms by your sides with palms facing down for stability.
2. Lift your legs off the floor, bending your knees at a 90-degree angle so that your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and your calves are parallel to the floor.
3. Engage your core and lift your hips off the floor, curling your knees towards your chest. Focus on using your abdominal muscles to lift your hips.
4. Slowly lower your hips back to the starting position, keeping your knees bent at a 90-degree angle. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift your hips; focus on using your abdominal muscles.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your hips and inhaling as you lower them back down.
3. Keep your head and shoulders relaxed on the floor to avoid straining your neck.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your arms by your sides with palms facing down for stability.
2. Lift your legs off the floor, bending your knees at a 90-degree angle so that your thighs are perpendicular to the floor and your calves are parallel to the floor.
3. Extend your legs straight out in front of you, keeping them off the floor to perform a kick-out.
4. Bend your knees back to the starting position and engage your core to lift your hips off the floor, curling your knees towards your chest. Lower your hips back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid using momentum to lift your hips; focus on using your abdominal muscles.
2. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and reduce discomfort.
3. Keep your head and shoulders relaxed on the floor to avoid straining your neck.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your feet flat on the floor and knees secured under the pads. Grasp the bar with an underhand grip (palms facing you) at shoulder-width apart, arms fully extended above you.
2. Engage your core and keep your back straight. Lean back slightly to create a natural arch in your lower back.
3. Pull the bar towards your upper chest, bringing your elbows down to your sides while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly return the bar to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the bar down and inhale as you return it to the starting position.
2. Avoid using momentum or swinging your body to lift the weight.
3. Keep your wrists straight and avoid letting them bend backward.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the middle of a resistance band under both feet. Hold one handle in each hand with an overhand grip (palms facing down), arms fully extended by your sides.
2. Simultaneously curl both handles upward towards your shoulders by bending your elbows and squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Slowly lower the handles back to the starting position with control, fully extending your arms. 
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl the handles upward and inhale as you lower them back down.
2. Use a resistance band that provides enough tension to challenge your muscles without compromising form.
3. Maintain a steady pace to ensure consistent tension on the muscles.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the middle of a resistance band under your right foot. Hold one handle in each hand with your arms bent and hands close to your face sides.
2. Step your left foot back into a lunge position, lowering your left knee towards the floor while keeping your right knee over your ankle.
3. Push through your right heel to return to the starting position, bringing your foot forward to stand up straight.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions, then switch to the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you push through your heel to stand up and inhale as you lower into the lunge.
2. Keep your front knee aligned with your toes to avoid unnecessary strain.
3. Focus on engaging your glutes and quadriceps throughout the movement.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus), Core (Rectus Abdominis)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a stool with your back straight, knees bent, and feet on the floor.
2. Extend your arms forward and grab the handles of the machine with your palms facing down.
3. Pull the handles by opening your arms wide to your sides.
4. As your arms are aligned with the shoulders, return to the initial position and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you pull the handles outward and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Keep your elbows slightly bent to reduce strain on your joints.
3. Focus on engaging your upper back and shoulder muscles throughout the movement.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand upright with your feet shoulder-width apart, facing away from a hip-level box or surface.
2. Place your hands on the box behind you with your arms straight, palms down.
3. Slowly bend your knees to lower your body, keeping your arms straight and allowing your shoulders to stretch as you lower yourself.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your shoulders and chest. Slowly straighten your legs to return to the starting position.
Exercise Tips:
1. Perform the stretch on a stable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and prevent slipping.
2. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears to maximize the stretch.
3. Ensure your hands are securely positioned on the box to prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a standing position with your feet hip-width apart.
2. Step your right foot slightly forward, keeping it straight. Lightly bend your left knee.
3. Lower your torso and arms towards your right foot, reaching down with your hands while keeping your back straight.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right hamstring. Slowly return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your front knee remains straight but not locked to maximize the hamstring stretch.
2. Keep your back leg slightly bent and your heel on the floor to deepen the calf stretch.
3. Perform the stretch on a stable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart, your arms relaxed by your sides, and your core engaged. Maintain an upright posture.
2. Begin running by taking quick, powerful strides, lifting your knees higher than jogging.
3. Swing your arms naturally with each step, keeping them bent at a 90-degree angle.
4. Maintain a steady, comfortable pace and continue running for the desired duration or distance.
Exercise Tips:
1. Stay hydrated and take breaks, especially during longer runs.
2. Breathe steadily and rhythmically to maintain oxygen flow during the run.
3. Focus on maintaining a relaxed posture and avoid tensing your shoulders.
Primary Activating Muscles: Quadriceps (Quadriceps Femoris), Hamstrings (Biceps Femoris, Semitendinosus, Semimembranosus), Calves (Gastrocnemius, Soleus)
Secondary Activating Muscles: Glutes (gluteus maximus, gluteus mideus), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Core (Rectus Abdominis, Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lean back slightly so that your torso forms a V-shape with your thighs.
2. Clasp your hands together in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing your hands opposite your right hip.
4. Rotate back through the center and to the left, bringing your hands opposite your left hip. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Move your torso, not just your arms, to ensure you are engaging your oblique muscles.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you rotate to each side and inhaling as you return to the center.
3. Keep your back straight and avoid hunching your shoulders to maintain proper form.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your knees bent and feet flat. Hold a weighted ball with both hands, keeping it opposite to your chest with straight arms.
2. Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, bringing the weighted ball towards the floor beside your hip.
4. Rotate your torso to the left, moving the weighted ball towards the floor beside your left hip. Repeat the twisting motion for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Engage your core throughout the movement to maintain balance and stability.
2. Ensure your movements are smooth and controlled to maximize core engagement.
3. Focus on twisting from your torso, not just moving your arms side to side.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Shoulders (Deltoids), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Begin in a plank position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Keep your feet hip-width apart.
2. Without bending your elbows, squeeze your shoulder blades together, allowing your chest to lower slightly towards the floor. 
3. Push your shoulder blades apart, rounding your upper back slightly and lifting your chest away from the floor. 
4. Continue to alternate between the retraction and protraction phases for the desired number of repetitions, maintaining a steady and controlled movement.
Exercise Tips:
1. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you protract and inhaling as you retract your shoulder blades.
2. Maintain a straight body line, avoiding any sagging or arching of the back.
3. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and prevent slipping.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Lie on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides, palms facing down.
2. Lift both legs off the floor a few inches, keeping them straight.
3. Alternately cross your legs over each other in a scissor-like motion. Move your right leg over your left leg and then switch, bringing your left leg over your right leg.
4. Continue alternating legs in a controlled manner for the desired number of repetitions or duration.
Exercise Tips:
1. Ensure your lower back remains pressed against the floor to avoid strain and maintain proper form.
2. Move your legs slowly and with control to maximize muscle engagement and prevent injury.
3. Perform the exercise on a comfortable, non-slip surface to ensure safety and reduce discomfort.
4. Avoid letting your legs drop too low, which could increase strain on your lower back.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques), Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas)

Exercise: Seated cable row V bar machine
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the cable row machine with your feet secure on the foot platform. Grasp the V bar with both hands.
2. Sit upright with your back straight, extending your arms fully in front of you.
3. Pull the V bar towards your abdomen by bringing your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight throughout the exercise to avoid strain.
2. Engage your core to maintain stability and proper posture.
3. Perform the movement slowly and with control to maximize muscle activation and reduce the risk of injury.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Upper Back (Rhomboids), Shoulders (Deltoids), Biceps (Biceps Brachii), Lower Back (Erector Spinae)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the calf raise machine with your forefeet positioned on the foot platform and your knees secured under the padded lever.
2. Hold the handles with both hands and allow your heels to lower as far as possible, fully stretching your calves.
3. Press through your forefeet to lift your heels as high as possible, then slowly lower your heels back to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and torso still throughout the exercise.
2. Maintain tension in the calves from start to finish.
3. Lower your heels slowly to emphasize the eccentric portion of the lift.

Exercise: Seated calf raises dumbbell on knee
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your forefeet on the edge of a plate, close together, allowing your heels to hang off. Place a dumbbell on both knees, holding them securely with your hands.
2. Raise your heels as high as possible, pushing through your forefeet and lifting the dumbbells.
3. Lower your heels back down to the starting position in a controlled manner. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the left leg and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on using your calf muscles to lift and lower your heel.
2. Keep the movement slow and controlled to maximize muscle engagement.
3. Avoid bouncing or using momentum to lift the weight.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you. Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
2. Extend your right foot while lightly bending the left knee, reaching forward to grasp your toes with both hands.
3. Gently pull your toes towards you, feeling the stretch in your calf muscle.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then slowly release. Repeat on the left leg.
Exercise Tips:
1. Focus on maintaining a straight back to enhance the effectiveness of the stretch.
2. Ensure your movements are slow and controlled to prevent overstretching or injury.
3. If you find it difficult to reach your toes, use a towel or strap for assistance without forcing the stretch.
4. Keep your shoulders relaxed and away from your ears to prevent unnecessary tension.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you.
2. Bend your right knee and cross your right leg over your left thigh and lightly bend your left knee placing your left foot flat on the floor.
3. Keeping your back straight, lower your chest towards your crossed leg, reaching your hands stright to the floor to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, feeling the stretch in your right glute. Slowly release and return to the starting position. Repeat on the left side.
Exercise Tips:
1. Maintain a straight back as you lower your chest to enhance the effectiveness of the stretch.
2. Move slowly and with control to prevent any sudden movements that could cause strain.
3. Ensure your bent knees remains stable and aligned with your body to avoid placing excess strain on the knee joints.

Exercise: Seated dumbbell one arm shoulder press
Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in your right hand at shoulder height, palm facing forward. Keep your back straight and feet flat on the floor.
2. Press the dumbbell upward until your arm is fully extended overhead, keeping your wrist straight.
3. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height with control.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to your left arm and repeat.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid arching your back; keep it pressed against the backrest of the bench.
2. Move the dumbbell in a straight line to maximize muscle engagement.
3. Exhale as you press the dumbbell up and inhale as you lower it.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the edge of a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a dumbbell in each hand. Lean forward at your hips until your chest is close to your thighs, letting your arms hang down towards the floor with palms facing each other.
2. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise the dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position in a controlled manner.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders.
2. Exhale as you lift the dumbbells and inhale as you lower them.
3. Avoid swinging the weights or using momentum to lift the dumbbells.

Exercise: seated elbow in alternating dumbbell overhead pres
Seated Figure Four With Twist Glute Stretch
Seated Figure Four With Twist Glute Stretch_Female

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight out in front of you, forming an L-shape with your torso.
2. Place your hands behind your head without pulling on your neck, elbows facing outwards.
3. Engage your core and bend your torso towards your thighs, performing a crunch while keeping your legs straight.
4. Bring your torso back to the starting position with control. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid pulling on your neck with your hands; use your abdominal muscles to lower your torso.
2. Breathe steadily, exhaling as you lift your torso and inhaling as you lower it back down.
3. Keep your legs straight and flat on the floor to maintain stability during the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on a bench with your legs extended straight out in front of you. Lean back slightly, supporting yourself by gripping the sides of the bench.
2. Lift both legs off the bench a few inches, keeping them straight.
3. Begin the flutter kicks by alternately raising and lowering your legs in a scissor-like motion, moving your right leg up while your left leg moves down and vice versa.
4. Continue the flutter kicks for the desired number of repetitions or duration, keeping your core engaged and your movements controlled.
Exercise Tips:
1. Keep your back straight and avoid rounding your shoulders to maintain proper form.
2. Perform the exercise on a stable, non-slip bench to ensure safety and prevent slipping.
3. If you are new to this exercise, start with a smaller range of motion and gradually increase it as you build strength.
Secondary Activating Muscles: Hip Flexors (Iliopsoas), Obliques (External Obliques, Internal Obliques)

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit down on the hip abduction machine and place your feet flat on the footrests while positioning your outer thighs against the padded levers.
2. Grip the side handles to stabilize your upper body and press your legs outward against the resistance, pushing the pads apart in a controlled motion.
3. Pause for a second at the peak of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Sit upright with your back firmly against the backrest to maintain proper posture.
2. Focus on squeezing your glutes and outer thighs throughout the movement.
3. Perform the movement slowly and avoid using momentum to push the legs outward.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your legs fully extended. Adjust the backrest and leg pads so the pad rests just above your heels.
2. Pull your heels down by bending your knees until the pad reaches down as far as possible.
3. Pause for a second, then slowly return to the starting position. 
4. Repeat for the desired repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Exhale as you curl and inhale as you return to the starting position.
2. Do not let the weight stack drop; control the descent movement for maximum muscle activation.
3. Keep your toes pointed forward throughout the exercise.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg extension machine. Position both feet under the padded lever, with the lever resting just above your ankles.
2. Grip the handles on the sides of the machine for support. Engage your core and keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest.
3. Extend your right leg by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knee, then slowly lower the lever to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg extension machine. Position both feet under the padded lever, with the lever resting just above your ankles.
2. Grip the handles on the sides of the machine for support. Engage your core and keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest.
3. Extend your right leg by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knee, then slowly lower the lever to the starting position.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

Exercise Instructions (step by step):
1. Sit on the leg extension machine. Position both feet under the padded lever, with the lever resting just above your ankles.
2. Grip the handles on the sides of the machine for support. Engage your core and keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest.
3. Extend your right leg by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knee, then slowly lower the lever to the starting position.
4. Immediately repeat the movement with your left leg. Alternate between right and left legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Exercise Tips:
1. Avoid locking your knees at the top of the movement to reduce strain on your joints.
2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.

3. Extend your right leg by pushing the padded lever upward, straightening your knee, then slowly lower the lever to the starting position.

2. Keep your back pressed firmly against the backrest to maintain proper form.
3. Exhale as you extend your legs and inhale as you lower them back down.
